3:45.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; Overall 7.0; Home straight: Far 7.0, Centre 7.1, Stands' 6.9)

runners.name: Rebels Romance
runners.comment: High class; big question is the trip as this 7yo is unraced beyond 1m4f
runners.spotlight: High-class 1m4f performer with a fine strike-rate and he's been all around the world; big question is the trip as this 7yo is unraced beyond 1m4f and takes on proven stayers, but he stays that shorter trip well.

quotes.race: Longines Dubai Sheema Classic (Group 1) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Rebel's Romance ran well, he ran a super race. We were happy to take the lead down the back and the pace slackened but he was running against fresher legs. Naturally it's impossible for horses to retain all of their abilities as they get older and he's not getting any younger - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: H H The Amir Trophy (Group 3) (4yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Rebel's Romance is a horse of a lifetime. He's a seven-year-old now and it's a great training performance by Charlie [Appleby] and the team to have him in this condition. He retains all his enthusiasm, wears his heart on his sleeve and always turns up. From a jockey's point of view, he's pretty bombproof. I always think he makes his own luck and he doesn't have to make the running; he can sit off the pace. He wasn't in love with the track today but he's still won as he's a class horse. Hopefully, that's another launchpad to Dubai and the Sheema Classic - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: Longines Breeders' Cup Turf (Grade 1) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Rebel's Romance is an incredible horse. He's such a joy to ride and a beautiful horse who has been expertly managed by Charlie Appleby and the team. He's an international superstar. We agreed to give him a positive ride but we managed to get a breather in. He kicked from the turn and, when the competition came, he went again - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: Mehl-Mulhens-Stiftung - 62nd Preis von Europa (Group 1) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Rebel's Romance is winning the race for a second time and he's a real international superstar. Today he showed what a tough horse he is and whenever we come to Germany we respect the local horses as it's never easy. The pace was pretty slow today and he's a horse who gets into a comfort zone. He's a high-class horse and he knows how to win - he always finds a way. He's a great horse - William Buick, rider.

quotes.race: Standard Chartered Champions & Chater Cup (Group 1) (3yo+) (Course A) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Rebel's Romance has done it really well. You always respect the local horses in Hong Kong, and he had to travel over here too, so the team have done a great job with him. I thought he looked magnificent beforehand, he always does. The race went the way I hoped it would and it suited him, that sort of even gallop the whole way that kept building up. He's become a very uncomplicated horse and he's a real international superstar - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: Longines Dubai Sheema Classic (Group 1) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Rebel's Romance showed in Qatar what a versatile horse he is. His best form has usually been when he's held up but in Qatar I tried something new. I was keen today to adopt a similar tactic and I got a lovely slipstream from the leader - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: H H The Amir Trophy (Group 3) (4yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I managed to get things my own way and Rebel's Romance enjoyed it. When he got to the front he wasn't going to get caught. He was very good and really showed up. He's a Breeders' Cup winner and went through that season almost unbeaten. He looked great beforehand and the concern we had was his draw in ten, but Charlie was keen to go forward and he got to the front easily and relaxed - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: Longines Dubai Sheema Classic (Group 1) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I just didn't have any luck from the gate. Rebel's Romance is still a very good horse - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: Longines Breeders' Cup Turf (Grade 1) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Rebel's Romance has turned himself round to be fair - probably telling me to switch him to the turf. Saying that, I watched him training on the dirt two days ago and said to the team I wish I was running him on the dirt - he loved it. He's a lovely big horse and time has helped him. He's another son of Dubawi and what more can I say about him as a stallion? - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

quotes.race: 60th Preis von Europa - prasentiert von DZ Privatbank (Group 1) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Rebel's Romance was nice and relaxed. He showed in Hoppegarten last time that he has a turn of foot and it's a long straight here. He's a better horse on faster ground but he did it well - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: Westminster 132nd Grosser Preis von Berlin (Group 1) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Rebel's Romance has a nice progressive profile and we've probably been running him on the wrong surface for so many years! Now we've switched him to turf he's three from three and he seems to be enjoying it - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

quotes.race: L'Ormarins Queen's Plate Glorious Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: William (Buick) was delighted with Rebel's Romance. He said he was a classy professional in the race and has seen it out well. It could have ideally done with being a little bit faster for him, but he said that once he got rolling he has picked up and done it nicely. That's only his second run on turf. He won the UAE Derby and we sort of went down that route this year thinking that might be his way forward. It didn't quite work out, so Charlie brought him back to the turf last time at Newmarket and it seems to have gone well. I spoke to Charlie (Appleby) and he said that (today) was the target, he has seen that out well so there is the possibility of stepping up to 1m6f - Alex Merriam, trainer's assistant.

quotes.race: House Of Cavani Menswear Fred Archer Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Rebel's Romance trains on turf at home and he has been here before and had a spin on this track and went well. I don't think anyone was really that worried about him running on turf as the ground is nice and fast and it suited him. It was a real nice good staying performance - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: UAE Derby Sponsored By Emirates NBD (Group 2) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: I was a little bit worried I was getting there a little early; a little too quick, but that was some performance. Rebel's Romance has really come on and he's a big horse, but he's still a shell. He really knows how to use his power now - William Buick, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He could finish only eighth on his first run at the carnival but will come forward for that, having been off the track for 300 days. It may not have been the strongest company, but races like that on the dirt are rough and ready and they were hardened horses he came up against, so it was always a bit of a concern that he lacked that kind of experience. He's still learning on the job and there are positives to take out of the run, so we'll look to the Listed Curlin Stakes for his next start. 26-01-22

runners.name: Sweet William
runners.comment: C&D second in the 2023 Ebor but it may provide an insufficient stamina test nowadays
runners.spotlight: Headgear and Rab Havlin for all starts; not a straightforward ride but he's only once failed to give his running (final start 2023) and took well to the visor last season, in which two wins included the 2m2f Doncaster Cup in good style; tries this trip for the first time since his C&D second in the 2023 Ebor and it may provide an insufficient stamina test nowadays.

quotes.race: Qipco British Champions Long Distance Cup (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Sweet William and Trawlerman both ran well. They controlled the pace upfront, both of Aidan's horses. The fractions were pretty steady and then they gradually increased and kicked off the bend. Ours would probably have preferred a stronger, even pace. They've run exceptionally well but Kyprios has a gear more than the rest. I'd have thought we'd come back with both of them next year. They're lovely horses. They both have great enthusiasm for it still and these long-distance horses make it fun - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Betfred Howard Wright Doncaster Cup Stakes (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: We've been mucking about with different things and Sweet William seems to be really enjoying it at the minute. We had a visor on and we made the slits slightly bigger so he could see a little bit - just changing things and keeping him interested. He never lets you down but it's nice when he asserts himself like that. He's deserved a big one. He's been in the first three in some top race races - Robert Havlin, rider.

quotes.race: Gold Cup (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Sweet William has had seven screws in his leg so what a courageous horse. That's why we love him and he's a character. He was box-rested for four months when he was two and he had a hell of a time. I never thought of him being a racehorse, I just wanted him to live. He's the most beautiful horse I've bred and he's named after my son. It's wonderful to be third in a Group 1 and my children don't come racing very often so for them both to run well is wonderful - Philippa Cooper.

quotes.race: Chasemore Farm Henry II Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: It was Philippa's [Cooper, owner] idea to put the visor on Sweet William. We put full-cup blinkers on him last year and he never travelled a yard. He didn't really travel today, to be honest, but the further he went, the better he went. He'll definitely stay two and a half miles and he'll go to Ascot now. He's had a good blow today. He's only run over further than two miles once at Doncaster and it wasn't a test because it turned into a three-furlong sprint. It worked out the way I thought it would in my head. I thought I would let Rossa [Ryan] on Caius Chorister lead me this time because he pounced on me last time. I was able to play with him a little bit up the straight - Rab Havlin, jockey.

quotes.race: Coral Summer Handicap
quotes.quote: Sweet William is becoming more straightforward. He has been a lot of fun to train and it was a long time until he could race for various reasons. He does have a strong view on life and it is not necessarily where you want him to go! He is getting the idea of it well now. The York Ebor meeting might nearly be my favourite meeting of the year, but we have got to get in the race, that's the thing, it will be touch and go. If not, he is a horse who might one day step up the ladder to Cup races - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Mettal UK Handicap
quotes.quote: We'll take it one race at a time but I think Sweet William would need another penalty to get into the Ebor, and these big handicaps aren't my bag to be honest, but John and Thady Gosden have helped so much with this horse's journey and they will decide - Philippa Cooper, owner/breeder.

runners.name: Alsakib
runners.comment: Won C&D Group 3 last July; disappointed after and was gelded; probably needs a career best
runners.spotlight: Kept finding to get on top late on in a C&D Group 3 (good to soft; acts on acts on good to firm) last July but he disappointed on both subsequent starts and has since been gelded; probably needs a career best.

quotes.race: John Smith's Silver Cup Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: When you get a chance to get on these horses you have to be so grateful and hopefully I can make hay now. Alsakib tested me a bit today, but we knew he'd enjoy the ground and would stay - PJ McDonald, jockey.

quotes.race: bet365 Old Rowley Cup Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Alsakib is a lovely horse who stays the trip well. I don't think he'll run again this season here. The owners wanted him to run in the Qatar Derby, which is over ten furlongs, and that's always been the plan in having him here with me. If he comes back after that then he has a lot of possibilities - Andrew Balding, trainer.

runners.name: Continuous
runners.owner: D Smith, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, Westerberg
runners.comment: 2023 was his heyday and he now sports first-time headgear; still smart though
runners.spotlight: Great Voltigeur winner on good to firm here in 2023, immediately preceding his victory in the St Leger and fifth in the Arc; he's not managed the same form since, stepping back up from 1m4f this term, but still showed enough to warrant respect in this field and today he sports first-time headgear.

quotes.race: Longines Red Sea Turf Handicap (Group 2) (3yo+) (Inner Track) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Continuous ran very well. It was his first run back, so happy with him - Ryan Moore, jockey.

quotes.race: Shoda Market Cafe Royal Whip Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Continuous has loads of options. He could go to the Irish Champion Stakes or the Irish St Leger. He could run in the Irish Champion with a view to going to the Arc. He could go to the Japan Cup He is a very versatile horse and a great one to have. Dropping him back to this trip was not a worry. We decided we would take a lead today if we could. He could have popped out in front and done it all himself. He's a classy horse and an unusual type of horse and a very genuine horse. He can do it from 1m2f and possibly up to 2m - Aidan O'Brien, trainer

quotes.race: Qatar Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe (Group 1) (3yo+ No Geldings) (Grande) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I was very happy. We made the decision to take our time and relax, and Continuous dropped in lovely. The pace was very slow so they sprinted in the last two or three furlongs. He was coming through, but obviously the winner quickened up on the outside. He's probably best over a strongly run mile and a half. He could go to Japan, Hong Kong, America or Dubai. All those things are open to him. He's a ready-made four-year-old and we think the best is yet to come - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfred St Leger Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: You would say looking at him at York, he was nailed on for this race and he had form on soft ground. Continuous didn't have any problem with the trip. He's got a lot of class, you could see it in his work every day. We're over the moon. The lads will think about the Arc, I'd say, he handles soft ground and gets a mile and a half very well and has class. He has all the things that could work in an Arc. It's just whether the two-week turnback is too tight or not. He has a great constitution as well - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Great Voltigeur Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Continuous came here in the Dante and he needed the run badly and ran a massive race. I said to Ryan before the race would any of the other horses have run as well in Dante as he did and he said they wouldn't. A little bit of class usually outs, especially if the pace is even. We thought he handles an ease very well because he has a little bit of a round action but that was fast ground today and he didn't seem to have any problem with it. He bends his knee but obviously that's his best performance so you have to say he's very comfortable on it. I asked Ryan and he said he doesn't need a mile and six but you wouldn't rule him out - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV For Just 12 Euro A Month At racingtv.com Now Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Continuous is still a baby. He seems to stay well and he quickened up quite well. He's in the Beresford Stakes and that's a possibility for him - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won the St Leger in 2023 and we've stepped him up in trip this year. He ran in the Dubai Gold Cup on Saturday but couldn't get into it from off the pace. 07-04-25

runners.name: Epic Poet
runners.comment: His revival has reached another level this year; not the form pick, but highly respected
runners.spotlight: His fortunes began to turn again last season and the revival has reached another level this year with his performances over 1m6f-2m at Meydan and Riyadh; on last two starts he finished ahead of Continuous, who admittedly gave weight on the first occasion; not the form pick but he's highly respected.

quotes.race: Longines Red Sea Turf Handicap (Group 2) (3yo+) (Inner Track) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Little bit hard luck but delighted with him. Epic Poet got locked in for a little bit up the straight but finished off really strongly. He's been invited to the World Cup meeting in Dubai so we'll look at that - David O'Meara, trainer.

quotes.race: Zoho (Conditions) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Epic Poet was a bit fresh tonight which isn't him. But the race panned out nicely and he got the job done. The plan will probably be to go to Saudi for the two-mile race [Red Sea Turf Handicap] - Daniel Tudhope, jockey.

quotes.race: Betfair Exchange Old Borough Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Epic Poet has been a good horse this year, he ran a cracker at Royal Ascot and obviously in the Ebor as well - he had a bad draw that day. He doesn't really help you - he's just so slow. The owners and David said try and get handy on him, but that's as handy as you can get because he takes a long time to warm up. He travels good, that's the main thing. We followed the right horse and he picked up well - Danny Tudhope, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He had a great winter, winning around half a million pounds in Dubai and Saudi. I like the sound of having a crack at the Yorkshire Cup next. You can chop and change his trip as he's quite versatile and gives himself a chance of staying by relaxing so well. He wants fast ground and we'll run him sparingly at home with a view to going abroad again next year. 14-04-25

3:13.race_name: Sky Bet Fillies' Stakes (Listed Race) (Registered As The Michael Seely Memorial Fillies' Stakes)
3:13.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; Overall 7.0; Home straight: Far 7.0, Centre 7.1, Stands' 6.9)

runners.name: Bermuda Longtail
runners.comment: 1l 2nd to Glittering Surf at Kempton; in good hands to continue to progress; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Made all at Kempton (7f, AW) last October on second start and returned with 1l second to Glittering Surf in fillies' conditions race there (1m, AW); in good hands to continue to progress and not ruled out on turf debut.

runners.name: Consecrated
runners.comment: Impressive on debut; this half-sister to connections' Sacred could have lots more to offer
runners.spotlight: Sent off the 5-2 favourite when comfortably making all on last month's debut at Newbury (7f, good); the third and fourth won next time, and this Coronation Stakes entry and half-sister to connections' Group 2 winner Sacred could have lots more to offer, especially now up to 1m (by Frankel).

quotes.race: Bridget "Confined" Maiden Fillies' Stakes (Newcomers' Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Consecrated is a beautifully bred filly and you hope they'd come out and do something like that. Cieren [Fallon, rider] couldn't pull her up and she's going to get further. We'll probably step her up to a mile next time, and we might look at the Listed Michael Seely at York - Maureen Haggas, trainer's assistant.

runners.name: Elsies Ruan
runners.comment: Disappointing on final 2yo run but not ruled out each-way in view of her previous promise
runners.spotlight: Won on debut here (7f, good to firm) last July and kept on for creditable third in Group 3 Sweet Solera Stakes at Newmarket (7f, good to firm) last August; disappointing in Group 2 May Hill at Doncaster (1m, good) on final 2yo run but not ruled out each-way in view of her previous promise.

quotes.race: Ire-Incentive, It Pays To Buy Irish EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Qualifier) (GBB/IRE Incentive)
quotes.quote: It was Elsie's Ruan's first run, but she's come from the breeze-ups. She was brilliant, she did everything I asked. She got a bit squeezed out at halfway and I've gone to follow Rossa [Ryan] down the outside and she's just took off. She's done that quite nicely - Joanna Mason, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: She won at York on her debut last July and then finished third at Newmarket in the Group 3 Sweet Solera Stakes. The aim is to return at York's Dante meeting in the mile Listed fillies' race. I'm really looking forward to her this year -she has done a bit of growing over the winter. 23-04-25

runners.name: Glittering Surf
runners.comment: Didn't look the finished article at Kempton when making it 2-2 and has star potential
runners.spotlight: Won easily on debut at Kempton (1m, AW) in December and made it 2-2 when coming from the back of the pack to beat Bermuda Longtail by 1l there (1m) in March in a fillies' conditions race; didn't look the finished article last time and this Coronation Stakes entry has star potential.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Extra Places/British EBF Fillies' Conditions Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The plan wasn't to drop back as far as she did, but I wanted Glittering Surf to have a little cover and learn the proper way to do things. Turning in they hadn't gone quick and I thought she'd do well to get involved, but what she did from the third-last furlong to the last furlong and a half, she's obviously pretty smart. She's still a bit green and she's a big girl, so all being well she'll go to York for the Michael Seely Stakes. That gives me a nice six weeks to let her blossom. There's plenty of stamina on the dam's side but at the moment we would be looking at a mile. We'll take our time, Peter [Winkworth, owner] didn't want to be tempted by putting her in the Guineas, so it's York and all being well a Coronation Stakes entry - Owen Burrows, trainer.

runners.name: Gulya
runners.comment: Coronation Stakes entry who was unlucky at Ascot recently; no surprise if she makes amends
runners.spotlight: With a clear run it's likely she would have won a warm fillies' novice at Ascot 16 days ago on her second start (1m, good to firm; beaten a short head); there can be optimism this Coronation Stakes entry will continue to progress for her top yard, and no surprise if she makes amends for last time.

stable_tour.quote: I love this filly and would like to run her in a fillies' novice over a mile at Ascot at the end of the month. I thought she was unlucky on her debut but she hit the line strong and the winner went on to win a Group 3 on her next start. Her work has always been good and I think she's potentially very smart. 11-04-25

runners.name: Kon Tiki
runners.comment: 2-2; others have achieved more but this well-bred filly could have more left in the tank
runners.spotlight: Won on debut at Wolverhampton (7f, AW) in December and followed up in Kempton novice (1m, AW) last month, with a subsequent Listed runner-up in second; others have achieved more but she's a half-sister to a Listed winner for connections and her dam won a Group 3, so could have more left in the tank.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Fillies' Stakes (Listed Race) (Registered As The Michael Seely Memorial Fillies' Stakes)
quotes.quote: I'm thrilled. Kon Tiki trained well all winter and I had her in the Guineas but we decided to come here because it was first time on turf, coming off the all-weather and I thought this was a nice start for her and allowed her to come in her coat.  Mr Harris likes them to go gradually up the staircase, there's no rush. So we'll head for the Sandringham, a Group 2 at Chantilly in June.  Then for me it would be the Falmouth - Jane Chapple-Hyam, trainer.

quotes.race: Free Bet With Unibet's Betbuilder Rebound Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: This was a competitive novice but we felt coming here gave us an extra week up our sleeve for the Guineas rather than running in the Nell Gwyn. I'm thrilled with the way Kon Tiki did and how she quickened up. As long as she comes out of this okay she will go for the Guineas - Jane Chapple-Hyam, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Royalty Bay
runners.comment: Near-miss in 7f Group 3 in France last July, but below par the next twice; back from break
runners.spotlight: Made it 2-3 with 6f novice win here last July before near-miss in 7f Group 3 in France; the step up to 1m could suit on reappearance but her 2yo campaign concluded with two below-par runs and others are more compelling.

quotes.race: William Hill Keep Your Raceday Positive Irish EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Royalty Bay carried a penalty, which is never easy, and won going away. She's got a very good attitude and we have her in the Lowther and a Listed race in France in two and a half weeks time. She's very likeable and puts her head down - John Quinn, joint trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We haven't made any firm decision about Ascot, but she's fine after her win at Ripon and she's a filly who'll be running in good races this season. She was a little green, learning on the job, and you'd hope there's improvement in her. She's a good mover and I imagine the better ground will be fine for her. 10-06-24

runners.name: Serving With Style
runners.comment: Runner-up in Group 2 Rockfel last September but on soft going; different ground today
runners.spotlight: Coronation Stakes entry who won last summer on first two starts (7f/1m, good to soft/soft) before seventh of nine in Group 2 May Hill (1m, good); runner-up in Group 2 Rockfel at Newmarket (7f, soft) next time and a case can be made on that form, but the forecast fast ground is a concern.

quotes.race: Racing TV Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: It was a nice performance and we're really pleased to be the first winner for Mohaather. I don't know how good a race it was but we thought Serving With Style might run reasonably well, based on what Karl [Burke, trainer] has said, and hopefully she can go on from there. Hopefully she's got a bright future - Oliver St Lawrence, owners' racing manager.

stable_tour.quote: I took a bit of a punt running her in the Rockfel but she likes cut in the ground and ran a blinder to finish second. She's wintered well and is working really nicely. If the ground came up slow she might run in a Guineas trial and, while I'm not saying she's a Group 1 filly, she's definitely a black-type one and it might be fun to run her in something like the German 1,000 Guineas. 11-04-25

runners.name: The Third Star
runners.comment: Won Southwell maiden then second in Yarmouth novice; something to find now up in grade
runners.spotlight: Won in good style at 25-1 at Southwell (7f, AW) last month on second start and again ran well when second in Yarmouth novice (7f, good to firm) last time; can win more races but has something to find now up in grade.

runners.name: Troia
runners.comment: 2-3; improvement needed but she looks a good prospect for 1m and trainer won this in 2021
runners.spotlight: Three starts, winning a Newbury maiden (6f, good) and a Catterick novice (7f, good to firm) with a 5l fourth in the Group 2 Oh So Sharp Stakes at Newmarket (7f, good to soft) in between; improvement is needed but she looks a good prospect for 1m and her trainer won this in 2021; not discounted.

stable_tour.quote: She did very little wrong last year. We were going to run her in the Fred Darling but decided to wait and take a more gradual approach with her. She's inexperienced, so she'll probably start in a novice with a penalty. She ran well in the Oh So Sharp Stakes and needs 1m. 16-04-25

2:10.race_name: Clipper EBF Marygate Fillies' Stakes (Listed Race)
2:10.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; Overall 7.0; Home straight: Far 7.0, Centre 7.1, Stands' 6.9)

runners.name: Alaskan Light
runners.comment: Runner-up at Ripon; Love Olivia looks the yard's chief hope, but not ruled out each-way
runners.spotlight: 15-8 when runner-up on recent debut at Ripon (5f, good); others have achieved considerably more (including stablemate Love Olivia) but her sister Alaskan Gold was a 2yo Listed runner-up for the trainer, who has a good record in this race, and she's open to improvement; not ruled out each-way.

runners.name: Awraad
runners.comment: Sole filly when winning at Pontefract; mixed messages from form; needs a big step forward
runners.spotlight: Sole filly in the field when narrow winner at 11-1 on last month's debut at Pontefract (5f, good); it was a promising start but there have been mixed messages from that form and it's likely she needs a big step forward today.

quotes.race: Racing TV Sky Channel 424 EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C/D) (GBB/IRE Incentive Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Awraad is quite a small filly but she's done everything really professionally. She only had one gallop away from home but she was straight as a die and I didn't think she'd need another one. She knew her job well. She was probably helped by the favourite missing the break but she stuck her neck out when it mattered, I thought she might get mown down but she was really gutsy. As long as the ground doesn't get any slower we'll keep her going - Gemma Tutty, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's a small filly but a very early type and has a great mind on her. She won first time out at Pontefract early last week. She'll probably head to the Marygate now at York next month. I don't really want to run her under a penalty given her size, so it's an obvious next step for her. She'd had only one gallop away from home before she won, so she's been super professional. 23-04-25

runners.name: Eternal Solace
runners.comment: Won by 3l on recent debut at Brighton and she could have a part to play
runners.spotlight: Backed into 11-2 prior to winning on debut at Brighton (5.2f, good to firm) 16 days ago; had 3l to spare and her in-form trainer saddled the third in this last year; could have a part to play.

runners.name: Guernsey Lady
runners.comment: Has made the frame on both runs; trainer won this in 2014 and 2019 but improvement needed
runners.spotlight: Showed pace when fair fourth to Harry's Girl on debut at Newmarket and again when third at Goodwood (5f, good); trainer won this in 2014 and 2019 so she's worth a second look, but plenty of improvement is needed.

runners.name: Harrys Girl
runners.owner: Craig Bloor, Will Salthouse & R Hannon
runners.comment: Won on debut at Newmarket and there can be optimism she'll improve; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Did well to come from the back of the field to win at 7-1 on last month's debut at Newmarket (5f, good to soft); the form looks solid and there can be optimism she'll improve for a trainer enjoying a fine spring with his 2yos; she's one to consider.

stable_tour.quote: scored well on her debut at the Craven meeting, and when mine win as impressively as that first time they're usually pretty good. 22-04-25

runners.name: Love Olivia
runners.comment: Impressive on debut at Wolverhampton and trainer has excellent recent record in race
runners.spotlight: 140,000gns yearling who was sent off 2-5 and easily made all on last month's debut at Wolverhampton (5f, AW); looks the stable number one (ahead of Alaskan Light) for trainer who won this in 2022 and 2023 and saddled last year's runner-up; leading claims.

quotes.race: Enjoy Spring Evening Racing April-June Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Love Olivia won nicely and the whole team are very happy with her performance. Karl [Burke, trainer] thought a lot of her going into this and she looks an exciting prospect. Like our two-year-olds, we'll make sure she comes out of this okay and takes it well. She seems to take things in her stride though. You'd have to think about the Marygate [Fillies' Stakes] at York but Karl will make plans going forwards - Amy Drummond, racing manager to Amo Racing.

runners.name: Saucy Jane
runners.owner: Nick Bradley Racing 16 And Jmr Partners
runners.comment: Impressive at Beverley on her second start and she could be in the mix
runners.spotlight: Promising second when favourite for debut at Pontefract (5f, good) and built on that to win by nearly 5l at Beverley (5f, good to firm) 11 days ago; the Beverley placed horses have shown promise before or after, so it was an impressive performance, and she could be in the mix.

quotes.race: EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses In Band D) (EBF Rest' Qual') (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Saucy Jane had a poor draw at Pontefract and she ran respectably but her homework had been showing us she'd improved. I'm delighted for all of my team, especially Harriett [Bryce], who rides her every day and broke her in as well. She looks like a filly on the up and a nice prospect. We'll see how she gets on when she gets home but we could look at the Hilary Needler Trophy back here [May 24] or the Marygate at York next Friday. We can always dream of Ascot. She looks a nice filly and if she continues to progress there's no reason why we can't look at it - Jack Morland, trainer.

runners.name: Secret Hideaway
runners.comment: Encouraging 2nd on debut at Ripon but no match for winner; others have much stronger form
runners.spotlight: Her dam was a Listed-placed 5f 2yo winner and she's open to improvement on her second start; encouraging second of five at 12-1 on debut at Ripon (5f, good) three weeks ago but she was no match for a stablemate of Alaskan Light and Love Olivia, and others have much stronger form.

quotes.race: Clipper EBF Marygate Fillies' Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I ran Secret Hideaway at Ripon to educate her on the undulations over a sharp five furlongs. She'll have no bother staying six furlongs, maybe even seven in time.  She will improve loads as the year goes on. I'll speak to the owners and Royal Ascot is the obvious place to go, either the Queen Mary or the Albany. She has a brilliant temperament, she's very laid back - Adrian Keatley, trainer.

runners.name: Solana Rose
runners.comment: Thrown in at deep end on debut but in excellent hands and the betting may be informative
runners.spotlight: 65,000gns yearling; second foal; Mehmas half-sister to connections' Listed-placed 7f AW 2yo winner Tundra Rose; dam once-raced half-sister to 1m Group 1 winner Mustashry, among others; thrown in at the deep end on debut but she's in excellent hands and the betting may be informative.

2:42.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; Overall 7.0; Home straight: Far 7.0, Centre 7.1, Stands' 6.9)

runners.name: Thunder Run
runners.comment: Fair chance on pedigree to get new trip; hadn't made debut a year ago, so could improve
runners.spotlight: Gamely made all in 18-runner handicap here (1m, good to firm) last August and fourth of 20 at Ascot (1m, soft) next time; disappointing second favourite in the Lincoln at Doncaster on reappearance and this is a new trip (fair chance to get it on pedigree) but he's well regarded and he hadn't made his debut a year ago, so could still improve.

quotes.race: Knights Solicitors Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: Thunder Run loves the track, but the step up in trip was the key. He needed to relax but after half a furlong he took off with Clifford [Lee] - the last thing I said to him was do not make it. I'd have dragged him off coming back in if he did!  Once he got a bit of cover he got him in a lovely rhythm. I didn't want him to hit the front too soon but didn't think it'd be that late. It nearly gave me a heart attack.  When he learns to race a bit more economically he's definitely a Listed or Group 3 horse. The Wolferton at Royal Ascot will be the plan. His new owners paid a nice bit of money for him before the Lincoln and they'd love to have a runner there - Karl Burke, trainer.

quotes.race: Clipper Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Thunder Run is still very raw and it wasn't the plan to go out and make it, but David (Egan) said he jumped out very well as they didn't feel they were going quick enough. But if something took him it probably would've cost him the race - he was on fresh air for the last 100 yards. We only ran Thunder Run at Thirsk last time as he needed a penalty to get in. Thank god he didn't win, because he might've got beat with a 6lb penalty - Karl Burke, trainer.

quotes.race: British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Thunder Run was entitled to improve a lot from his first run. We had loads of excuses at Wetherby, he was slow away and drawn wide, and William's (Haggas)  horse got the run of the race. I felt we were unlucky not to win. He's quite a relaxed horse and he quickened up well when Danny asked him. I'd say it was a good performance and he's a smart horse. Danny likes him and I'd say we can go upwards from here - Karl Burke, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ended up having to do the donkey work on his return in the Lincoln and just got tired in the end. I think he's a Group horse all day long and is one who we can hopefully travel abroad with later in the year. We'll give him an easy few weeks and it would be good if we could find a nice race for him before something like the Royal Hunt Cup. 11-04-25

runners.name: Salamanca
runners.comment: Dictated a steady pace to win the 1m2f Easter Classic Handicap at Newcastle; lightly raced
runners.spotlight: Looked a useful prospect on good ground last spring and confirmed it on AW in recent outings; dictated a steady pace when winning the Easter Classic Handicap at Newcastle (1m2f) four weeks ago; 4lb higher today but lightly raced and could continue on his upward curve.

quotes.race: BetUK All-Weather Easter Classic Middle Distance Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: It was well mapped out to come here for the championship and when you get a wide draw your six months of planning looks like it's all down the gurgler, as I said to Mr Harris before the race. It was an excellent ride, he clocked it properly in his head. We're thrilled we've seen the horse that we believed in and how he's trained at home. Salamanca is a good horse! - Jane Chapple-Hyam, trainer

runners.name: Tony Montana
runners.comment: Has run well over C&D; good 2nd to unexposed sort on reappearance at Goodwood 13 days ago
runners.spotlight: Started last season with two wins and he was third in major big-field handicaps at York and Goodwood, all over about 1m2f and the latter probably on good to firm; good second to an unexposed sort on reappearance at Goodwood 13 days ago and well capable of being on the premises.

quotes.race: Precision Facades Handicap
quotes.quote: Tony Montana is a lovely horse with a lovely pedigree. He's probably won't be high enough for the Ascot handicaps, so we'll box clever and look at places like Goodwood - Michael Bell, trainer.

runners.name: Flying Frontier
runners.comment: Very solid on good/AW, below form on his only start on good to firm; won in August latest
runners.spotlight: Has a very solid record on good ground and AW but below form last summer on his only start on good to firm; better than ever at Sandown (1m2f) in August, getting up in the final strides in a six-runner race; 2lb higher today and off since but he could still have more to offer.

runners.name: Brioni
runners.owner: Mrs M C Sweeney & Alan King
runners.comment: May have needed his reappearance outing (weak 11-1) and his stable is among the winners
runners.spotlight: Improved form once he was gelded last summer, pipped at Glorious Goodwood (1m2f, good to firm) before drawing 4l clear at Ascot (1m2f, soft); below form both starts since but may have needed last month's reappearance outing (weak 11-1) and his stable is among the winners.

runners.name: Westerton
runners.comment: Sole win (18 races) remains a maiden in 2023; reappearance suggests all hope is not lost
runners.spotlight: Sole win (18 races) remains a maiden on good to firm in 2023 and last year was pretty disappointing, on Flat and over hurdles; 25-1 when 4l behind Tony Montana at Goodwood on reappearance 13 days ago but dropped a further 3lb since and made some late headway, so all hope isn't lost.

quotes.race: Darley British EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We were looking at the 1m1f handicap on this card for Westerton but we thought we'd be brave and go for this race where the prize-money is excellent. I left it to Ryan Moore and it worked out great. That's my 2,000th winner and it's great to do it for wonderful owners who have flown down from Aberdeen this morning. They're a delight to train for - Alan King, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I was initially disappointed by his hurdles debut at Stratford, but Tom Cannon said he blew up. He murders everything at home so we can't really stretch him and he'll come on plenty for that run. He loves jumping and I hope he'll progress well, probably kept to the sharper tracks for the time being. 25-10-24
I was very disappointed with his effort at Huntington when he didn't look keen under pressure. He may switch back to the Flat for the time being. 07-11-24

runners.name: Have Secret

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Mary, Lady Manton

runners.comment: Raced nearly 5l clear at Ripon last time to break his losing run; back up 8lb, though
runners.spotlight: Threatened last season to break his losing run and it finally happened at Ripon (1m2f, good) four weeks ago when he led over 2f out and raced nearly 5l clear; going back up 8lb may demand a career best but he's effective over C&D and on good to firm ground, and he might have turned a corner.

quotes.race: Coral Kincsem Handicap
quotes.quote: Have Secret has run a cracking race, which he has done all season. He's a horse who is getting better with racing, but he keeps just finding one or two. But we are delighted with him - Richard Fahey, trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Have Secret tends to race behind the bridle but keeps finding. The step up in trip helped him and he handled the ground. Oisin Orr, jockey.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Series Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Have Secret deserved that after he ran well at Chester last week on a course that didn't suit him. He was going to go up the ratings so we thought we'd come here and he's going to go up even further now. He'll make a nice 3yo next year - Robin O'Ryan, assistant to trainer Richard Fahey.

runners.name: Bint Al Daar
runners.comment: Second of 15 over C&D (good to firm) last August off 3lb lower was one of her peak efforts
runners.spotlight: Two wins (1m2f/9.4f) last summer and back to form when taking minor honours under an inexperienced claimer over 1m on both starts this term; second of 15 over C&D (good to firm) last August off 3lb lower was one of her peak efforts, so she's firmly in the picture.

quotes.race: Mutasaabeq At The National Stud Handicap
quotes.quote: Bint Al Daar wasn't travelling that well early doors but she crept into it and I got a lovely split when I needed it. Kevin Phillippart de Foy's horses are in good form and she enjoyed the ground - Jack Mitchell, jockey.

runners.name: Deboras Dream
runners.comment: Ran on nicely from a poor position when sixth of 14 at Chester (1m2f, good) eight days ago
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 1m last July for Roger Varian; 0-5 for current yard and little help from the handicapper but he ran on nicely from a poor position when sixth of 14 at Chester (1m2f, good; acts on good to firm) eight days ago, nearly 3l behind Austrian Theory but it looked encouraging.

stable_tour.quote: He ran disappointingly at Dundalk last time and he's been gelded now. He's rated 88 and he'll definitely win off that mark in January if we can find the right race. 05-12-24

runners.name: Austrian Theory
runners.breeder: Epona Bloodstock Ltd And P A Byrne
runners.comment: Rallied strongly when second at Redcar (1m) and Chester (1m2f) in his two runs this term
runners.spotlight: Won once in each of his four previous seasons; no better than fourth in his five races here but he rallied strongly when second at Redcar (1m) and Chester (1m2f) in his two runs this term, which demands respect.

quotes.race: Racehorse Lotto Handicap
quotes.quote: We've always thought a lot of Austrian Theory and he was a very talented two-year-old. I thought he was a real Golden Mile type for Goodwood last year but he can be a bit in and out. His run at Chester last weekend was a sign he was coming back to the boil and Joe Fanning was sublime on the front end. The straight track handicaps don't really suit him and, albeit the plan didn't come off last year, we'll be working back from the Golden Mile again - Charlie Johnston, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a grand horse who we bought from the Horses In Training Sale in Newmarket. He's not quite ready to run yet, but we're looking forward to him this summer. I'm still learning about him, but I'd expect him to want a mile and good ground and to be running at some of the bigger meetings. 23-04-24

runners.name: Zain Blue
runners.comment: Won here sole go in cheekpieces; new trip now but there is some stamina on the dam's side
runners.spotlight: His eight handicaps have all been over 1m with two wins on good to soft last year, latterly when rallying well at York in September on the only time he's worn cheekpieces; they return today, following a heavy defeat on reappearance four weeks ago, and he's run creditably on good to firm; new trip today but there is some stamina on the dam's side.

quotes.race: PJ Staffing Group Handicap
quotes.quote: Zain Blue ran well here the last day and there was always a good handicap in him. There will be more to come when we step him up in trip and he preferred this ground. There's more to come and there's a big one in him - John Butler, trainer.

quotes.race: Long Harbour Derek Lucie-Smith Handicap
quotes.quote: It's taken Zain Blue a long time to win a race. On his two-year-old form we thought he would be able to win before now and it's been a little bit disappointing to be on this rating, but it's onwards and upwards for now. He was second here two runs back and there's just been a few little things but he's a sound horse and I think he'll keep winning races. We had him in a Premier handicap on Saturday but we decided to come here today instead. There's plenty of racing for him ahead - John Butler, trainer.

runners.name: Man Of Desert
runners.comment: In warm race for handicap debut but he has potential, for sure, and 1m2f is likely to help
runners.spotlight: Half brother to Derby winner Desert Crown; all three races over 1m, 200-1 for a maiden at Yarmouth (good to firm) last time but he produced a big run from off the pace to be a close third of 12; this is a warm race for handicap debut but he has potential, for sure, and 1m2f is likely to help.

runners.name: Financer
runners.owner: S Bulmer, P Hebdon & R Taylor
runners.comment: Three 1m2f wins on good/good to firm last season and respectable second on reappearance
runners.spotlight: Three 1m2f wins on good/good to firm last season, possibly unsuited by softer ground when he appeared twice over C&D in the autumn; respectable second to Have Secret at Ripon (1m2f, good) on reappearance and he's a contender if back to his best.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice colt by Cracksman who's had only one run, finishing fifth at York. We like him and you'd think he'll be a middle-distance horse. 23-04-24

4:55.race_name: Darley EBF "Confined" Novice Stakes (No More Than Two Runs) (GBB Race)
4:55.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; Overall 7.0; Home straight: Far 7.0, Centre 7.1, Stands' 6.9)

runners.name: Bowmark
runners.comment: Listed runner-up on AW on second start and he holds leading form claims for top stable
runners.spotlight: Impressive win on debut at Kempton (1m, AW) in December and beaten just a neck in Listed race at Newcastle (1m, AW) on last month's reappearance; stable has won the last two runnings; leading form claims even under penalty.

runners.name: Point Of Contact
runners.comment: Won at Newbury last month; further improvement needed but he should continue to progress
runners.spotlight: Promising third at Newbury (7f, good) last July on sole 2yo start and reappeared with a win there (1m, good) last month; further improvement is needed if he's to defy a penalty today but he should continue to progress and is entitled to respect.

runners.name: Coulsea
runners.comment: Could be sharper for last month's debut at Ayr but lots of improvement is needed
runners.spotlight: His dam was useful and he could be sharper for last month's debut at Ayr (1m, good), but soundly beaten at 28-1 and lots of improvement is needed.

runners.name: Crown Of Oaks
runners.comment: Promise when third on both starts and he didn't get the breaks last time; key player
runners.spotlight: Third on debut at Newmarket (7f, good to soft) last October and also showed promise when third to Point Of Contact at Newbury (1m, good) last month; didn't get the breaks in the straight last time, when beaten about 1l, and he's now 6lb better off with the winner; excellent pedigree; key player.

runners.name: Real Trouper
runners.owner: Peter Onslow, Fdc Holdings Ltd & Nwir Ltd
runners.comment: Dam 8.6f AW winner (RPR 70); makes debut in a hot novice and is probably best watched
runners.spotlight: By Kodi Bear; second foal; dam 8.6f AW winner (RPR 70), half-sister to two winners; makes debut in a hot novice and is probably best watched.

runners.name: Marsh Meadow
runners.comment: Didn't show enough on last month's debut to suggest she'll be making an impact today
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to three winners who was a fair third of four at 14-1 on last month's debut at Catterick (7f, good to firm); open to improvement but didn't show enough last time to suggest she'll be making an impact today.

runners.name: Sea The Wonder
runners.comment: Purchase price catches the eye but tough task on this debut and she may want further
runners.spotlight: 310,000gns yearling; third foal; dam unplaced 6.5f/1m in France (RPR 70), closely related to multiple 1m4f-2m Group 2 winner Enbihaar, half-sister to two useful winners; in excellent hands and her purchase price catches the eye, but has a tough assignment on debut and this Sea The Stars filly may not come into her own until tackling further.

4:15.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; Overall 7.0; Home straight: Far 7.0, Centre 7.1, Stands' 6.9)

runners.name: King Of Bears
runners.comment: Pulled hard and finished out the back at Newmarket on stable debut/reappearance; new trip
runners.spotlight: 6f win at Newbury last summer, his second start, before coming up short in strong company; had wind and gelding operations prior to his stable/seasonal/handicap debut at Newmarket (6f, good to soft) last month, a race where he pulled hard and was beaten a long way (wore a hood and a tongue-tie, both absent today); 5f might suit but he's not solid.

runners.name: Against The Wind
runners.comment: Looked an improved performer on his Thirsk reappearance/h'cap debut; up 6lb but unexposed
runners.spotlight: 5f AW win last summer and also ran well in a sales race here at the Ebor meeting, looking stretched by the sixth furlong; gelded prior to his Thirsk reappearance (5f, good to firm) and he turned in an improved display, travelling strongly and finding plenty off the bridle; up 6lb but could well have more in the tank; connections had Vantheman finish second in this race last year.

quotes.race: Winners Wear Skopes Menswear EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We thought the world of Against The Wind into the spring. I was very confident he'd go and win at York first time as he was so professional at home but he got beat. First run you can always forgive with a little bit of greenness but he then got beaten again on his second start. I felt just dropping back to five [furlongs] and taking a lead would suit and he showed his quality today - Kevin Ryan, trainer.

runners.name: King Of Light
runners.comment: Returning to handicap company in his favour; more to prove on fast groundurs
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 5f as a 2yo (good and soft) and also performed with credit over C&D; 6lb higher than when scoring at Haydock on his only handicap run and this is more suitable than some of his subsequent assignments.

runners.name: Loom
runners.comment: Beaten 3l at Royal Ascot last summer; promising reappearance last month; drop to 5f a plus
runners.spotlight: 5f novice win as a 2yo before running with credit in the Norfolk Stakes at Royal Ascot; absent for ten months (gelded) prior to his reappearance at Newmarket last month, a race where he travelled strongly before tiring in the closing stages; dropping back to 5f should suit and this mark probably not beyond him; one to consider.

quotes.race: Janet And Mark Leach Wedding Celebration EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Loom ran a little bit keen and didn't finish out his race at York and I was very keen to get a lead on him today. The drop back to five [furlongs] suited, he's a very quick horse and very good tempered. He was still keen early but he ran through the line well - Billy Garritty, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Sudden Flight
runners.comment: Improved with each start and still has more to offer; interesting on turf/handicap debut
runners.spotlight: The form of his Southwell maiden success has been handsomely advertised by the runner-up (now BHA-rated 100); failed to concede a penalty to the 86-rated Carrados at Wolverhampton three weeks ago but still ran a fine race; likely he'll need to improve again to defy this mark on his turf and handicap debut but it wouldn't be a huge surprise.

runners.name: Lexington Blitz
runners.breeder: Troy & Joey Cullen & Irish National Stud
runners.comment: Two wins last year before coming up short in a Listed event; opening mark looks tough
runners.spotlight: Won a maiden and a novice last summer (both 5f; good and good to firm) before coming up short in Listed company at Ayr when last seen in September; opening mark demands improvement.

runners.name: Mearall
runners.comment: Impressed on debut before a Listed 3rd two weeks later; opening mark tough; down in trip
runners.spotlight: Impressive on last season's debut (6f, good; strong favourite); third in Listed company a fortnight later but his form dipped at Thirsk when last seen in September; gelded over the winter; should be quick enough to cope with 5f but not obviously well treated; stable also run Loom and Tuscan Point.

quotes.race: Karl Budge 60th Birthday EBF Novice Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Mearall had been showing up nicely at home. There's plenty of improvement, he was green enough the whole way - Oisin Orr, jockey.

runners.name: Elouises Prince
runners.comment: Two easy front-running AW wins last autumn; this tougher but ceiling yet to be established
runners.spotlight: Too green to do himself justice on debut last September (5f, good) but he put the experience to good use, winning two 5f events at Wolverhampton in October and November (made all both times); not obviously thrown in for this handicap debut but his ceiling is yet to be established.

runners.name: Storm Call
runners.comment: Useful 2yo for K Burke last year; sold 35,000gns in September; tough mark on her return
runners.spotlight: Showed a useful level of ability in six runs for Karl Burke last year, notably her second of 11 in a conditions event at Glorious Goodwood (5f, good to firm); sold for 35,000gns in September; can win races this year but not sure she's well-enough treated for a race of this nature.

runners.name: Amestris
runners.owner: Mrs B Green And Mrs Michael Bell
runners.comment: Highly tried after her novice win last summer; had wind op prior to return; yard in form
runners.spotlight: Came to hand early last season but she was highly tried after her easy Lingfield win last June (5f, good) and failed to add to her tally; had a wind op in February and returns with her yard's hot spell showing no sign of slowing down; no tongue-tie this time.

runners.name: Al Hussar
runners.comment: Three 5f wins as a 2yo; well beaten on recent Chester return and this is tougher
runners.spotlight: Three 5f wins as a 2yo but he was a well-beaten 16-1 shot at Chester on his reappearance nine days ago; this looks a better race and he needs a big leap forward.

runners.name: The Quiet Gent
runners.comment: Beaten odds-on fav switched to turf last month; drop to 5f can help; has a Group 1 entry
runners.spotlight: All runs over 6f, winning at Kempton in December (made all) and showing better form when second of ten at Ripon four weeks ago (6f, good; turf debut; beaten at short odds); should be quick enough for 5f and his Commonwealth Cup entry, while seeming unlikely now, suggests he's well thought of; could well do better.

runners.name: The Man
runners.comment: Highly tried after AW win on 2yo debut; had wind/gelding ops prior to return; needs more
runners.spotlight: Overcame inexperience to make a winning debut at Southwell last April; highly tried in the summer and came up short; faces a more realistic assignment on his reappearance and he's had wind and gelding operations during his absence; hard to say he was thrown in here though.

runners.name: Just King High
runners.comment: Southwell win in November has been franked; had wind op since; open to further progress
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the third attempt as a 2yo, keeping on well to land a 5f Southwell maiden; that form has been advertised since and he's undergone wind surgery during his absence; unexposed and one to consider.

runners.name: Do It Now
runners.comment: Has a squeak on best 2yo form but his progress looks to have levelled off
runners.spotlight: Won at Ripon (5f, good) one year ago and ran well when a close fifth in the Super Sprint on his next start; progress has stalled since and he was 3l behind Against The Wind at Thirsk on his reappearance.

runners.name: Jm Jhingree
runners.comment: Never threatened in a Class 5 at Catterick on his stable debut last month; up against it
runners.spotlight: Often held back by a refusal to settle when trained by the Quinns last year; never in the hunt in a Class 5 at Catterick on his stable debut three weeks ago; up in class and others have more pressing claims.

runners.name: Acrisius
runners.comment: Pipped at the post at Doncaster 3 weeks ago but impressed with how he travelled; unexposed
runners.spotlight: Brighton maiden win as a 2yo (5.5f, good to firm); improved form on his reappearance/handicap debut at Doncaster three weeks ago (5f, good to firm), tanking through the race but collared in the final stride; his early pace will be an asset over C&D and he could yet rate higher.

runners.name: Two Shoes
runners.comment: 5f maiden win on 2yo debut; no progress in two runs after; absent 259 days and vulnerable
runners.spotlight: Made a winning debut at Carlisle last June (5f, good to firm); highly tried on her second start and came up short; ran okay on her nursery debut 259 days ago without suggesting she was ahead of her mark.

quotes.race: Alan Jennings Last Orders Memorial Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands B/C/D) (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Two Shoes started nicely. She looked a bit green but once she got organised, she's really come home well. She's not fully wound up and will improve, and she'll probably get another furlong - Steve Charlton, husband of Julie Camacho.

runners.name: Cape Sovereign
runners.comment: Six-race maiden but he's sharp and ran well on recent handicap debut; yard run two here
runners.spotlight: Expensive to follow in his six starts but he has shown promise, including when second on his handicap debut at Beverley 11 days ago; in deeper today and stable may have stronger claims with Against The Wind.

runners.name: Im Next
runners.comment: Ended 2024 with a heavy-ground win at Nottingham; solid return but this is much tougher
runners.spotlight: Ended 2024 with a heavy-ground defeat of Jm Jhingree at Nottingham; similar form when third of eight at Catterick last month; this demands more.

runners.name: Tuscan Point
runners.comment: 0-6 as a 2yo; drops in trip for his reappearance and looks to have plenty to prove
runners.spotlight: Showed some promise as a 2yo but his best run came over 7f on good to soft ground; gelded prior to his reappearance; 1lb out of the handicap and his stable look to hold stronger claims elsewhere.

runners.name: Boyne Lady
runners.comment: Improved 2nd to h'cap blot (pair clear of subsequent winner) latest; 5f may help; up 7lb
runners.spotlight: Took a good step forward when forcing a handicap blot to pull out all the stops at Haydock three weeks ago (6f, good; distant third has won since); looked quick enough for 5f on that occasion but she did have the benefit of the stands' rail and, perhaps more significantly, she's racing off effectively 7lb higher today.

5:30.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; Overall 7.0; Home straight: Far 7.0, Centre 7.1, Stands' 6.9)

runners.name: Eldrickjones
runners.comment: Won on Sunday's reappearance at Newcastle but he failed to shine on turf last season
runners.spotlight: Returned to form with a win on reappearance at Newcastle on Sunday (7f, AW; won the same race last year); highly effective on turf earlier in career but failed to shine on grass last season (well beaten in this).

quotes.race: Coventry Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Eldrickjones is a horse that we liked a lot at home, so this performance was no surprise. I'm delighted with him, he's still a baby, is raw and green. There's still lots of improvement in him - Daniel Tudhope, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He could end up somewhere similar to La Trinidad as a miler and there could be a nice race for him at Newcastle on June 27 - it's a 0-105 over a mile. We think he's turned into a bit of a specialist at that track. Before that, though, he has a big day at Royal Ascot on Wednesday as he is going in the Royal Hunt Cup. Last summer the owner suggested giving him a wind operation and we haven't really looked back since. He had a good winter and he won at Newcastle last month, but York last time probably came a little bit too quick for him. I definitely think there's scope for him to improve. He showed lots of potential as a two-year-old, when he was second in the Coventry, and we're hoping he can land a big handicap this year. 21-06-24

runners.name: Altmore
runners.comment: Made it 2-3 last October; hasn't kicked on but returns from a break and retains potential
runners.spotlight: Won at Chepstow (6f, good; unraced on faster) last September on second start and followed up in Pontefract handicap (6f, soft); didn't kick on subsequently but returns from four-month break and retains potential for top yard.

runners.name: The Turpinator

prev_owners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd And G Tuer
Bighouse Synd , J Rosier & C Rosier

runners.comment: In good form this spring since return to action but may be vulnerable to stronger stayers
runners.spotlight: Reappeared with a win at Newcastle (6f, AW) last month and creditable third at Chester (7f, good) last week; however, he might be vulnerable to stronger stayers at this trip now back on a galloping track.

quotes.race: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Handicap
quotes.quote: The Turpinator had a few problems at the end of last year and has had a lot of time off but he's been working well recently so it's been no huge shock. I think he'll improve again, Ollie [Stammers, jockey] said he had a bit of a blow fifty yards before the line so hopefully there's a bit left. That six [furlongs] here really suits him, he wants a stiff six or an easy seven [furlongs] and there's another nice race in him - Grant Tuer, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He won twice for us last season, at Thirsk and Newcastle. He's a solid handicapper who runs in all the big seven-furlong races in the north. He hasn't run since February but has a target at York on Friday in an apprentice handicap. 14-06-24

runners.name: Sword
runners.comment: Ex-Gosden; new trainer does well with recruits from other yards; could be on good mark
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the seventh attempt for the Gosdens at Newcastle (1m2f, AW) last October when last seen; sold for 55,000gns later that month; drops back in trip for this stable and seasonal debut but his trainer does extremely well with recruits from other yards; Tudhope rides; could be on a good mark.

runners.name: Dolce Courage
runners.comment: Close fourth in first-time blinkers at Doncaster in March but struggled at Newmarket since
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 5yo who was a close fourth of 15 in first-time blinkers (retained since) at Doncaster (7f, good) in March; however, beaten a long way out at Newmarket (1m good) since, and hard to be confident after that.

runners.name: Mereside Diva
runners.comment: Second over C&D last May and recent reappearance fourth may have put her spot on for today
runners.spotlight: Good campaign last season, including second of 18 over C&D (good to soft) last May; reappeared with creditable fourth at Wetherby (7f, good to firm) three weeks ago and that outing may have put her spot on for today.

quotes.race: Sky Bet For The Fans Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Mereside Diva is improving all the time and thriving. She's been progressing nicely since stepping up to seven furlongs. When she was still a bit raw, you'd go for her and she'd prick her ears and have a look, but she's really game now and sticking to her task well - Callum Rodriguez, speaking to ITV Racing.

quotes.race: Pertemps Handicap
quotes.quote: We kept thinking Mereside Diva would improve for the step up to seven furlongs and she stayed the trip well. She's run a lot on bad ground, but she handles this fine and seemed to travel on it well - Nicola Barron, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Brannans Have Done The 61 Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: I had to switch Mereside Diva a couple of times because I hit a couple of wet patches that knocked her momentum, but she's tough and she dug it out well - Rossa Ryan, jockey.

runners.name: Intervention
runners.breeder: D & S L Tanker Transport Ltd
runners.comment: Fair fourth at Pontefract last month but he's 11-66 on AW as opposed to 1-32 on turf
runners.spotlight: Won at Lingfield (7f, AW) in March and fair fourth at Pontefract (5f, good) next time; excuse at Chester last week when slowly away; however, he's 11-66 on AW as opposed to 1-32 on turf so isn't the percentage call.

quotes.race: Win Â£2,000,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a fantastic win again and Intervention is just an amazing horse. That's eleven wins since we bought him, his last four on the bounce. He's going on seven, in the form of his life and is better than ever. It secures at least sharing the top prize for the all-weather horse of the month at the Arc (Arena Racing Company) tracks in December because that's three wins from his last three runs. We're thrilled with him, he came to us as a longstanding maiden and Mick's just worked wonders with him. He's a bit of a hero of ours, he's won more races for us than any other horse and he's a firm favourite - Chris Dixon, syndicate boss.

stable_tour.quote: Our winningmost horse with 11 victories. He had quite a few goes before we bought him and he's won all those races for us and well over Â£100,000 in prize-money. He's just a legend. He runs his race nearly every time and always seems to be in the money. He's come down to a good mark again for the all-weather season and he's ready to win again soon. He's having a break now and usually thrives through the winter. 26-09-24

runners.name: Musical Touch
runners.owner: Sporting Life Racing Club - R Fahey
runners.comment: 6f wins the last twice and this unexposed 4yo could have more to offer now tackling 7f
runners.spotlight: Won at Wolverhampton (6f, AW) last October on second handicap start and belatedly followed up at Thirsk (6f, good) last month; strong at the finish for both wins and this unexposed 4yo could have more to offer now tackling 7f for the first time; firmly in calculations.

runners.name: Flying Fletcher
runners.comment: Kept on for fair 5th over 6f at Doncaster latest and could build on that now back up to 7f
runners.spotlight: Won at Newcastle (6f, AW) last November and close third over 7f there in February; kept on for fair fifth at Doncaster (6f, good to firm) latest and could build on that now back up to 7f; not ruled out each-way.

runners.name: Al Muqdad
runners.comment: May have needed last month's reappearance run; three wins last summer and not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten on reappearance at Redcar last month but may have needed the run; won three times last summer (7f, good/good to firm) and went close off this mark on final run last season; not ruled out.

quotes.race: Kimberly Wyatt @ Scottish Sun Ladies Night Handicap
quotes.quote: They went very hard and I thought the pace was always going to collapse and it helped the closers like me. Al Muqdad has been very consistent and good, quicker ground is probably his thing. Seven furlongs is probably his best trip - Danny Tudhope, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Master Richard
runners.owner: T S Ingham & Mrs Liz Ingham
runners.comment: On long losing run but reduced mark appeals on last year's best form; effective here
runners.spotlight: Front-runner whose losing run goes back to May 2023; however, his reduced mark appeals on last year's best form and he could improve for last month's reappearance fourth at Redcar; effective here; could make bold bid.

runners.name: One Night Thunder
runners.comment: Needs to prove how much ability he retains, but on a dangerous mark and interesting
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 5yo who needs to prove how much ability he retains but he was sent off at 15-2 and had no luck in running when returning from a long absence at Newcastle (7f, AW) a fortnight ago, finishing a 7l last of eight; another 4lb lower today and he's an interesting candidate.

stable_tour.quote: He had an issue in the stalls in the Spring Mile but passed his stalls test last Monday, so we're just waiting for a bit of cut in the ground for him now. He's a really nice horse and I think a lot of him. I wouldn't be surprised if there was a big handicap in him. 23-04-25

runners.name: Feel The Need
runners.comment: The forecast fast ground may be a negative but this C&D winner is still respected
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent on AW this year and below par latest, while the forecast fast ground may be a negative; however, he won over C&D (good to soft) last May and is still entitled to respect now back here on a competitive mark.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well on his return and can take a step forward from that. There are some nice races for him this month and there should be plenty of improvement to come. 04-05-23

runners.name: Mums Tipple
runners.comment: Has tumbled down the weights but this regressive 8yo needs to turn things around
runners.spotlight: Very well handicapped on last year's best efforts and showed spark as recently as November; however, he's been soundly beaten on AW on his three runs this year and this regressive 8yo needs to turn things around.

quotes.race: Bombardier Lady Wulfruna Stakes (Listed Race) (All-Weather Championships Fast-Track Qualifier)
quotes.quote: It's nice for the owners as Mums Tipple looked a serious horse at two but last year was a bit of a mess for many reasons. He ran a fine race at Lingfield and the step up to seven furlongs suited him. There were some good horses in there but the race went well for him and he did it nicely. He's a fast horse, started well and the race went smoothly - Ryan Moore, jockey.  Mums Tipple worked very well during the week and it's nice to see him back after his encouraging run at Lingfield. He's a very good horse and it's been a little bit unfair as he gets knocked every time he runs. People want to see a similar performance to what he did at York each time but that was one of the best performances I've seen by any horse - even I was shocked by that - and people haven't given him a break since that. He's got an awful lot of ability so it's nice to see him win, and win very well, at that level. Hopefully he can build on that for the rest of the year and we'll probably go for the Mile on Finals' Day - Richard Hannon, trainer.

quotes.race: Goffs UK Premier Yearling Stakes
quotes.quote: We thought Mums Tipple was a very nice horse when he won at Ascot but I haven't seen a horse of ours win like that for years. I'm not sure what strength of depth there was in the race but he looked pretty smart. He's one of the nicest horses we've had in terms of the way he looks, behaves and moves - he's a little bit different. He does his thing at home and to me he looks like he'll still improve. There are plenty of options for him but he's entered in all the big ones - Richard Hannon, trainer.

quotes.race: Anders Foundation British EBF Crocker Bulteel Maiden Stakes (Plus 10 Race) (Not Run More Than Once)
quotes.quote: Mums Tipple is a very nice colt, always has been. I think it's a very good race, there's been a lot of talk for a lot of horses there. He's done it the hard way making the running but he hit the gate well, he was in front for a long way so he's probably wanted the line. He's got a lot of scope - Richard Hannon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A great old horse, a real yard favourite. He runs good and he runs bad but his owners have had a great time with him and there will be more good days this year, I'm sure. He messed around in the gates and reared up at the wrong time at Lingfield on Friday, but we'll just put a line through that and nobody should give up on him. On his day he's one of the most capable horses we've had and he'll come back to that at some stage. 22-04-25

runners.name: Riot

prev_owners.owner: Rasio Cymru 1 & Windmill House Tb Ltd

runners.comment: Went off boil in January but a break may have helped; won this race in 2024 off 1lb higher
runners.spotlight: Went off the boil in January but he'd been on the go for a long time and a break may have helped; often runs well here and he's 1lb lower than when winning this race last year; could have a big part to play.

stable_tour.quote: He was placed in the Buckingham Palace for previous connections and has dropped down the handicap now. He had a few runs for us on slower ground but he wants it faster and could be well handicapped for the summer. He runs at Chelmsford on Thursday. 04-05-23

runners.name: Quest For Fun
runners.comment: On a 15-race losing sequence but he's on a tempting mark and has good C&D form
runners.spotlight: 0-14 last year and his form went the wrong way, while he's unproven on fast ground (albeit hasn't had many chances); however, he's 8lb lower than when second of 17 over C&D (good to soft) last June and was well backed on last month's return at Thirsk (7f, good) when an unlucky ninth; a possible.

stable_tour.quote: He loves a bit of juice in the ground and seven furlongs or an easy mile. I think he could improve again this year, Lope De Vegas tend to do that. 23-04-24

runners.name: Yaaser
runners.owner: Michele Craig And David D Smith
runners.comment: Won at Ayr last time and ran well when third of 16 over C&D last June; each-way shout
runners.spotlight: Tends to start slowly but that didn't stop him winning at Ayr (7f, good) last time; ran well when third of 16 over C&D (good to soft) last June and also effective on fast ground; each-way shout.

quotes.race: Musselburgh Windsor FC Celebrating 70 Years Handicap
quotes.quote: The race didn't set up the way we thought as Joe (Fanning) got to the front and slowed up a bit but Yaaser did it well, he ran as straight as a gun-barrel up the straight. The last time here we probably played too early and we've learnt from that, the more you take him back the more he comes back on the bit. I think you could even play him later as he has a good turn of foot - Jim Goldie, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He looks to be back to his best and his best is very good. He had a good year last year but not quite where we'd had him before. He looked really well in the paddock before he won and showed his wellbeing in the race. He's won some nice races. He likes a strong pace to run at over 7f and I think that's possibly his optimum, but he ran well in the Carlisle Bell over a stiff mile. We've won it before but that race is on our bucket list, but it may be a bit sharp for him at the moment. We'll have a look at York for him because he ran well there last year and a big field over 7f would suit him. 07-05-25

runners.name: Eligible
runners.comment: 9yo; no threat on AW on last 3 starts but today's scenario should suit (won this in 2023)
runners.spotlight: 9yo who hasn't threatened on AW on his last three starts but a big field and a strong pace over this C&D could bring out the best in him, as was the case when he won this in 2023 (good to firm); not discounted.

quotes.race: Yorkshire Equine Practice Handicap
quotes.quote: That was a great ride.The instructions were to drop Eligible in and fill him with confidence, he loves passing horses - David Easterby, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Delicacy
runners.comment: Won on stable debut at Leicester last Saturday; could have plenty more to offer for yard
runners.spotlight: Returned to form on last Saturday's stable debut with 1l win at Leicester (7f, good to firm); trainer does very well with recruits from other yards and she could have plenty more to offer; on the shortlist under 5lb penalty.

quotes.race: AK Bets Best Price Premier League Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Sean gave Delicacy a really sympathetic ride and said she was always in his hands and going well. She's in the sales and I suppose she'll still go as there isn't a race for her before then - Rolf Johnson, owners' representative.

runners.name: Minnesota Lad
runners.comment: Two-time winner (5f/6f) but untested beyond sprint trips and this is a tough race
runners.spotlight: Won at Doncaster (6f, good to firm) last June and some fair AW runs since December (6f/5f); however, this is a hot race in which to test his stamina for 7f and others have more compelling credentials.

runners.name: Stockpyle
runners.comment: Went close at Doncaster in March and has continued in pretty good heart; e-w possibilities
runners.spotlight: Went close in big field at Doncaster (7f, good) in March on second stable start and he's produced positive performances when fifth at Musselburgh (7f, good) and Ripon (1m, good) the next twice; each-way possibilities.

quotes.race: Plan A Consulting Handicap (Chepstow Mile Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: We were going to sell Stockpyle at the July sales, but PJ [McDonald, jockey] said something was troubling him. We took him to the vets and checked him, where we found a huge growth under his epiglottis. It was like having a cork in a bottle and he couldn't breathe, but now his confidence is being rewarded. He's been running some lovely races and has been unlucky not to win more. He's from a very good family and there's more excitement to come - William Muir, joint-trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Another of La Pyle's progeny who is a half-brother to Pyledriver, he did his owners proud this summer by winning twice in four days at Chepstow and Wolverhampton, both over 7f. I love him and having had a tiny injury as a juvenile - a split pastern that healed beautifully - he has made steady progress. He was last of six at Chepstow on Monday but must have the ground just right and when things go his way he looks pretty impressive. Clearly 7f is his trip and there are more wins to come this year. 01-09-22

runners.name: Golden Pharaoh
