runners.comment: Continues to drop down the weights but this year's form has been patchy; 0-9 in Britain
runners.spotlight: Two-time French winner who ran fairly well on his British debut over C&D last June and is now 15lb lower; however, this year's form has been patchy and his claims aren't pressing; wears first-time cheekpieces.

7:15.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; 8.1)

runners.name: Faylaq
runners.owner: B Jordan, Brian Jordan, S Jordan & N Mcconnell
runners.comment: Made all over 1m5f here 12 days ago; apprentice-ridden now; respected
runners.spotlight: Came on from his Musselburgh reappearance when making all under Paul Mulrennan here (1m5f, good to firm) 12 days ago; 1lb wrong under his 4lb penalty, though his new rider claims 7lb; shorter trip not a problem and respected; one of three from yard.

quotes.race: Hampton By Hilton Onsite Hotel Buttonhook Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: Faylaq has got gears and when he's allowed to dominate he's hard to get past. I still see him as an Ebor-type horse, but you have to be high to get in these days. Paul even said the Cesarewitch, and I don't think trip matters to him - Jim Goldie, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfred Mallard Handicap
quotes.quote: I just had to get Faylaq relaxed and it's worked out well. He was travelling so well and he picked up nicely - Amy Waugh, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's an improving nine-year-old as well! His win in the Mallard last year was a career-best for him and he went in again at Hamilton on Sunday when making all. He has got gears and when he's allowed to dominate he's hard to get past. I still see him as an Ebor-type horse, but you have to be high to get in these days. 07-05-25

runners.name: Creatif
runners.comment: 2-5; things didn't pan out his way last time; unexposed and respected back up in trip
runners.spotlight: 1-2 over 1m4f in France and having been gelded/undergone wind surgery, has done well since returning last month, winning easily at Newcastle (1m2f, AW) and finishing second of seven at Redcar (1m2f, good to firm) when things didn't really pan out his way; still unexposed and respected back up in trip.

stable_tour.quote: He's had a wind op since we bought him and it has helped a lot. He won on the all-weather last week when he was still raw and keen. He's bred to be a good horse and he has plenty of ability, so we're quite excited about him. There'll be some nice mile-and-a-half handicaps for him. 14-04-25

runners.name: Per Contra
runners.comment: Won three of first four starts but out of the frame in last four; behind Creatif last time
runners.spotlight: Won three of his first four starts over 7f-1m4f on turf/AW for Ollie Sangster, but out of the frame in his last four including on stable debut at Redcar (1m2f, good to firm) this month when 9l behind Creatif; may have needed the run after 197 days off, but needs plenty more.

stable_tour.quote: I had him in a Listed race at Haydock last Saturday but I didn't run him and I'm now looking at the Champagne and the Royal Lodge - he's probably going to go up to a mile next time. He wasn't that expensive, but he's a big horse and he's shown up well since the spring. We rather expected him to do what he did first time out at Chepstow and then he won easily at Ffos Las. He's only going to improve as he still has plenty of learning to do and I think he's going to be a better horse next year, when he'll probably want a mile and a quarter. I've raced him in relatively Mickey Mouse races so it's hard to get a guide as to how good he is, but I hope he'll do well for the winter. He'll be a stakes horse. 12-09-23

runners.name: Individualism
runners.comment: Twice well held since off the mark at Carlisle last summer; needs to bounce back
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who made all to get off the mark at Carlisle (1m3f, good) last summer, but well held the last twice including on his return from nine months off and wind surgery at Haydock (1m2f, good) 20 days ago; needs to bounce back.

runners.name: Tafsir
runners.comment: Well behind Faylaq here last time, but has won four times here so she could play a part
runners.spotlight: Hard-puller who finished around 9l behind stablemate Faylaq here (1m5f, good to firm) 12 days ago; can't be recommended on that form, but she has won four times here so she could play a part if rediscovering her best.

quotes.race: Racecourse Live Streams On Racing TV Extra Handicap
quotes.quote: Tafsir is a well-bred filly so it's good to get a win, but Paul's given her an absolute peach of a ride. He's gone down the brave man's route down the inside rail and has won quite comfortably in the end. She'll win again, especially with the assistance of Paul. He's top-class - Jim Goldie, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's challenging but she always has been. It's always been onwards and upwards with her and she has her own way of doing things. She probably needs to race herself fit. She probably needs a couple of runs to get there. It could have been a blindfold issue on her penultimate start and she doesn't make it easy for the jockeys as she knows the rhythm of the stalls and she starts to mess about - she plays games. She couldn't make an impression behind Faylaq at Hamilton last time. She was probably the cheapest of Hamdan's cast-offs and it looked like they were right, but now she's won more races than most of them. He bred her to be better than 78, so we don't know if her mark is too high. 07-05-25

runners.name: Letsbefrank
runners.owner: J S Morrison & Ms Carol Morrison
runners.comment: Slow starts have become a habit including in both starts since returning; risky
runners.spotlight: Slow starts have become a bit of a habit and while he got away with it when winning a four-runner event at Pontefract (2m1f, good to firm) last August, he hasn't done so in either start since returning last month; risky.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Build A Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: Letsbefrank is getting very lethargic in his races and he was never on the bridle. He's tough and game, but the Johnston horse got a soft lead and you know they'll always keep going. But this horse keeps digging, he's tough. I'm lucky I'm the one pointing him, but this has been the plan for Jim and his team since the winter. He's had all the races mapped out, credit to him. To win one race is hard but to win three takes some doing - Paul Mulrennan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's been frustrating at the start of this year. We did such a good job with him last year, so it just swings and roundabouts. We've given him a couple of runs and he was a little bit better at Thirsk, but he was still playing games. I've taken my foot off the accelerator a bit and we're treating him for ulcers and various health things. He had quite a hard season last year so maybe we're paying for it, but I'm sure he'll bounce back. He's still got an engine. 07-05-25

runners.name: Whathappensinvegas
runners.comment: Dual winner last year and a close third on last month's Haydock return; possibilities
runners.spotlight: Both wins came over 1m2f/1m3f last year and was back off his last winning mark when beaten less than a length into third of nine on last month's Haydock return (1m2f, good); possibilities.

7:50.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; 8.1)

runners.name: Bodorgan
runners.owner: Julie And David R Martin And Dan Hall

prev_owners.owner: Julie Martin & David R Martin & Partner

runners.comment: 2-15; market should indicate what is expected on stable debut after seven months off
runners.spotlight: 2-15 for Charles Hills, his last win coming at Windsor (1m2f, good to firm) last summer; changed hands for 38,000gns in October and the market should indicate what is expected on stable debut after seven months off.

stable_tour.quote: His form looks pretty good and he's done well despite a problem through the winter. He's back cantering now and he's done nothing wrong. He won a Newmarket novice under Ryan Moore in fine style and we'll look to have him out towards the end of next month. 17-04-23

He progressed with each run last year, winning a 7f novice at Newmarket at the third attempt. That was an impressive win and he did well for the winter break. I brought him back late last month at Haydock, where he was drawn badly in a red-hot running of the Silver Bowl, but he ran a nice race behind Covey. He didn't get into the Britannia off his mark of 87, which was a shame as I I would have dearly loved to see him in the race. But there's a race at Chester for him coming up. 21-06-23

runners.name: Bubbles Wonky
runners.comment: Ran well on his Doncaster reappearance, but still needs to prove that he wants this far
runners.spotlight: Won a heavy-ground Catterick novice (7f) as a 2yo; not beaten far into fifth of 15 on last month's Doncaster return (7f, good; first start since being gelded) in March, but he still needs to prove that he wants this far.

quotes.race: Robert Kemp-Ambler Memorial/British EBF Novice Stakes (Horses With No More Than 3 Runs) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bubbles Wonky obviously has a bit of talent. Tim has experience of the family as he trained his older half-brother Mahanakhon and they're quite similar, he's a very straightforward type of horse. He travelled well and quickened nicely when I let him down - Sean Kirrane, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's training really well and we think he's pretty good. I think a mile is probably his trip and he seems to go well with give in the ground. 23-04-24

runners.name: Bamburgh
runners.comment: Makes handicap debut after eight months off having been gelded; market informative
runners.spotlight: Beautifully bred and showed ability in all three starts over 7f on good to firm/AW last year; makes his handicap debut after eight months off having been gelded in the meantime and the market should be informative.

runners.name: Westernesse
runners.comment: Has won on good to firm ground and no problem with the trip; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: A bit in and out since returning on the AW in February, including a Newcastle success (1m) in March; has won on good to firm ground and no problem with the trip; shortlisted.

stable_tour.quote: I was happy with his first run this year and then it was a tactical race last time. I'm not sure about his trip, I've run over a mile and a quarter a few times and we might run him over shorter. He looks progressive. 19-04-24
He's had a couple of setbacks since we bought him two years ago and he has struggled with his consistency. He's on a bit of a break and will be back for the all-weather season. 26-09-24

runners.name: Starliner
runners.owner: David Orr & Miss L A Perratt
runners.comment: Placed in last three starts off this mark as when second over C&D last time; go well again
runners.spotlight: 2-26, but has been placed in six of his 11 starts since his latest success including all three back on turf off this mark; beaten less than a length into second of eight over C&D (good to firm) 12 days ago and should go well again.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Starliner has been running with credit. We thought he had a chance but he had to do the hard work on his own which leaves you vulnerable. He was good and tough - Gavin Ryan, rider.

runners.name: Freedom Day
runners.comment: 0-14 on the Flat/hurdles since winning a Redcar novice for the Gosdens in April 2023
runners.spotlight: 0-14 on the Flat and over hurdles since winning a Redcar novice for the Gosdens in April 2023; nothing since joining this yard earlier in year to suggest that is about to change.

runners.name: Braes Of Doune
runners.comment: Mainly consistent since winning twice last August; runner-up off this mark last time
runners.spotlight: Stll 6lb higher than for the latest of two wins over 7f/1m last August, but has been mainly consistent in the meantime as when second of six off this mark at Ayr (1m, good to firm) 15 days ago; no problem with the trip and high on list.

6:40.race_name: Prime Secure William Wallace Restricted Maiden Stakes (For Horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
6:40.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; 8.1)

runners.name: Kabuki
runners.comment: 1-1 in bumpers and placed twice over hurdles; will find this a very different test
runners.spotlight: 1-1 in bumpers and placed in two of his six starts over hurdles; will find this a very different test, though, and looks up against it.

stable_tour.quote: He won a bumper on his debut and then ran a nice race at Newbury, where he wasn't right. He came back and ran a nice race at Warwick, and I'd like to think he's a good bit better than his run at Sedgefield last time. He's always worked nicely. 12-11-24

runners.name: Mafting
runners.comment: Clear of the third when runner-up on his Beverley debut; strong chance of going one better
runners.spotlight: Sent off 6-5 favourite when beaten less than a length into second of ten on his Beverley debut (1m2f, good) last month, finishing well clear of the rest (third has won since); the extra furlong should suit and a strong chance of going one better.

runners.name: Me And Bobby Mcgee
runners.comment: Enough appeal on pedigree to make him worth monitoring in the market
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to five winners including Notation (1m-2m AW including Saudi Arabia; RPR 102), Temporize (1m4f-2m4f including AW; 98) and Cool Party (8.5f-2m including 2yo/AW; 97); dam 1m4f-1m6f winner (98); enough appeal on pedigree to make him worth monitoring in the market.

runners.name: Talismans Time
runners.comment: In the frame in both starts last autumn; trip should be within range, but may need the run
runners.spotlight: Ran to a similar level when in the frame at Newcastle (7f, AW) and Redcar (1m, soft) last autumn; gelded since and the longer trip should be within range on breeding, but he may need this after seven months off.

6:05.race_name: British EBF Supports Racing Welfare #mentalhealthawarenessweek Restricted Maiden (Qualifier) (GBB)
6:05.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; 8.1)

runners.name: Believeinthisone
runners.comment: Always behind on his Pontefract debut last month; looks one for later on
runners.spotlight: Sent off 25-1 and was always behind when seventh of nine on his Pontefract debut (5f, good) last month; looks one for later on.

runners.name: Blue Mantle
runners.comment: Bred for further but this trip on a stiff track may suit at this stage of his career
runners.spotlight: March foal by Iffraaj; 12,000gns foal, 30,000euros yearling; half-brother to Flat winners Monty (French 1m1f-1m4f including Group 3; RPR 117), Victory Bond (9.4f/1m2f including AW; 110) and Prewar (French 1m1f/9.5f; 82); dam once-raced half-sister to 12.5f Group 2 winner Ziyad; attractive pedigree and although bred for further, this trip on a stiff track may suit at this stage of his career; watch market.

runners.name: Dacres Cross
runners.comment: Has shown some ability in both starts; doesn't set an insurmountable standard
runners.spotlight: Both starts over 5f on good ground; caught the eye when fifth of eight on last month's Pontefract debut (second and fourth won next time), but didn't really build on it when fourth of eight at Thirsk 13 days ago; sets the standard, albeit not an insurmountable one.

runners.name: Mister Moet
runners.comment: Always behind on his Beverley debut last month; needs a big step forward
runners.spotlight: 125-1 and was always behind when ninth of 12 on his Beverley debut (5f, good) last month; needs a big step forward.

runners.name: Our Boy Harry
runners.comment: Something to like on pedigree, but stable not a noted source of winning 2yo newcomers
runners.spotlight: April foal by Mohaather; half-brother to winners Zabiari (French 6.5f-1m including 2yo Group 3; RPR 105), Zariyannka (French/Czech/Slovakian 1m-1m4f; 105) and Zimaniya (French 7f AW 2yo/1m3f turf); dam Listed-placed 1m winner (including 2yo; 102); something to like on pedigree, but stable wouldn't be a noted source of winning 2yo newcomers.

runners.name: Rathmullan
runners.comment: Apprentice-ridden on debut and stable not known for winning 2yo newcomers
runners.spotlight: March foal by A'Ali; half-brother to winners Back See Daa (1m; RPR 96), Completed (1m AW 2yo; 93) and Fulfilled (1m-1m4f including AW; 87); dam 1m AW winner (83), half-sister to 1m Group 3 winner Zibelina; apprentice-ridden on debut and stable not known for winning 2yo newcomers.

runners.name: Harlequin Bay
runners.comment: Well worth monitoring in the market on debut; holds a Super Sprint entry
runners.spotlight: April foal by Mohaather; 6,000gns yearling; half-brother to winners Lucky Charm (5f AW; RPR 73) and Surfina (Spanish 6.5f/7f including 2yo); dam 5f/6f winner (including 2yo; 86); stable gets its share of 2yo winners first time out and worth monitoring in the market; holds a Super Sprint entry.

runners.name: Kolkata Knight
runners.comment: Worth a market check on debut; holds an entry in the sales race at the York Ebor meeting
runners.spotlight: February foal by Cotai Glory; Â£16,000 yearling; closely related to Danish 7f/1m winner Dark Stream, half-brother to winners La Neide (Italian 5f) and Rabbit Coulsty (Czech 1m); dam unraced half-sister to smart 1m2f-2m winner Angel Gabrial; stable does have 2yo winners first time out and worth a market check; holds an entry in the sales race at the York Ebor meeting.

8:25.race_name: Molton Brown Proud Hamilton Park Partner Handicap
8:25.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; 8.1)

runners.name: Dingwall
runners.comment: Sole win came over 1m2f; drop in trip may not be ideal even on a stiff track
runners.spotlight: 1-11 with his sole success coming at Ayr (1m2f, good; first-time hood) last summer; ran with credit on his return from six months off over the same C&D (good to firm) 15 days ago, but this drop in trip may not be ideal even on a stiff track.

stable_tour.quote: His work has always been very good at home and we've found the key to him after running him over the wrong trip to begin with. He never got involved first time this year over 7f and we tried a mile at Hamilton but he ran far too free in blinkers, so we put a hood on over 1m2f at Ayr and it worked a treat. I couldn't believe he'd slipped down to a mark of 56 as he's a lovely horse and I hope he'll be on an upward curve now. There are plenty of opportunities for him. 26-07-24

runners.name: Cloud Free

prev_owners.owner: D Fish And Mrs J Aldridge

runners.comment: Finished 4l behind Dingwall when well held on stable debut at Ayr last time
runners.spotlight: 1-16, his sole win coming for Michael Bell at Chelmsford (1m, AW) last October; now 1lb lower, but he finished a well-held sixth of eight on stable debut at Ayr (1m2f, good to firm) 15 days ago (4l behind Dingwall).

runners.name: We Still Believe

prev_owners.owner: Sam Farthing, Linda McGarry & Ken Nicol

runners.comment: Course winner who is 2lb higher than when winning at Ayr last summer; each-way shout
runners.spotlight: Three wins apiece on turf/AW including one over a furlong further here; pulled up over hurdles last month but is just 2lb higher than when winning on the Flat at Ayr (1m2f, good to firm) last summer; each-way shout for stable also responsible for Shahnaz.

runners.name: Shahnaz
runners.comment: Won twice last summer including over C&D, but first start in seven months may be needed
runners.spotlight: Won twice last summer including over C&D (good to firm); just 2lb above her last winning mark and her latest Wolverhampton effort not hard to forgive given her AW form doesn't match up, but her record suggests this first start in seven months may be needed.

runners.name: Bay Dream Believer
runners.comment: Back off last winning mark when runner-up at Ripon a week ago; 1lb well in; solid claims
runners.spotlight: Has made the frame in all three visits here and was back off her last winning mark when second of nine at Ripon (1m2f, good) a week ago; already due to go up 1lb for that and solid claims of going one better.

quotes.race: William Hill Betting Done Properly Handicap
quotes.quote: We were unsure as Bay Dream Believer had a 5lb penalty and was only put up 2lb for her last win so it was a bit of a gamble but the prize money was good for the grade and she came out of the race really well. She's only a little pony but she tries hard - trainer Mark Walford.

stable_tour.quote: She's a very small mare but has one of the biggest hearts in training. We expect her to win again this summer - she's been fourth in her last two runs at Nottingham and Pontefract and is knocking on the door. She ran again at Pontefract on Monday, where the draw and a slow start made life very tricky for her. However, she finished powerfully to finish fourth behind Lord Warburton which was a great effort! 14-06-24

runners.name: Ayr Poet
runners.owner: Adam Mills And Jonnie Delta Racing
runners.comment: Triple winner over 1m1f here, but all ten wins have come on good ground or softer
runners.spotlight: 10yo who made an encouraging return when fourth of ten at Ayr (1m2f, good) last month; back off his last winning mark and has run well on good to firm, but all ten wins (including three over 1m1f here) have come on good ground or softer; one of three from yard.

quotes.race: Bet At racingtv.com Amateur Jockeys' Handicap
quotes.quote: Ayr Poet was super and took me the full way. I just sat there and he did his job. I thought coming to the two-furlong pole that he's travelling very well and then I thought today might be the day for that first winner. Jim said let him jump and sit handy and if not, don't panic and he'd be good for me. There's no racing in my family at all and I'm continuing as an amateur as I'm a bit heavy for an apprentice licence, but Jim's been so generous in helping young people like me progress - Megan Davies, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Tennent's Lager Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: I thought we had it on the line but we did it the tough way. Ayr Poet knows where the winning post is here. He's a good doer and is from a family we've done well with here, as he's the fourth winner out of his dam, with Euchen Glen and Sir Chauvelin both running this week too - Jim Goldie, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: His brother wasn't too bad as a 12-year-old and I'm sure he'd be quite good as a 13-year-old if I kept him going. He'll win more races, I wouldn't be keeping him going if I didn't think I could. It's been a very lucky family for me. 07-05-25

runners.name: Hostelry
runners.breeder: J A Knox And Mrs M A Knox

prev_owners.owner: J A Knox and Mrs M A Knox

runners.comment: In good form under Kaiya Fraser recently (123) and another big run is likely
runners.spotlight: Placed twice off this mark since returning to winning form at Nottingham (1m, good) last month (all three starts under Kaiya Fraser), looking unfortunate not to go even closer when third of six at Ayr (1m, good to firm) this month; another big run is likely.

stable_tour.quote: She's a consistent miler who has won five and come second 13 times. She had a winter break and returned to Southwell last month, where she ran well considering the time off. I'm looking at a race for her at Nottingham on Saturday. 09-04-25

runners.name: Yellow Lemons
runners.comment: Unplaced all seven starts, the latest over C&D 12 days ago; improvement needed
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all seven starts, the latest when sixth of eight on her return from nine months off over C&D (good to firm) 12 days ago; improvement needed.

runners.name: Desert Dream
runners.comment: Back off last winning mark, but this trip and the prospect of fast ground poses a question
runners.spotlight: Veteran who is back off the same mark as for the last of three wins over 7f last year; this trip and the prospect of fast ground poses a question.

quotes.race: totequadpot Insure Your Last Four Maiden Stakes
quotes.quote: Pat gave Desert Dream a good ride. We'll run him over further in handicaps now. The ground was perfect. Absolutely perfect - Sir Evelyn De Rothschild, owner-breeder.

runners.name: Jumeira Vision
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd And Partner
runners.comment: C&D winner who is back off the same mark as when last successful; a case can be made
runners.spotlight: Completed a hat-trick on ground ranging from good to soft to good to firm last summer, the last leg coming over C&D off 4lb higher; inconsistent since, but is off the same mark as when winning at Wolverhampton (9.5f, AW) in December; a case can be made.

quotes.race: Visit racingtv.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Sam James gave Jumeira Vision him a wonderful ride, he was very tough but Sam did think he had a bit left in the tank at the finish. It was a bit of a shock when Jumeira Vision won last time, although Katie has always said he works well at home. It's more that the conditions haven't been right until now - Craig Talbot, owners' spokesperson.

quotes.race: Woodsmith Construction Straight Mile 'Confined' Handicap (No Win In 2024) (Straight Mile Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I didn't really go into it with any plan. Katie said Jumeira Vision had been working well at home but wasn't showing it on the track, so ride him as I found him. I put my hands on his neck and it worked out! Sometimes we make too much [of the rail bias], but I do think it's an advantage getting on to those tyre tracks. You're still not going to win if you don't have the horse, however, and he travelled well to get there in the first place - Sam James, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Ring Of Gold
runners.comment: Second last time, but record of 0-18 on turf and losing run of 26 sound a note of caution
runners.spotlight: Ran well when second of seven at Nottingham (1m, good) last month (first and sixth have won since) and races off the same mark, but a record of 0-18 on turf and a losing run of 26 sound a note of caution.

runners.name: Zumaaty
runners.comment: C&D winner; seems to needs a softer surface these days
runners.spotlight: Just 1lb higher than when winning over C&D (good to soft) last September; rarely seen on fast ground and although he has run well on it, he seems to needs a softer surface these days.

quotes.race: virginbet.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Zumaaty got there in plenty of time and went through the race nicely. He's broken his maiden too, which is a good thing - Iain Jardine, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: It's taken a wee while to get to know him- he came with a few issues and it's taken a while to get them ironed out. I was starting to think there might not be a day in him but he won last time at Hamilton, where Kaiya Fraser gave him a nice ride. I hope he can follow up at Musselburgh on Wednesday now he's got his head in front. 02-10-24

9:00.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; 8.1)

runners.name: Back Tomorrow
runners.owner: N J Dalgarno & W R Ellis
runners.comment: 0-11 on turf, albeit she ran well when third over 5f at Ayr last time; 6f suits her better
runners.spotlight: Habitual slow-starter who is 5-17 on the AW and 0-11 on turf, albeit she ran well when beaten just over a length into third of six at Ayr (5f, good to firm) 15 days ago; this trip suits her better and she's one of the likelier winners.

runners.name: Ishe Worth Agamble
runners.comment: Off the mark at the 13th attempt on Leicester return; holds stronger claims than most
runners.spotlight: Made it 13th-time lucky on his return from 133 days off at Leicester (6f, good to firm) six days ago; not sure this will pan out the same way with no established front-runner in the field, but he still holds stronger claims than most.

runners.name: Black Cab
runners.comment: Changed stables since winning at Wolverhampton last month; remains unexposed
runners.spotlight: Made it sixth-time lucky for Jamie Osborne when winning narrowly at Wolverhampton (6f, AW) last month; picked up for 10,000gns this month and has something to prove back on turf on stable debut, but he remains unexposed.

runners.name: Rain Cap
runners.comment: C&D winner; feasibly treated on form as recently as last autumn
runners.spotlight: Seven wins including one over C&D; losing run is up to 16 and he finished behind Black Cab at Wolverhampton (6f, AW) last time, but still feasibly treated on form as recently as last autumn.

runners.name: Bernie The Bear
runners.comment: 0-14 on turf and losing run up to 27; others are more persuasive
runners.spotlight: Has gone close a couple of times on the AW since last autumn, but is 0-14 on turf and losing run is up to 27; others are more persuasive.

runners.name: Ignac Lamar
runners.owner: Lets Be Lucky Racing 35 & Adam Scott
runners.comment: Close third at Musselburgh last time, but 0-16 on turf and may need further than this now
runners.spotlight: Rated much lower on turf (0-16) than on the AW (4-24); beaten less than a length into third of eight at Musselburgh (7f, good) a fortnight ago but may need further than 6f now; stable also runs Thunderstorm Katie.

runners.name: Thunderstorm Katie
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs P & J Hopper, Mrs M Morris
runners.comment: Unplaced in all nine starts and makes limited appeal back from 134 days off
runners.spotlight: Has hinted at ability, but unplaced in all nine starts and makes limited appeal back from 134 days off.

5:35.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; 8.1)

runners.name: Match Play
runners.comment: C&D winner who remains 9lb below his last winning mark and is respected; blinkers on
runners.spotlight: C&D winner who has been performing better of late, going down by just a head and a neck when third of ten at Redcar (5f, good to firm) 15 days ago; 1lb rise for that still leaves him 9lb below his last winning mark and blinkers are given a go this time; respected.

stable_tour.quote: I was delighted with him at Leicester, he came home well and will step up to six furlongs at York. 10-05-22

runners.name: Newyorkstateofmind
runners.comment: Record over C&D reads 112 and only found a well-handicapped rival too good last time
runners.spotlight: Lost his unbeaten course record in reapplied cheekpieces when second of four over C&D (good to firm) 12 days ago, but he was the only one to make a race of it with a well-handicapped rival; high on list from the same mark with conditions likely to be ideal.

quotes.race: Read Katie Walsh On Betway Insider Handicap
quotes.quote: Newyorkstateofmind picked up for me in the straight, he's very honest and genuine. The gap opened up for us. He's been in great form lately - Ray Dawson.

stable_tour.quote: Three wins from 13 races last year was a nice return for this fellow, two on the all-weather and one on grass. Six of his nine wins have been on the all-weather and when it comes to the turf, he has to have theound fast. He was a bit disappointing when he returned to Wolverhampton from his winter break, but it is onwards and upwards. There's a race at Thirsk on Saturday that looks right for him. 09-04-25

runners.name: Kyber Crystal
runners.comment: C&D winner; held off this mark at Catterick last time; may find one or two too good again
runners.spotlight: C&D winner last September (good to soft) and made a successful reappearance at Musselburgh (5f, good) last month, but only fifth of 13 off this mark at Catterick (5f, good to firm) three weeks later; may find one or two too good again; cheekpieces return.

quotes.race: Every Race Live On Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: We kept it simple and got the job done. Kyber Crystal has plenty of form on soft ground, so hopefully we should have some fun with her through the autumn - Rebecca Menzies, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Refuge
runners.comment: Record over C&D reads 0111013235 and is 1lb below last winning mark; respected back here
runners.spotlight: Record over C&D reads 0111013235 and is 1lb lower than when winning at Beverley (5f, good to firm) last summer; finished behind Kyber Crystal at Catterick (5f, good to firm) last month, but he was returning from 209 days off so may fare better this time.

runners.name: Woohoo
runners.comment: Not beaten far on second start for the yard at Catterick on Monday; stiffer track may suit
runners.spotlight: 0-9, but was having only her second start for this yard when beaten 2l into fifth of 15 at Catterick (5f, good to firm) on Monday; shaped as though this stiffer track might suit and one for the shortlist.

runners.name: Royal Duke
runners.comment: 1-13; return to this trip should suit but good to firm ground remains a moot point
runners.spotlight: 1-13, the win coming when getting the better of Kyber Crystal at Musselburgh (5f, good) last October; return to this trip should suit, but good to firm ground remains a moot point.

runners.name: Fumbleinthejungle
runners.comment: Off 1072 days before last of ten on stable debut at Redcar this month; hard to recommend
runners.spotlight: Didn't show much in three starts for Mick Channon in May 2022 and was off for 1072 days before finishing last of ten on stable/handicap debut at Redcar (5f, good to firm; 100-1) this month; yard won this last year, but nothing to recommend him otherwise.

runners.name: Chester Le Streak
runners.comment: Not shown much in three starts for this yard since returning from 18 months off in March
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 5f/6f for Craig Lidster in 2023, but not shown much in three starts for this yard since returning from 18 months off in March; something to prove.

6:55.race_name: Huyton Asphalt Franny Blennerhassett Memorial Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Fantastic Lady
runners.comment: Smart mare; not much went to plan last season but she's well handicapped now
runners.spotlight: Smart mare who ended 2023-24 season in career-best form, winning Sandown Grade 2 (2m6f, good); not much went to plan last term but she was going well until bad jumping error knocked the stuffing out of her in last month's Topham over the big fences here and she remains well handicapped.

quotes.race: Randox Supports Race Against Dementia Topham Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a great run, tremendous. Fantastic Lady was going well going to the last but the other horse just pulled out a bit more. She wouldn't really want that ground but she's got through it. I expect she'll come back here, she jumped for fun all the way - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Bud Booth Mares' Chase (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've had a couple of goes in this race for the same owners but with a different mare (Casablanca Mix) so it's fantastic to finally be able to put it to bed! I thought Fantastic Lady was very gutsy. She got knocked over at the first fence on her last start in the Topham Chase and took a bit of time to work up today, but she's very professional and will only improve. She'll handle most ground so she looks a nice one for this sphere and beyond - Nico De Boinville, rider.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet EBF Mares' "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (EBF Mares' NH Novices' Hurdle Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Fantastic Lady travelled and jumped brilliantly. She was unlucky to tip up last time. She was the one to beat and a very straightforward ride. She has plenty of scope and should keep progressing - Aidan Coleman, rider.

stable_tour.quote: We have some mares' races lined up for her and she's going great. We mentioned the Grand National is something we're keeping our eye on because she'll get into the race after winning the Grade 2 Oaksey Chase at Sandown in April. I hope that'll be the plan and she can have another fruitful campaign. 22-10-24

runners.name: Sail Away
runners.breeder: S A R L Phoenix Eventing
runners.owner: Mr And Mrs J D Cotton
runners.comment: Went close in series final in March and had ground excuse last time; major player
runners.spotlight: Drew a blank and was unable to replicate his best form last season but went close off much reduced mark in series final at Warwick (3m, good) in March; probably not ideally suited by the soft ground when slightly below that form at Bangor last month and can play a major role here.

quotes.race: CPMS Novices' Champion Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We won this three years ago with Molly The Dolly and we've had it in mind we wanted to come back for it with Sail Away. I had him entered for the Scottish National but that may be next year. He loves nice ground, his jumping counted for a lot and he was a fresh horse. He'll probably go for the Summer Cup at Uttoxeter unless the ground is particularly quick - Dan Skelton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's won some decent races but he had a crashing fall at Newbury last week, having shown plenty of enthusiasm beforehand. His chances will come when the handicapper gives him a break, over two and a half to three miles on decent ground. 12-11-24

runners.name: The Wolf

prev_owners.owner: McNeill Family and Prodec Networks Ltd

runners.comment: Second in three small-field chases towards end of last season; likely to run well again
runners.spotlight: No longer the force of old and not always a fluent jumper but won two chases in November (2m7f/2m6f) and was runner-up in three small-field races towards end of last season; suited by good ground and will probably give another good account.

quotes.race: Racecourse Live Streams On Racing TV Extra Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The Wolf absolutely winged round for a circuit but we came round to the water jump and I thought I'd get a breather into him but he jammed the brakes on and I thought after that I'd probably be cooked. However, he showed a good attitude today, just winning probably helps those older horses and, obviously a veterans' chase last time he was able to get his head in front and he followed up today. He's a character but he's been a good servant for the yard - Sean Bowen, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Lord Sparky Veterans' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I can't remember the last time The Wolf won but he jumped well today on the whole and these races are why we kept him in training - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: CD Racing At tipstersempire.co.uk Beginners' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It rode a proper race, we got racing early and I couldn't have been more pleased with The Wolf. I was a little bit disappointed he got beat the last day but that's definitely more like it and hopefully he can progress over fences. I didn't want to be racing from the top of the straight with five fences to go, I knew I'd be able to rely on his jumping and have a crack at the last - winning rider Adrian Heskin.

stable_tour.quote: He's had a wind op since his run in the Scottish National and has loads of ability. He ran a cracker at Cheltenham on Saturday. He didn't jump well to start and didn't make it easy for himself but he'll go for the Becher Chase now. He'll win a nice one at some point - I'm sure he'll do it when we least expect it. If he does win a nice race, he may sneak into the bottom weights for the Grand National. 27-10-22

This talented handicapper hasn't won for a couple of seasons but you can't knock his resolve as he has run well in defeat, notably first time out this season when second to Lord Accord at Cheltenham. He heads there again on New Year's Day for the 3m2f handicap chase. Last time out in the Becher Chase he was a bit sticky early on and got detached, but he'll be much better suited to a smaller field at Cheltenham. 22-12-22

runners.name: Only The Bold
runners.comment: In process of running well before chance-ending jumping error on stable debut
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on final three starts for David Pipe in 2023-24 season but, following a layoff, was in process of running well for new stable before chance-ending jumping error in home straight at Ludlow (3m1f, good to soft) in December; not seen again since and not sure to be ideally suited by the faster ground here but remains well handicapped on old form.

stable_tour.quote: He won his first two starts for us, but the ground was not as soft as they said it was at Haydock on his third run and he was run off his feet a little bit over two and a half miles. He'll be aimed at long-distance chases this term and, while he's not the biggest, he's got a good attitude. 31-10-23

As a youngster he beat Tommy's Oscar by nine lengths in a point-to-point, and as a result he went for a lot of money to join Evan Williams. He had a couple of seasons with Evan before coming here and he has really thrived since arriving at Pond House. You never know what can bring about a horse's improvement but often a new environment does the job and also I think he was on a nice handicap mark (117). I thought he would go well in his first run for us at Bangor, and he won nicely by nine lengths, but I was even more impressed with him on his second outing at Hereford, where he won a better race. The handicapper has raised him a further 10lb for that run (20 lb in two runs) and I don't think we have seen the best of him yet. He is still a novice and we will look for a nice long-distance novice chase, or handicap for him next. The ground has dried out since his last win and he is definitely a horse who prefers some nice cut, so we could not have run him anyway. He will need another run to get in the big handicaps at Cheltenham or Aintree, but I am not sure whether they would suit him at this stage. I would suggest readers keep this fellow on their side now he is on the up again. 22-02-23

runners.name: Stormin Crossgales
runners.comment: Won two-runner claimer last month; has much more on his plate here; stable debut
runners.spotlight: Three chase wins for the Pogson stable last season, the latest in two-runner Fakenham claimer (2m5f, good) last month; subsequetly joined Max Young for Â£5,000; has considerably more on his plate in this good-quality handicap; tries a new trip.

quotes.race: Jordan Road Planning Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: That was brilliant - if Noel Fehily doesn't send us a horse now, he never will! We got Stormin Crossgales for 5,000GBP from Doncaster Sales, and it's taken a bit of time to get to know him. I kept the headgear on for a while as that's what he had on before, but taking it off has really worked. His jumping is key, and that's what wins races for him. To jump and stay 2m4f on that ground is unbelievable - Adam Pogson, joint trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Never Ordinary At bet365 Handicap Chase (Go North One Man Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Stormin Crossgales just needed a bit of confidence. He had a hood and a tongue strap and we've taken the whole lot off. You've got to ride him positively and he's a strong stayer over two miles. It takes some winning round here, making the running like that - Adam Pogson, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Price Boosts Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The whole race was working out perfectly, I was settled and Stormin Crossgales was jumping great but the saddle just went completely sideways and I couldn't get my right leg out. I thought for a second I was coming off him. Somehow I slipped my right foot out and we were still in front, which was the main thing. He stayed straight thankfully, if he jinked or anything I was a goner - Jack Hogan, jockey, talking to RacingTV.

quotes.race: Colin Lewis Memorial Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Stormin Crossgales is not an easy ride and wouldn't settle in his bumpers. He's a lovely horse who is only a frame of a horse - you won't see the best of him until next year. We thought we'd be hurdling now and chasing this time next year, but we kicked on and he's an out-and-out chaser. He'll get bigger and stronger as he gets older. He's a big baby who likes nice ground, but he will cope with slower ground when he gets older - Dave Crosse, owners' representative.

runners.name: Finn Lough
runners.comment: Dual 3m winner since cheekpieces were added in December; could have a say in blinkers here
runners.spotlight: Dual 3m chase winner since cheekpieces were added in December and posted sound effort when second of four at Carlisle (3m, good) last month; up in grade and 1lb out of the weights for this first run in blinkers but still considered.

quotes.race: attheraces.com/marketmovers Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Finn Lough doesn't like to be in front too soon. The thinking was to run him in a better race with more pace on. We were going quick enough and I was taking my time. I knew I'd got the horse but it was whether I could get it out of him. And today it's worked well. The cheekpieces helped but the main thing was riding him as he wanted - Henry Brooke, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: One of our better novice hurdlers for the season, he came from Harley Dunne having won his only point-to-point in Ireland. He was lucky as the two horses in front of him fell two out, but he was going just as well and everyone here seems to think he's as nice as Making Headway, if not nicer. 01-11-23

6:20.race_name: Mental Health Awareness Week Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Rambo T
runners.comment: Career-best form when leading close home at Perth last month; likely contender
runners.spotlight: Won a small-field chase in the autumn but posted his career-best performance when back over hurdles last month, keeping on strongly from off the pace to lead close home at Perth (2m4f, good to soft); also suited by good ground; likely contender.

quotes.race: Stan Mellor Memorial Beginners' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I don't think Rambo T liked making the running to be honest. Uttoxeter, two miles is a lovely place to get a horse started. He got a nice bit of experience that day and we got beat, but that stood him in good stead. He's been a real fun horse for connections and hopefully he'll carry on improving - Ollie Murphy, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well when second on his chase debut over an inadequate trip at Uttoxeter and will be stepped up to two and a half miles. He's going to be a really fun middle-distance chaser. 24-10-24

He won very well at Newton Abbot and ran well when third at Cheltenham last week. He looks progressive and we could go over fences with him later in the season, but we'll go for one last run over hurdles and try to win a nice pot. 01-11-23

runners.name: Aucunrisque
runners.breeder: L Lafitte, H Barus & P Lafitte
runners.comment: Ended last season with two good 2m runs (hurdle/chase); well worth another crack at 2m4f
runners.spotlight: Not quite as good as he was but still a useful performer; second off today's mark on latest hurdling start at Newbury (2m, good to soft) in March and also ran well when third in Sussex Champion Chase at Plumpton (2m1f, good) last month; well worth another crack at 2m4f; probably won't be far away.

quotes.race: LK Bennett Autumn Collection Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: They went off like the clappers to start off with and I was the first off the bridle. Aucunrisque always puts in a good race and he's a good, tough horse - Freddie Gordon, jockey.

quotes.race: Betfair Hurdle (Handicap) (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We'll go for the Grand Annual with him now. Aucunrisque is a wonderful, tough, consistent horse who gives me no issues at all. It makes life so easier when he's straightforward. I thought about going for the Lightning Novices' Chase at Doncaster, but I didn't want to pick up a couple more pounds in the handicap - Chris Gordon, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing On Sky 415 Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was just a huge relief as Aucunrisque was a bit unlucky to get beaten last time and it was very painful. We thought we'd keep it simple and pop out in front. He's very straightforward. He's a good jumper but he's not the biggest in the world. He might jump a fence but if he doesn't he'll be a smashing hurdler. He's got solid form all the way through and backed it up - Chris Gordon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: His long-term plan had been the Graduation Chase at Carlisle but it was called off due to the weather, so his run at Ascot was a back-up option. He seems in good form and it's great to contest some valuable races with him, but his handicap mark makes things tricky. He's a better-ground horse and he's not very big, so he's largely kept to hurdles, and he just showed his novicey side on Saturday over fences. He finished well though and two miles is probably his trip, so we just need to harden him up a little bit. I think we'll keep him over fences for now as Rex [Dingle] thinks there's very much a chaser in there. 27-11-23

I'd love to go up to Kelso with him for the Morebattle Hurdle on Saturday but we'd need the ground to dry up for him. He's a good-ground horse and conditions went against him at Newbury last time. If he doesn't go to Kelso, we might just have a day out at Cheltenham for a bit of fun - he's entered in the County Hurdle. He's effective on good ground or quicker and I think the Sussex Champion Hurdle at Plumpton in April would be a good aim. He won it three years ago. 26-02-25

runners.name: Pyramid Place
runners.comment: Shock winner of this race in 2024; needs to better his recent efforts, though
runners.spotlight: Caused 66-1 shock in this race for Harriet Dickin in 2024 (good ground) and looked in even better nick when easy winner at Kempton (2m5f, good) for Olly Murphy in November; needs to up his game after some quiet runs this year, though, and stablemate Rambo T has much less to prove.

quotes.race: William Hill Cumbria Crystal Cup Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We bought Pyramid Place off John Gosden and he's had a few issues but he's really holding his form together. It was a quick return for him because he ran at Newton Abbot a few days ago and he needs a pace to aim at - Milton Harris, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He did us proud last season, winning three times over hurdles, and despite not adding to his tally this term he has run well in defeat, notably when second at Chepstow and third at Doncaster. Unfortunately, he bled last time at Fontwell and was pulled up, so we have given him some time to get over those exertions. He's in good order now and could go for the same race as Global Agreement at Lingfield this weekend. His preference is for better ground and, although he'll jump a fence, we'll stick to hurdles for the rest of this season. 19-01-22

runners.name: Ike Sport
runners.comment: Failed to win last season but ran well in two competitive handicaps in April; good chance
runners.spotlight: Failed to win last season but was very respectable fifth of 20 over C&D (good to soft; first run in today's headgear combination) in hot handicap at last month's Grand National meeting and again ran well when fourth at Sandown (2m4f, good) three weeks ago; good chance.

stable_tour.quote: He's in good form after winning a big handicap chase for us last time out. Like Any News, we won't be running him on the winter ground but the plan will be to have him back out again before the end of the season. He's done very little wrong for us and I think he can step up again. 27-11-23

He's solid and very consistent. He'll go chasing after May 1. There's nothing major jumping out for him at any of the festivals. He had a rating of 116 before he last ran. He's done very little wrong and it was a Â£70,000 race he won last time out. He's a six-year-old who jumps, stays and has a big heart, so now is the natural time to go chasing. He cost only Â£16,000. We could end up targeting him towards the Summer Plate or something similar. 06-03-24

runners.name: Fingals Hill
runners.comment: In-form front-runner; on fairly tough mark now but may enjoy an uncontested lead
runners.spotlight: Made all to score by 6l at Newcastle (2m4f, good) in March, his sixth hurdle win, and probably bettered that performance when close second at Kelso (2m5f, good) last month; could be vulnerable after latest 2lb nudge but, on the other hand, may not face much competition for the lead here.

quotes.race: Castletown Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I only have two horses so how could I be confident but Fingal's Hill is a good trier - we'll get to the bottom of him eventually but he keeps trying - Peter Atkinson, trainer.

runners.name: Arclight
runners.comment: Steadied the ship with respectable run at Cheltenham last month; still well handicapped
runners.spotlight: Looked out of sorts on all three appearances in 2024 but, following a break, steadied the ship with respectable sixth of 16 at Cheltenham (2m1f, good) last month; it's hard to tell whether she'll build on that performance here but she remains well handicapped and will be fine over the longer trip.

quotes.race: Trustatrader Fully Vetted Tradespeople Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: All credit to Nico, it was his idea [to go chasing] and Arclight was very good. She had all the allowances and it's why you need a good jockey like that who is thinking. We've got to do the same thing next time because you've still got all the allowances; she's always going to be a mare, but she's not always going to be a four-year-old. Walking out of the saddling box I said she should be going down to the starting stalls, not jumping fences because she's a Flat-bred, but she was on springs. Until the last, she was excellent. She needs that better ground and it's beautiful ground for these types - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Play Coral "Racing-Super-Series" For Free Fillies' Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Arclight is a sweet filly and, as Nico says, she is very game and genuine. She handled that but I can't believe she liked it. There is a four year old fillies' Listed race at Doncaster on Friday week. I think now that if all was right we go there to get a bit of black type, then it's a different ball game altogether - winning trainer Nicky Henderson.

quotes.race: bet365 Fillies' Juvenile Maiden Hurdle (Go North Grey Bomber Juvenile Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB)
quotes.quote: We're really pleased with that. Arclight will learn from that, we'll give her another run and the Boodles is a possibility if she's good enough. But she's very straightforward and fingers crossed we've got something decent - syndicate leader, David Sumpter.

stable_tour.quote: She's been a little star and has grown and strengthened up considerably over the summer. She made a good start over hurdles and it was Nico's [de Boinville] idea to try her over fences last season. I thought it was a brave shout, but she was absolutely brilliant and won three of her four starts. If it wasn't for an injury she would have been out in the spring, but we look to resume over fences and she has a very bright future. 22-10-24

runners.name: Asta La Pasta
runners.comment: Gained both chase wins by wide margins in small fields; ended last season with a poor run
runners.spotlight: Dual chase winner last season (2m4f/2m), both times by wide margins in small fields; suited by good ground but ran poorly when last in action and still needs to prove he can cope with this career-high mark.

quotes.race: Seko Logistics Scotland Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The race never really materialised and I'll have a think about whether to run Asta La Pasta tomorrow - Dan Skelton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been looking like he's not quite staying over two and a half miles, so it might be that we drop back in trip for the Grand Annual. He's had plenty of experience for a novice, so that shouldn't be a concern.  10-2-24

runners.name: Flic Ou Voyou
runners.comment: Resurgent veteran who was creditable second in valuable series final last month
runners.spotlight: Resurgent 11yo who won three 2m4f chases last season and was creditable second in valuable series final for veterans at Haydock (2m4f, good) last month; can't be ignored in current form.

quotes.race: Val And Kath Bollado Memorial Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Flic Ou Voyou is dependent on good ground, that's why we gave him a layoff. I'm glad that he's done it as well as he did, apart from when I look at what the handicapper does with him! - Henry Hogarth, trainer.

quotes.race: JenningsBet Bracknell Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Flic Ou Voyou can go to Ayr for something at the Scottish National meeting in April as he needs fast ground - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: John Ayres Memorial Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Flic Ou Voyou's jumping let him down a couple of times last season, we did a lot of work on it. He loves that ground, looked fresh and well. He had a nice weight and I thought he'd win today, he had everything in his favour. It's a nice prize to win with him - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: EBF Stallions "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Flic Ou Voyou has now won three and that was just an exercise canter for him. We'll try and find a better race for him now. I'm not sure where yet - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet 3 Uniboosts A Day Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Flic Ou Voyou was a big, backward horse last year, but just needed time. He's going to run at Newton Abbot on Sunday and I was going to run once and then go chasing, but if he's improving he might just win a nice novice hurdle - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: For a big horse he wasn't the most fluent of jumpers last season, but we have done a lot of work in that department this autumn and it paid off as he came out and jumped nicely to win at Chepstow. I fancied him strongly as everything was in his favour; he wants 2m4f on decent ground. Rarely runs two races alike and was below that form at Wetherby three days ago; the fences there were slightly stiffer than at Chepstow and he got caught out by one. Is ideally suited by a small field and provided I place him right he should win again. 31-10-22

runners.name: Tedley
runners.comment: Took well to fences last season and today's drop back in trip looks the right move
runners.spotlight: Launched chasing career with two wins in the autumn (2m/2m3f. good to soft/good) and generally remained in good form until end of last season; looked a non-stayer over 2m7f on latest outing and now drops back in trip with usual cheekpieces refitted; recent 3lb drop gives him a decent chance.

quotes.race: Bet Boost At bet365 Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Tedley jumped even better than he did last time, I think he's a lovely horse - Jim Old, trainer's representative.

runners.name: Prince Escalus

prev_owners.owner: The As You Like It Syndicate

runners.comment: Returned from absence with quite encouraging run last month; well handicapped now
runners.spotlight: Missed most of last season but returned from nine-month break with quite encouraging third (albeit well held in the end) at Perth (2m, good to soft) last month; on a good mark and will also be suited by today's trip-and-ground combination; contender if that recent outing has brought him on.

stable_tour.quote: He progressed well last season but is going to pay for it this season as a result. We'll have to pick and choose our races carefully. He's versatile between two miles and two and a half, and hopefully he can pick up a race. 25-10-22

runners.name: Sainte Doctor
runners.comment: Back in prime form towards end of last season (three wins); probably in the mix again here
runners.spotlight: Back in prime form towards end of last season, winning three in a row (2m4f-2m6f) before creditable second in valuable series final at Cheltenham (3m1f, good); ought to be right in the thick of things again here.

quotes.race: Â£50,000 Queen Boudicca Series Qualifier Mares' Handicap Chase (Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's very satisfying to get Sainte Doctor back in the winner's enclosure and I've won on her a few times now. She has had her problems but we've ironed them out and that was a lovely performance - Richie McLernon, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: She's just come back in and will be ready to run in the summer. She's won two of her last three starts, so her form looks good. She won by 15 lengths at Plumpton last time. She's a nice mare and hopefully she can remain competitive. 06-03-24

runners.name: Malaita
runners.comment: Looked stretched by 3m1f a Cheltenham last month but still ran well; enters calculations
runners.spotlight: Collected good prize at Cheltenham (2m4f, good) at end of 2023-24 season and ran well until stamina ebbed away over 3m1f there last month; drops back in trip today and enter calculations.

quotes.race: British EBF Mares' Novices' Limited Handicap Chase Final (Grade 2) (Series Final) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Malaita is a lovely mare but we've always been a bit up against it with the ground. She wears her heart on her sleeve - Mel Rowley, trainer.

quotes.race: NAF Challenger Series Mares' Hurdle Final Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Malaita went a bit weak so we backed off for a bit. She won a nice race at Carlisle and seems to be back on track now. Time has helped us a bit and hopefully she's exciting. We were coming here off a low weight and I didn't even know if we'd get in, and in these big races it's tough. She'll go over fences, she jumps like a stag - Mel Rowley, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's been a revelation for us. She came of age at the end of the season before last and continued it through the last campaign. We'll see the best of her in the spring as she seems to thrive on that better ground, but we'll do our best to find the ideal conditions at this time of year. She ran well for a long way at Cheltenham last time but carried a ridiculous amount of weight and folded two from home. We weren't too disappointed as it was obvious that was the reason. She's a light-framed mare who jumps in an exuberant manner, so she doesn't save anything for herself at all. We've got to make sure we place her in such a way that she isn't carrying lumps of weight on the wrong ground. She's won twice at Cheltenham's April meeting, including a Grade 2 mares' novice handicap chase last season. If there's a race at that meeting again, we'll certainly be looking at it. 16-01-25

8:40.race_name: Pendle Capital "Point-To-Point" Bumper Standard NH Flat Race (Amateurs') (Cat 1 Elimination) (GBB)

runners.name: Call Me Early
runners.comment: 3-4 in British points; stout pedigree raises doubts about suitability of this test
runners.spotlight: Stoutly bred 5yo who is 3-4 in British points, albeit he beat only one rival in a hunt members' contest last month; evidently has significant ability but may find this an inadequate stamina test.

runners.name: Cal Ok
runners.comment: Led close home to beat Magna Patch in Sandon point bumper last month
runners.spotlight: Out of a bumper winner and bettered his debut effort when pipping Magna Patch in good-ground point bumper at Sandon last month; enters calculations.

runners.name: Catch Me Quick
runners.comment: Ex-Irish 5yo; won 14-runner Cothelstone maiden on British debut in March
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in two Irish points last year and drew 4l clear to win 14-runner Cothelstone maiden (good ground) on British debut two months ago; pedigree offers hope this shorter trip will suit; a possible.

runners.name: Couer Dalene
runners.comment: Point winner; close second of four behind Amatchmadeinheaven on rules debut at Exeter
runners.spotlight: Flat-bred 5yo who won soft-ground maiden point at Kingston Blount by 12l in February and was close second of four behind Amatchmadeinheaven on rules debut at Exeter (good to firm) the following month; better off at the weights with that rival here; no surprise if he features.

runners.name: Jack Torrance
runners.comment: Beaten in two point bumpers this spring and not the most obvious answer here
runners.spotlight: Out of a well-connected and useful French Flat winner; second of four in a point bumper on debut in March but managed only fifth of nine at Bitterley last month; not the most obvious answer.

runners.name: Magna Patch
runners.comment: Collared only in closing stages by Cal OK after bold bid from the front in a point bumper
runners.spotlight: Out of a winning sprinter; collared only in closing stages by Cal OK after running well from the front in good-ground point bumper at Sandon last month; stable has won this race before; could have a say.

runners.name: Perseo
runners.comment: Won a point bumper in December but beaten in two maiden points over jumps since
runners.spotlight: Won good-ground point bumper at Larkhill in December but beaten in two maiden points over jumps since and not on the shortlist today.

runners.name: Tufton
runners.comment: Placed in a point bumper; well beaten when falling last time but stable is respected
runners.spotlight: Just a respectable third in Maisemore Park point bumper (good ground) on debut in March and looked well beaten when falling in a maiden point last month; not easily recommended on that evidence but his respected stable won two of the last four editions of this race.

runners.name: Amatchmadeinheaven
runners.comment: Won Larkhill point bumper on debut and followed up under rules at Exeter later in March
runners.spotlight: First foal from a fair Flat/hurdle winner; made all to win good-ground Larkhill point bumper by 8l on debut in March and beat Couer d'Alene and Lady Kloppenheim in small field at Exeter (good to firm) later that month; has penalty to shoulder here but should go well again.

runners.name: Lets Go Harry
runners.owner: Mrs Jackie Teal & Mrs Rita Williams

prev_owners.owner: Jack Teal, Rita Williams, Frank Peckitt

runners.comment: 2-2 in points (bumper/maiden); trainer Jack Teal rides his stablemate
runners.spotlight: Won good-ground point bumper on debut in January and followed up over jumps at Tranwell (2m4f, good) in March; the limit of his ability remains hard to gauge but trainer-jockey Jack Teal rides his stablemate here.

runners.name: Low Kick
runners.comment: Only third on point debut but trainer-jockey seems to prefer him to Lets Go Harry
runners.spotlight: Unable to justify favouritism when only third of seven in Garthorpe maiden point in February (good to soft) but trainer-jockey Jack Teal (who won this race in 2022) seemingly prefers this fellow to unbeaten stablemate Lets Go Harry.

runners.name: Rebel Tribesman
runners.comment: Not beaten far in a maiden point last month but others have more compelling form
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to very useful Irish hurdler Filey Bay; not beaten far when third of six in maiden point at Garthorpe (good) last month but others in this line-up have more compelling form.

runners.name: Cue Jump
runners.comment: Placed in two maiden points but probably needs improvement here
runners.spotlight: Out of a sister to top-class chaser Cue Card; placed in two maiden points this spring (2m4f/3m) but probably needs this different test to enable some improvement.

runners.name: Just A Glance
runners.comment: 2-3 in points, having won a bumper and a Cothelstone maiden
runners.spotlight: 2-3 in points, having won a Godstone bumper last spring and a Cothelstone maiden (also on good) in March; one to consider.

runners.name: Lady Kloppenheim
runners.comment: Not beaten far when third behind two of these at Exeter in March; tongue-tie added
runners.spotlight: Easily beat two rivals in maiden point at Badbury Rings (2m4f, good to firm) in November and was not beaten far behind Amatchmadeinheaven and Couer d'Alene on rules debut at Exeter (good to firm) in March; each-way claims if aided by new tongue-tie.

runners.name: Out On Her Own
runners.comment: Comfortably beat three rivals when upped to 3m for a maiden point last month
runners.spotlight: Placed behind Lets Go Harry on debut at Tranwell (2m4f) in March and comfortably beat three rivals when upped to 3m at Chaddesley Corbett (also good) last month; may not be ideally suited by the shorter trip here.

runners.name: Angel Of My Dreams
runners.comment: Made all for easy win in point bumper on debut; looks a likely candidate
runners.spotlight: Closely related to useful bumper/jumps winner Rhythm Is A Dancer; made all for easy win in point bumper at Bangor (good to soft) in March; bought for Â£15,000 soon afterwards and now with a professional stable; likely contender under Gina Andrews.

7:30.race_name: HA Civils Franny Blennerhassett Memorial Mares' Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Ile De Jersey
runners.comment: Sixth of 16 in valuable series final at Cheltenham last month; in calmer waters here
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced in recent years but returned from long layoff with two very respectable runs towards end of last season, latterly when sixth of 16 in valuable series final at Cheltenham (2m4f, good); in calmer waters here and needs to be taken very seriously.

quotes.race: Join Vickers.Bet Free Bet Club Mares' Novices' Handicap Chase (Challenger Mares' Chs Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: Ile De Jersey is a really hardy mare and still very young. She made a mistake three out and it turned into a sprint but I was impressed with her - Nico de Boinville, rider.

stable_tour.quote: She's a quality mare. She's been off for more than a year, but prior to that she has been really consistent mixing hurdles and fences. It'll be best to start over hurdles ready to resume her chasing career, but it's great to have her back. 22-10-24

runners.name: Sunday Soldier
runners.comment: Second in a Listed race in February but two lesser efforts in handicaps have followed
runners.spotlight: Creditable second in Warwick Listed race (2m5f, soft) in February and should be fine on the quicker ground here but two lesser efforts in handicaps have followed and she needs a boost from the new cheekpieces.

quotes.race: Go North Lady Buttons Mares' Hurdle Series Final (A Handicap Hurdle) (NHMOPS Bonus Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We started Sunday Soldier off over this trip thinking she needed it and she wasn't seeing it out. But I think that was due to weakness. She's got stronger and done nothing but improve. David Killahena, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Hiconic
runners.comment: Seven-time winner; absent since September, though, and resumes on fairly tough mark
runners.spotlight: Seven-time hurdle winner, most recently when clinging on by a nose in busy finish at Uttoxeter (2m4f, good) last summer; probably not suited by the slower ground when below that form in September but absent since and remains on a fairly tough mark.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Hiconic is a hardy filly and stays well, which is key. She's been getting better with each win and we've been schooling her since we claimed her as a 2yo last year. I'm annoyed I didn't enter her at Market Rasen next week but we'll find another opportunity for her and maybe claim off her next time. We'll have a crack at a Listed race down the line as she has nothing to lose - she's been a revelation -  Alex Hales, trainer.

quotes.race: tote Placepot - Your First Bet Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've done a lot of schooling with Hiconic and she's always jumped. I was pleased with the way she did it from the front on her own. We'll have to go somewhere with a double penalty - Alex Hales, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She ran up a string of four straight wins in juvenile hurdles last season as well as finishing second in Listed company. She has started back in her work now and should be ready to run again by the end of February. She needs a trip now, but although a little off a run I like how she is coming on and she can certainly add more wins to her cv. 30-12-21

runners.name: Wudya
runners.comment: Second to useful rival on final start in Ireland; makes stable debut after 225-day absence
runners.spotlight: 1-6 over hurdles for Gordon Elliott in Ireland; chased home useful rival in Clonmel handicap (2m4f, good) in October but was sold for Â£7,500 soon afterwards and has fitness to prove on this stable debut; tongue-tie added.

runners.name: Masked Dance
runners.comment: Won this race in 2024 and returns here after good effort at Huntingdon last week
runners.spotlight: Has rather mixed record since clearcut success in this race a year ago (good ground) but kept on well for second at Huntingdon (2m3f, good) last week and remains on a good mark; high on the list.

quotes.race: Watch Off The Fence On attheraces.com Mares' Handicap Hurdle (Go North Lady Buttons Series Qual')
quotes.quote: Alex put himself in a good position and they just fell away around him, it was a steering job which is fantastic - Mel Rowley, trainer of Masked Dance

stable_tour.quote: She lost nothing in defeat in a competitive 2m4f mares' handicap hurdle at Cheltenham last time, given that she doesn't like to be crowded in a race. She learned so much there as she was in the hustle and bustle at the moment where she didn't need it to happen. After she jumped the last hurdle, she really rallied. We weren't sure if she'd cope with the undulations, but she really powered up the hill and finished the race really well. It gives us the scope to look at those tracks as well, rather than confining ourselves to flatter courses. There's lots to look forward to and she's really matured as well. She's much easier to train now. 16-01-25

runners.name: Midnight Ginger
runners.comment: Ended last season in fairly good form but younger rivals appeal more all the same
runners.spotlight: Runner-up off today's mark at Ludlow (2m5f, good to soft) in February and subsequent Cheltenham eighth (just behind Ile De Jersey) was perfectly respectable but she's not quite as good as she was and some of her younger rivals appeal more.

quotes.race: Play Coral 'Racing-Super-Series' For Free Mares' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Midnight Ginger is so gutsy, although I think we were lucky the ground was still decentish as it's the first race - it will get worse. I think Andrew (Martin, trainer) wants to put her over a fence and that could happen this season - Andrew John, owner.

quotes.race: Prodec Networks Fillies' "Junior" Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race
quotes.quote: We've always liked Midnight Ginger, but she's all stamina. Karastani is more speed. I had Midnight Ginger entered over 2m but decided this was logical. I don't think the ground matters and she'll have plenty of time. We probably won't see her for six weeks to two months and whether she's good enough to go to Aintree in the spring I don't know - Alan King, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's a very likeable filly who won on her debut at Newbury and was a good fourth in a Listed bumper at Market Rasen. She's been held up slightly after throwing a curb but she'll go straight over hurdles. 09-11-20

runners.name: Police Academy
runners.comment: Off since below-par run in October; resumes on workable mark and with conditions suitable
runners.spotlight: Placed over hurdles and fences last summer; absent since below-par run in October but resumes on a workable mark and with conditions suitable; market may guide.

runners.name: Touchy Feely
runners.comment: Fourth in this race in 2024; on dangerous mark but far too inconsistent to rely upon
runners.spotlight: Ran quite well when fourth behind Masked Dance in this race a year ago and is 10lb lower now but has become far too inconsistent to rely upon; pulled up over C&D on latest hurdling start (Boxing Day) and safely held in a chase a few weeks later; needs 112-day break to have done her good.

quotes.race: Tanners Cava EBF Mares' 'National Hunt' Novices' Hurdle (EBF Mares' NH Novices' Hurdle Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: Touchy Feely is bred to stay and go in soft ground and it's hard work out there. If you go in the ground you've got a big chance. We'd like to go to the Jane Seymour at Sandown with her, which is a Grade 2 - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Unfortunately her race record is littered with letters, which doesn't reflect her ability as I still believe in her. She ran consistently over hurdles and won two novices the season before last, but she's not yet won a chase in three starts. She begins as a novice again and I'm sure she'll get off the mark before too long. Everyone's been patient with her. 22-10-24

runners.name: Versace Twentyone
runners.comment: Up in grade after last month's Ludlow win but might still have more to offer
runners.spotlight: Irish bumper winner who came good over hurdles at sixth attempt, keeping on well to beat 12 rivals at Ludlow (2m5f, good to soft) last month; moves up in grade today but will be suited by the quicker ground and might still have more to offer.

runners.name: Ronnies Rules
runners.comment: Made all to win by over 6l at Ffos Las last month; obvious contender under penalty
runners.spotlight: Triple bumper winner last summer (good/good to firm); unseated rider in early stages of first two hurdle races but, following a break, made all to win by over 6l at Ffos Las (2m, good to soft) last month; obvious contender under penalty here.

runners.name: Bear Market
runners.comment: Won course bumper a year ago but first two hurdle runs were disappointing
runners.spotlight: Won the point-to-point bumper on this card for Philip Rowley last year (good ground) but was pulled up when odds-on for stable/hurdle debut in December and again disappointed when well-held fourth at Warwick (2m3f, soft) in February; not written off just yet but returns here with a point to prove.

stable_tour.quote: This fellow has already made a good start to his career as he won his only point-to-point in England before going on to win the point-to-point bumper at Aintree. He'll probably start off in a two-and-a-half-mile novice hurdle. 22-10-24

runners.name: Flawless Clarity
runners.comment: Irish point runner-up; pulled up over 3m on rules debut in January; now tries 2m1f
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in Irish point last April (good to yielding), form that was very well advertised under rules by the winner last season, but was pulled up when 80-1 for rules debut at Ayr (3m, soft) in January and it's hard to know what to expect from him over today's much shorter trip.

runners.name: King Gris
runners.breeder: Earl Trinquet, O Trinquet & M Trinquet
runners.comment: Close third in Irish point in February but struggled on recent hurdle debut
runners.spotlight: Appeared to show improvement when close third in Irish point in February (yielding ground) but struggled to get competitive in Bangor novice hurdle (2m3f, good to soft) for new stable last month.

runners.name: Lemon Leaf
runners.comment: Fourth in good Naas bumper in December; now with new stable for hurdling career
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten in three Irish points last year but belied 80-1 odds when fourth of 12 in Naas bumper (good to yielding) on rules debut in December; that form has worked out pretty well and it will be very interesting to see what Olly Murphy can do with him over hurdles.

runners.name: Royal Hope
runners.comment: Tailed off when 150-1 for Huntingdon bumper on rules debut in January
runners.spotlight: Tailed off when 150-1 for Huntingdon bumper (good to soft) on rules debut in January; can't be recommended here.

runners.name: Lively Citizen
runners.owner: Mark E Smith And Keith M Hawes

prev_owners.owner: Mark E Smith,Brake Horse Power Syndicate

runners.comment: Comfortable won recent Ffos Las chase; reverts to hurdling on same mark; respected
runners.spotlight: Not very consistent nowadays but comfortably drew clear to win recent Ffos Las chase (2m, good; refitted cheekpieces) under Toby McCain-Mitchell and reverts to hurdling on the same mark here; must be considered.

quotes.race: Try Racing TV For Free Now Handicap Chase (Go North One Man Qualifier) (GBB Race)
