quotes.quote: We've highly tried Lively Citizen over the years and he's been a great yard servant. It became quite evident there were more opportunities over fences for him and we'll stick to that discipline for now. He travels well so we may well head back north as he seems to enjoy it and we'll look for another small field for him - David Jeffreys, trainer.

quotes.race: Catesby Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I came up with this plan a long time ago and for the owners to back me with a horse that was 113 coming into a 0-140 was ambitious, but they allowed me the time to do it. Lively Citizen is a burly horse and is one of life's great givers but this was the plan. I was a bit worried we didn't get the rain we were promised - DJ Jeffreys, trainer.

runners.name: Bannister
runners.comment: In good form in the autumn but has fitness to prove after seven-month break
runners.spotlight: Scored at Market Rasen (2m, good) in September and bumped into a big improver when second over 2m2f there the following month but has fitness to prove after seven-month break.

runners.name: Fandabidozi
runners.comment: Won at Bangor last month and placed off today's mark a few days later; respected
runners.spotlight: Doubled hurdling tally with clearcut win at Bangor (2m, good) last month and was placed off today's mark there (good to soft) a few days later; Sean Bowen takes the ride today; likely contender again.

runners.name: Ravenscraig Castle
runners.owner: A Sinclair, I Jardine & V Renwick
runners.comment: Largely consistent 7yo who has performed well in higher-grade races this year
runners.spotlight: Largely consistent 7yo who has performed well in stronger races than this on all four appearances this year; on a workable and versatile regarding ground; can make his presence felt.

runners.name: Book Of Tales

prev_owners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Al Maktoum

runners.comment: Clear second to very well handicapped rival last month; still unexposed over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Well beaten when upped to 2m5f in March (raced too freely) but fared much better when clear second to very well handicapped rival at Huntingdon (2m, good) last month; still lightly raced over hurdles; shortlisted.

quotes.race: QuinnBet Acca Bonus Handicap
quotes.quote: This trip will be the bare minimum for Book Of Tales but the blinkers certainly focussed his mind and he's going the right way now - Charlie Johnston, trainer.

runners.name: Waspy
runners.comment: Dropped out tamely on last month's stable/handicap debut; others look much less risky
runners.spotlight: Signed off for Donald McCain with Bangor maiden win (2m, good) in May 2023 but, following a long absence, dropped out very tamely on recent stable/handicap debut there; may yet come good for Fergal O'Brien but seems to have issues with his breathing, and others look much less risky.

runners.name: Come On Nia
runners.comment: Eased in grade after very respectable fifth in Grade 2 mares' novices' handicap at Newbury
runners.spotlight: Won twice over about 2m in early part of last season (good to soft/good) and gave very good account when fifth in Grade 2 mares' novices' handicap at Newbury (2m4f, good) in March; eased in grade; a possible.

runners.name: Its A Love Thing
runners.comment: Not seen over hurdles since 2023 but a three-time Flat winner in recent weeks; interesting
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle winner in October 2023; not seen over hurdles since pulled-up favourite on handicap debut the following month but has collected three Flat wins in recent weeks and could still have untapped potential in this sphere; interesting.

quotes.race: National Horseracing College Handicap
quotes.quote: It's A Love Thing is a lovely little horse, as tough as teak. He bled a couple of times and had a couple of wind ops and we couldn't get to the bottom of it but it seems to have sorted itself out and he's flying along. Now he's got rid of his issues, we seem to be getting somewhere with him - Sam England, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Jonathan: He ran a strong race when he finished second on the Flat at Newcastle last time and showed he stays 1m4Â½f. He'll probably return to hurdles at Huntingdon on Thursday. He disappointed on his last hurdles run but he made a bad mistake and may have just jarred himself a bit. Sam: He pulled a shoe off and we struggle with his feet, they're big and take a bit of minding. He's another who does a lot of swimming. 08-02-24

runners.name: Aotano
runners.comment: Caused 28-1 surprise at Doncaster in March but well beaten since; hard to predict
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo; caused 28-1 surprise at Doncaster (2m, good to soft; flights in home straight omitted) in March, his second hurdling success, but was well beaten last month and is not an easy one to predict.

runners.name: Kingoftheswingerz
runners.comment: Battled gamely for Class 5 win in February but safely held since; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Battled on gamely to open account in Class 5 handicap at Huntingdon (2m, good to soft; first-time cheekpieces) in February, her seventh hurdle run, but was well below that form last time; others preferred.

runners.name: Natzor
runners.owner: Hambleton Racing Xxxix & The Fab Four
runners.comment: Quite useful Flat racer; placed on first of three hurdle starts; still open to improvement
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful Flat racer who was placed on stable/hurdle debut at Musselburgh (1m7f, good to soft) in February; below that form twice since but remains open to improvement on this handicap hurdle debut, and the switch to good ground ought to suit.

runners.name: Trafalgar Square
runners.comment: Ready winner at Hereford last month; 7lb higher in much deeper race here
runners.spotlight: Bounced back from very disappointing reappearance run to win readily by 5l at Hereford (2m, good) last month, opening his hurdles account at the eighth attempt; 7lb higher in a much deeper race but further progress is possible.

quotes.race: Kidwells Group Novices' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We've always thought Trafalgar Square should have been a hell of a lot better than he has shown as he had a fair level of form on the Flat. We went back to the blinkers and that's made him concentrate and bring out the best in him - Josh Guerriero, joint-trainer.

2:25.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered; 6.1)

runners.name: Kind Of Kiss
runners.owner: Crest Racing Vii & D A Olver
runners.comment: Ex-French 4yo who shaped well at Lingfield (AW) in last two British starts
runners.spotlight: Ex-French 4yo who has shaped well at Lingfield (1m2f, AW) in last two British starts, close fourth when favourite for Vase contest on Good Friday latest; frame possibilities off same mark returned to turf.

runners.name: Gloucestershire
runners.comment: Fairly consistent but hasn't won for over three years
runners.spotlight: Fairly consistent and is capable of being involved off current mark; however, lacks recent match practice (off since November) and hasn't won for over three years; not the percentage call.

stable_tour.quote: This is a quality colt who made his debut a few days before Christmas when successful at Kempton over 1m3f. He went off at a big price [22-1] but it came as no surprise as he had been pleasing me. He's a striking individual who I didn't think would run last year, but he was going so well and I thought we might as well give him a day out, despite how late in the year it was. He did it nicely and is now rated 85. I had hoped to start him earlier this season, but he got an infection in his off-hind a couple of months ago. He's fine now and back in work. He's our big Derby hope so I need to get a prep race into him and the two options I have are either the Fairway Stakes at Newmarket or the Cocked Hat at Goodwood a little later, but the latter is not ideal as it is so close to the Derby. I really love him and he's definitely good enough to be considered for Epsom. 05-05-21

runners.name: Burrito
runners.comment: Gelded since last run; raced only twice (won on debut) and remains open to progress
runners.spotlight: Raced twice in his first season last year, winning at Newmarket (1m2f, good) then beaten favourite at Chester where the slower ground perhaps wasn't ideal; gelded since; has a good pedigree, represents major yard and remains open to progress; interesting handicap debutant.

runners.name: Nap Hand
runners.comment: Record of 3-8 in Flat turf events features a C&D success; may improve further
runners.spotlight: Disappointing at Newbury in latest hurdles attempt; however, scored over C&D (heavy) last October, taking record in Flat turf events to 3-8, and may improve further in this sphere; has won on good to firm.

quotes.race: PMS Oxford Handicap
quotes.quote: The fact Nap Hand got a mile and a quarter on deep ground was good and although there's a slight doubt if he stays two miles over hurdles, we can come back on the Flat if it doesn't work out. It's about learning how to settle him and I'm delighted - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Sergei Prokofiev Standing At Whitsbury Manor Auction Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: James Doyle said we should stick at 6f at the minute because Nap Hand is quite a free traveller. I think he is good on this ground, but I don't think he needs it - Alan King, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He is improving on the Flat and won over 1m2f on heavy ground at Newbury last time. Hurdling is a possibility at a later date, he's schooled well and if he gets the trip he could be quite useful, although he'd obviously be kept to sharper tracks. 07-11-24

runners.name: Prometeo
runners.comment: Ended his 2024 campaign with a hat-trick; this progressive sort is one to consider
runners.spotlight: Ended his 2024 campaign with a hat-trick, scoring narrowly at Southwell (1m2f, AW) the final time and taking overall record to 4-11; this progressive sort is effective on turf and one to consider.

runners.name: Sovereign Sea
runners.comment: Form figures read 1222, all on AW; likely player if transferring ability to turf
runners.spotlight: Form figures read 1222, all at about 1m on AW; good second in Southwell handicap most recently; gives the impression he'll stay this new trip; likely player off same mark, assuming he transfers ability to turf.

runners.name: Royal Approval
runners.comment: Failed to transfer the form of his winter AW wins back to turf last time
runners.spotlight: Came up short at Doncaster (1m2f) last time, failing to transfer the form of his two winter AW wins back to turf; faces another competitive field and has something to prove.

runners.name: Eagle Day
runners.comment: Has much better strike-rate on AW than on turf and is on a difficult mark
runners.spotlight: Exposed 5yo who has a much better strike-rate on AW than on turf and returns to this sphere off a difficult mark; has lacked consistency this year; opposed.

runners.name: Sweet Reward
runners.comment: Won over C&D on seasonal debut; has a sound record in this race; solid claims
runners.spotlight: The oldest contender in this field but retains plenty of ability and beat Yokohama in C&D contest (good) on seasonal debut; has a sound record in this race (second in 2023, fourth in 2024); solid claims.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Millennium Millionaire Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: Sweet Reward has had a lovely winter break and it's so nice to see these older horses come back year after year. - Jonathan Portman, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Pick Your Places Handicap
quotes.quote: It's a shame Sweet Reward has won so far because it's rather flattered him. These older need a bit of help sometimes and they go and do that and the handicapper thinks they've improved a stone. He's getting on and you have to get what you can, when you can. You never know what you're going to get from him. He doesn't like it firm and he doesn't like it heavy - Jonathan Portman, trainer.

quotes.race: Sandown Park Breeders' Day September 15 Handicap
quotes.quote: Sweet Reward seems to like it here. He is tough, brave and he stays and Rob Hornby knows how to ride him. He doesn't like sharp or undulating tracks but this track seems to bring out the best in him. It is great for the Old Stoic Racing Club. I was worried about him staying the mile and a quarter on soft ground last time but I had none of those worries today - Jonathan Portman, trainer.

quotes.race: Play Coral "Racing-Super-Series" For Free Handicap (Jockey Club Grassroots Middle Dist' Series Qual)
quotes.quote: Sweet Reward's ideap trip is 1m1f but he did stay today. I worried he wouldn't stay on the ground. He likes to get his toe in and is very brave. It took him a couple of races to blow the cobwebs away after his winter break - Jonathan Portman, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet New Instant Roulette Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought Sweet Reward would cope best of my runners on this ground and Rob [Hornby] gave him a super ride at Sandown last time when the horse got his confidence. I wasn't in a rush to put him in an apprentice race but was keen to get him to Newbury, which is a lovely track, nice and straightforward, while Tyler is a good chap. The handicapper can get hysterical when something wins that far and if he does that, it's going to be very dull. He's a horse who has developed nicely and I knew he'd be a slow-burner. If we race him conservatively he could improve again next year; he's still developing. I always thought nine furlongs was ideal and ten would be okay on certain tracks. He reminds me very much of Balmoral Castle, whom I used to train - Jonathan Portman, trainer.

runners.name: Silent Age
runners.comment: Won his first two races but 0-6 since; less convincing than others
runners.spotlight: Campaigned mostly on AW; won his first two races (for previous yard) but 0-6 since and finished behind Kind Of Kiss on Good Friday most recently; less convincing than others.

runners.name: Expert Witness
runners.comment: Steadily progressive form (421) for new yard; however, this is a stiffer task
runners.spotlight: Has shown steadily progressive form (421) this term for new yard, winning at Windsor (1m2f, good to firm) most recently; however, campaigned largely in lower grades and now goes into deeper waters.

runners.name: Beauld As Brass
runners.comment: Better than ever this spring; bids for a quickfire five-timer; has to be feared
runners.spotlight: Regular slow-starter but that hasn't stopped him from completing a quickfire four-timer (1m2f/1m4f) this spring, looking better than ever; gained last two wins in comfortable style at Bath and Leicester; has to be feared in current form, even with a double penalty.

quotes.race: Silvershine Turf Services Amateur Jockeys' Handicap
quotes.quote: I felt quite cunning as the three amateur races jumped out at me in the programme book with Simon [Walker, jockey] on. I thought if we could win one that'd be good so to complete the hat-trick is the perfect plan. Beauld As Brass is a quirky horse and exhausting to watch, I have to look away when the stalls open, but I'm delighted. These three races were the plan and we could look at going again at Leicester on Saturday. The Amateur Derby with Simon would be an obvious target for the summer - George Baker, trainer.

runners.name: Into Battle
runners.comment: Close fourth, despite traffic issues, at Haydock on reappearance; respected off same mark
runners.spotlight: Good fifth in the London Gold Cup over C&D a year ago, on the back of maiden/novice wins; no further progress since but ran very encouragingly when favourite at Haydock (1m2f, good) on reappearance, finishing a close fourth despite traffic issues; respected off unaltered mark.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Digital Solutions Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Into Battle is such a good-looking horse and his work has been decent, but I wasn't expecting that. I expect the handicapper will take a dim view, but I'm sure there's plenty more to come - Ed Walker, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He slightly disappointed us after the London Gold Cup last season but he's a massive horse and has done well through the winter. I hope he'll be progressive in handicaps from 1m to 1m2f this season. He looks to start the year on a fair mark. 16-04-25

runners.name: Azahara Palace
runners.comment: Unlucky third at Haydock on seasonal debut; similar type to Into Battle; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Four-time 1m winner; has form figures of 323 since upped to 1m2f, most recently an unlucky third when favourite at Haydock (1m2f, good; would likely have won with a clearer run) on seasonal debut; that latest effort makes her a similar type to Into Battle; one for the shortlist.

quotes.race: Download The Vickers.Bet App Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: We were disappointed when Azahara Palace got beat at Catterick, but I think the course caught her out. She's quite difficult to train, and was still learning here, but hopefully she'll keep progressing - Hughie Morrison, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: She won at Leicester last week off 74 and it was particularly pleasing as she was bred by my brother and I trained both her dam and her dam's sire Sakhee's Secret, who won a July Cup. I'm looking at the Kensington Palace Stakes - the four-year-old fillies' race on the Wednesday at Royal Ascot - for her next run. In the Racing Calendar it said the race was restricted to 20 runners but I rang up the clerk at Ascot and learned it was a misprint and 30 get in. She's gone up 7lb, so she should bang there towards the bottom of the weights. 06-06-24

runners.name: Yokohama
runners.comment: Close second at Newbury and Haydock since being gelded; possibilities off bottom weight
runners.spotlight: Record of 0-12 since debut success but is threatening to put that right, having finished a close second at Newbury and Haydock since being gelded; ties in with Sweet Reward and Into Battle on those efforts; possibilities off bottom weight.

4:45.race_name: Coolmore City Of Troy EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)
4:45.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered; 6.1)

runners.name: Altareq
runners.comment: Just over 2l behind Hinchinbrooke at Newmarket and a neck in front Respond at Chelmsford
runners.spotlight: Brother to 1m2f Listed winner Al Asifah; weakened out of serious contention in both the Wood Ditton at Newmarket (1m, good; behind two of these) and novice at Chelmsford (1m2f, AW; 6-4 favourite, neck ahead of the promising Respond) 15 days later; still showed fair form but a fair bit better will be required to win this.

runners.name: Bedford
runners.comment: 50-1 and hooded in novice at Chelmsford (1m2f, AW) but very slowly away and always behind
runners.spotlight: Useful pedigree; late foal; 50-1, hooded and taken down early for novice at Chelmsford (1m2f, AW) 15 days ago but he was very slowly away from the widest draw and always behind, well adrift of Altareq.

runners.name: Caughtredhanded
runners.comment: Just over 2l behind Hinchinbrooke on debut; 1m2f will help and he could be a big improver
runners.spotlight: Has a useful pedigree for 1m4f; weak 14-1 for the Wood Ditton at Newmarket (1m, good) one month ago, green and never in a threatening position but he did close into fifth of 15, a neck in front of Altareq and just over 2l behind Hinchinbrooke; this extra 2f will help and he could be a big improver if he's learned from that debut experience.

runners.name: Crown Imperial
runners.breeder: Newsells Park & Ammerland Gmbh & Co Kg
runners.comment: 450,000gns yearling by Frankel; closely related to Arc winner Waldgeist; Irish Derby entry
runners.spotlight: 450,000gns yearling by Frankel; eighth foal; closely related to three winners including Waldgeist (1m-1m4f including Arc; RPR 128) and Waldlied (1m4f Group 2; 112), half-brother to three more including Waldkonig (8.6f-1m2f including Group 3; 116); dam 1m 2yo/10.5f Group 3 winner (106); late foal who has an Irish Derby entry; newcomer to note from stable which runs two.

runners.name: Gamrai
runners.comment: 4-6 at Southwell (1m, AW) in November and made most but ended 3rd of nine; cheekpieces now
runners.spotlight: Closely related to 7f/1m winner Aljazzi (Group 2; RPR 116) and half-brother to four winners, including Majestic Noor (1m2f; RPR 103); dam 1m2f Listed winner (RPR 104); 4-6 for novice at Southwell (1m, AW) in November and made the running but ended up third of nine; cheekpieces go on; should improve.

runners.name: Hinchinbrooke
runners.comment: 33-1, bang there from 3f out to over 1f out when fourth of 15 at Newmarket (1m, good)
runners.spotlight: By Cracksman out of a 6f 2yo winner (including Group 3; RPR 109); 33-1, bang there from 3f out to over 1f out when fourth of 15 in the Wood Ditton for newcomers at Newmarket (1m, good) one month ago, weakening but still finishing just over 2l in front of Caughtredhanded and Altareq; going up in trip asks a question but he has among the best form and looks promising.

runners.name: Meblesh
runners.comment: Third at Doncaster (7f, good) in March but beaten 18l when C&D fourth (good) 12 days later
runners.spotlight: Late foal by Sea The Stars; promising third of 11 in novice event at Doncaster (7f, good) in March would make him a leading contender but beaten 18l when fourth of nine over C&D (good) 12 days later; needs to bounce back.

stable_tour.quote: He ran a good race first time and wasn't right when we scoped him after his latest run. We'll forget that and judge him on what he does next. 22-04-25

runners.name: Minnesota
runners.comment: 46,000gns foal by Without Parole; first foal; dam 1m AW winner (RPR 79); gelded
runners.spotlight: 46,000gns foal by Without Parole; first foal; dam 1m AW winner (RPR 79), half-sister to Italian Listed-placed 6f-1m winner Rabiosa Fiore, out of 2m-winning half-sister to 7f Listed winner Ibn Malik; gelded and his stable also runs Meblesh, so the market should give big clues.

runners.name: Respond
runners.comment: 14-1 and hooded, slowly away at Chelmsford (1m2f, AW) but stayed on, a neck behind Altareq
runners.spotlight: 185,000euros foal, 130,000gns yearling; bred to stay 1m2f+; 14-1 and hooded, slowly away in steadily run novice at Chelmsford (1m2f, AW) 15 days ago but he stayed on past six of his rivals to finish fourth of 11, a neck behind Altareq; also hung under pressure that day but it was a promising debut.

runners.name: Sail On Jimmy Boy
runners.comment: 66-1, slowly into stride when seventh of ten in maiden at Leicester (1m2f, good)
runners.spotlight: 66-1, slowly into stride and always behind when seventh of ten in maiden at Leicester (1m2f, good) three weeks ago; major work to do.

runners.name: Valiancy
runners.breeder: Airlie Stud & Mrs S M Rogers
runners.comment: 410,000gns yearling by Cracksman; gelded; probably stable second string to Crown Imperial
runners.spotlight: 48,000euros foal, 410,000gns yearling; third foal; Cracksman half-brother to 5.7f/6f winner Givemethebeatboys (including Group 3; RPR 112); dam 1m3f/1m4f winner (84), half-sister to winners Lismore (2m Group 3) and Testa (1m Listed); already gelded and probably stable second string to Crown Imperial, although Harry Davies was 2-4 for the yard last year.

3:33.race_name: Trade Nation Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (Div I)
3:33.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered; 6.1)

runners.name: Montpellier
runners.comment: Scored readily at Thirsk and the form has received a couple of boosts; respected
runners.spotlight: Wootton Bassett gelding who made a promising debut in Thirsk maiden (7f, good; scored readily) five weeks ago; the form has received a couple of boosts since; respected under 7lb penalty.

runners.name: Abundance
runners.comment: Solid promise at Wolverhampton and Windsor; again has frame possibilities
runners.spotlight: Solid promise, having finished fourth at Wolverhampton (7f, AW) and third at Windsor (1m, good to firm); again has frame possibilities.

runners.name: Blue Lancero
runners.comment: Finished third of seven at Doncaster, faring best of the newcomers
runners.spotlight: Finished third of seven in 7f maiden at Doncaster (good to firm), beaten about 7l by the first two but faring best of the newcomers; open to progress with the experience under his belt.

runners.name: Impresario
runners.comment: 18,000euros yearling; Profitable half-brother to three winners
runners.spotlight: 18,000euros yearling; Profitable half-brother to three winners, out of 9.7f winner (84); one of three newcomers in the field; market helpful.

runners.name: Kaizen
runners.breeder: Newsells Park Stud & Merry Fox Stud
runners.comment: Has performed well below expectations in two runs
runners.spotlight: Nicely bred and cost 425,000gns as a yearling but has performed well below expectations in two runs; the way things are looking, he may find better opportunities in handicaps shortly.

runners.name: Road House
runners.comment: Modest RPR in sole start for Ollie Sangster; sold for 2,500gns since
runners.spotlight: Wore blinkers and recorded only a modest RPR, nonetheless showing some ability, at Wolverhampton (7f, AW) in sole start for Ollie Sangster; sold for 2,500gns since; others preferred.

runners.name: Rock N It
runners.comment: Last of 14 at Kempton in sole 2yo outing
runners.spotlight: Brings the worst form, having finished last of 14 at Kempton (7f, AW) in sole 2yo outing; gelded since and now wears tongue-tie.

runners.name: Sea Force
runners.comment: Went close at Doncaster on reappearance; bred to do much better still; leading player
runners.spotlight: Went down by only a neck at Doncaster (7f, good to firm) on reappearance and is bred to do much better still, being related to two Group 3 winners for his owner; leading contender.

runners.name: Silent Storm
runners.owner: J Kimber, J Savory, A Ocallaghan
runners.comment: 90,000euros yearling; brother to a Group 2 winner; the pick of the debutants
runners.spotlight: 90,000euros yearling; brother to three winners, notably Happy Power (6f-1m including Group 2; RPR 117); the pick of the debutants.

runners.name: Uniting
runners.comment: One of the main contenders, provided Doncaster form (250-1 fourth) is confirmed
runners.spotlight: Belied his 250-1 odds with fourth-place finish, despite traffic issues, in Doncaster novice contest (7f, good); one of the main contenders, provided he backs up that effort.

runners.name: Zouligan
runners.comment: 9,000gns yearling; by Zoustar; doesn't leap off the page
runners.spotlight: 9,000gns yearling; Zoustar half-brother to three winners who have RPRs in the 70s, out of 5f Listed scorer (97); doesn't leap off the page.

3:00.race_name: Arc Proud To Support Starlight Maiden Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
3:00.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered; 6.1)

runners.name: Bourbon Blues
runners.owner: M Hughes, M Kerr-Dineen And Partners
runners.comment: Â£56,000 yearling; by Space Blues; yard also runs Dodge City; market helpful
runners.spotlight: 42,000gns foal, Â£56,000 yearling; Space Blues half-brother to winners Lower Street (9.4f-1m4f AW; RPR 91) and Golden Bolt (HK 7f), out of 1m2f AW scorer (71); yard also runs Dodge City; market helpful.

runners.name: Cape Orator
runners.breeder: Sas Le Thenney - Pearl Champs Elysses
runners.comment: 280,000euros yearling; by Mohaather; major stable; one to consider
runners.spotlight: 280,000euros yearling; Mohaather half-brother to Group-placed 7f/8.5f winner Minoushka (including French 2yo/US; RPR 105), out of 9.4f AW/1m2f turf scorer (85); major stable; one to consider.

runners.name: Commanders Intent
runners.breeder: S A S Haute Vallee, Mme Moa Sundstrom
runners.comment: Victor Ludorum colt; potentially useful, having cost 420,000euros as a yearling
runners.spotlight: Victor Ludorum colt; dam well beaten in France, half-sister to French winner Lilac Fairy (1m 2yo Listed) out of French 9.5f/1m2f 2yo scorer; potentially useful, having cost 420,000euros as a yearling.

runners.name: Crest Of Fire
runners.comment: 70,000gns yearling; by Phoenix Of Spain; yard's first 2yo runner of the season
runners.spotlight: 33,000euros foal, 70,000gns yearling; Phoenix Of Spain half-brother to six winners, notably Perfect Illusion (10.5f-1m4f; RPR 89); dam 5f 2yo scorer (68); yard's first 2yo runner of the season.

runners.name: Dodge City
runners.comment: Â£38,000 yearling; by Victor Ludorum; one of two newcomers for this stable
runners.spotlight: 10,000euros foal, Â£38,000 yearling; Victor Ludorum half-brother to French 1m winner Knuckle, out of unraced half-sister to French 1m scorer Darena; one of two newcomers for this stable.

runners.name: Domination
runners.comment: Related to a couple of Group 3 winners; in good hands; possibilities
runners.spotlight: Brother to French 7.5f-1m1f winner Darlinghurst (including Group 3; RPR 110); dam 5f scorer (including Group 3; 102), from family of top-class miler Soviet Song; in good hands; possibilities.

runners.name: Do Or Do Not
runners.comment: 75,000gns yearling; out of half-sister to a Gimcrack winner; suitably bred
runners.spotlight: 75,000gns yearling; Space Blues half-brother to Group/Grade 3 scorers Higher Leaves (10.5f France; RPR 114) and Selenaia (US 1m1f turf; 106), out of half-sister to Gimcrack winner Lake Forest; nicely bred.

runners.name: French Affair
runners.comment: Showed promise at Newmarket on 1,000 Guineas day; helps to set the standard
runners.spotlight: Mehmas colt who showed some promise in small field at Newmarket (5f) on 1,000 Guineas day, while shaping as if this extra furlong will suit; one of only two runners who have the benefit of experience.

runners.name: Humidity
runners.comment: Brother to a Group 3 scorer; represents notable connections; likely sort
runners.spotlight: Brother to 7f/1m scorer Holloway Boy (including 2yo/Group 3; RPR 113), out of unraced granddaughter of Cheveley Park winner; suitably bred and represents notable connections; likely sort.

quotes.race: Arc Proud To Support Starlight Maiden Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Humidity is a lovely horse and he's one with a bright future. We hoped he would go pretty well but obviously six [furlongs] was going to be his minimum and there were some nice types in the race. I liked the manner in which he did things through the race - Andrew Balding, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: John Barleycorn
runners.comment: 30,000gns yearling; by Saxon Warrior; others preferred
runners.spotlight: 30,000gns yearling; by Saxon Warrior out of Group-placed 5f 2yo winner (RPR 100); others have stronger-looking credentials overall; best watched unless the betting suggests otherwise.

runners.name: Lohoobb
runners.comment: Too Darn Hot colt; dam 7f 2yo winner (including Listed); looks a likely type
runners.spotlight: Too Darn Hot colt; sibling to four winners, notably Boosala (6f/7f including 2yo; 112); dam 7f 2yo winner (including Listed; 102), out of 7f Listed scorer; esteemed connections; looks a likely type.

runners.name: Morris Dancer
runners.comment: Palace Pier half-brother to a 1m/1m1f winner; major connections
runners.spotlight: Palace Pier half-brother to 1m/1m1f scorer Magnum Opus (including AW 2yo; RPR 101), out of French 11.5f/1m7f winner who is related to some useful winners; major connections; one to consider.

runners.name: Secret Santa
runners.comment: Fourth at Goodwood; jointly sets the standard with stablemate French Affair
runners.spotlight: Out of a Queen Mary winner for his connections; showed ability with his fourth-place finish at Goodwood (5f) while shaping as if this longer trip will suit; jointly sets the standard with stablemate French Affair.

runners.name: Sirius A
runners.comment: 45,000gns yearling; pedigree suggests he's one for longer trips
runners.spotlight: 45,000gns yearling; Palace Pier half-brother to three winners, notably Light Of Night (French 10.5f; RPR 93); dam 7.5f 2yo/1m Listed scorer (108); may be more interesting when sent over further.

runners.name: Telling Time
runners.comment: 18,000gns yearling; pedigree suggests he'll find 6f too sharp
runners.spotlight: 18,000gns yearling; Time Test half-brother to two winners over 1m; unraced dam closely related to 1m Group 1 scorer Toronado; that pedigree suggests he'll find 6f too sharp.

runners.name: Title Role
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith
runners.comment: 500,000gns (breeze-up) 2yo; by Too Darn Hot; high-yield stable; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: 90,000gns yearling, 500,000gns (breeze-up) 2yo; Too Darn Hot half-brother to five winners, notably Dolce Courage (7f/1m AW; RPR 93), dam US 1m1f Grade 3 scorer (97); high-yield stable; one for the shortlist.

runners.name: Whinbarrow
runners.comment: 1,500euros yearling; by Profitable; the least appealing contender
runners.spotlight: 1,500euros yearling; by Profitable out of a maiden (RPR 70) half-sister to winners Dark Pearl (1m2f-1m4f) and Cosette (11.4f-2m); the least appealing contender.

runners.name: Words Of Truth
runners.comment: Related to a couple of 2yo Group 2 winners for his connections; strong credentials
runners.spotlight: Lope De Vega half-brother to two winners, notably Ancient Truth (6f/7f 2yo including Group 2; RPR 112), out of 6f/7f scorer (including 2yo Group 2; 108); powerful trainer knows the family well; strong credentials.

5:55.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered; 6.1)

runners.name: One Cool Dreamer
runners.breeder: Exors Of The Late Mrs L Peacock
runners.comment: Unexposed at middle distances; cheekpieces added and Oisin Murphy booked; contender.
runners.spotlight: Improved for the step up to 1m2f last summer, winning handicaps at Windsor and Newmarket; another step forward upped to 1m4f at Kempton on his reappearance, finishing second of 12, and latest Goodwood fourth (1m6f, good) was also respectable; won't need much more for the addition of cheekpieces to play a big part in the finish.

quotes.race: Jenningsbet Halstead Handicap
quotes.quote: I feel One Cool Dreamer will get a mile and a half. He enjoyed the good even pace and I thought he pulled out a bit more when the second, ridden by my father, came to me - David Egan, jockey.

runners.name: Civil Law
runners.comment: Better on AW and still to convince he wants this far
runners.spotlight: Better known for his AW exploits and although he's lower rated on grass, this trip looks an issue (unplaced all six runs at 1m4f).

quotes.race: Churchill Tyres Handicap
quotes.quote: Civil Law is in the Queen Mother Cup at York tomorrow and we'll see how he is. He's not blowing there and it's a 15,000GBP race. He could have done with a better gallop. Ben said they probably didn't go quick enough for him - Brian Ellison, trainer

runners.name: Parkland
runners.comment: Second to a top-class rival at Kempton last year but yet to shine in handicaps; new trip
runners.spotlight: Chased home Notable Speech at Kempton last January but their paths have been very different subsequently; yet to make a major impact in handicaps and hopes pinned on the step up in trip having a positive effect.

runners.name: La Cadalora
runners.comment: Promise in fillies' novice events at up to 1m4f; makes handicap debut after ten months off
runners.spotlight: Promise in three fillies' novice events at up to 1m4f and faces more realistic assignment now handicapping; 295-day absence to overcome though.

runners.name: An Bradan Feasa
runners.comment: Unexposed over middle distances; still feasibly treated and he rates a leading contender
runners.spotlight: Useful jumper who has benefitted from a step up in trip/switch to handicapping on the Flat, winning at Catterick (1m4f, good to firm) before finishing second at Southwell one week later (1m3f; steadily run); another 3lb higher today but a thorough test at this trip could spark further progress; rider's claim useful too.

quotes.race: JCB Triumph Trial Juvenile Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Fred Winter is what we discussed two or three weeks ago. An Bradan Feasa would be 50-1 in a Triumph Hurdle, but although he will go up again today he would have a competitive enough weight in the Fred Winter. He will have a quiet enough time now and he will have one more run before March and see where we end up. He is very easy to ride, and Tom said he is an absolute delight. It (the Fred Winter) wouldn't be any bother to him. He has sat third there today and you could let him sit mid division to the rear in the Fred Winter and let him travel away  - Jack Jones, trainer.

runners.name: Amancio

prev_owners.owner: Power Geneva Ltd, R Windridge & Partner

runners.comment: Winning stable debut over hurdles at Chepstow last month; first 1m4f Flat run; chance
runners.spotlight: Never raced over further than an extended 1m2f on the Flat for Jack Channon but he won over hurdles at Chepstow three weeks ago on his first run for his new stable; it could be that this trip brings about some progress and he's feasibly weighted.

stable_tour.quote: He's been really consistent all year, winning a mile handicap at Haydock in late April and finishing second or third on seven other occasions. Last time he was beaten only half a length by Tipsy Tiger at Sandown. He'll go to the sales but we're hoping to get another win into him beforehand. He's entered in the 1m2f handicap at Nottingham on Wednesday. 10-10-24

runners.name: Percy Jones
runners.comment: All wins on AW and usually seen over further; vulnerable at this trip after a break
runners.spotlight: All wins on AW and usually seen over further; still 2lb higher than for his Wolverhampton win last October (2m) and others appeal more on this return from 114 days off.

stable_tour.quote: He's still a maiden after six races but is definitely improving. He ran a very good second at Goodwood last month and went up 2lb, rather harshly. He's owned by Australians and if I can get him up one more grade, he could be worth taking over there. I ran him in a hot handicap at Haydock at the start of the month and he ran well to finish fifth. We'll stick to handicaps now. 13-07-22

runners.name: Alpine Stroll
runners.comment: Two wins last year; yard still to get off the mark in 2025 but recent signs more promising
runners.spotlight: Won two middle-distance handicaps last season and he's only 1lb higher than for his soft-ground success at Yarmouth last October; signs the stable are emerging from a quiet spell and the betting should be revealing.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Bloodstock Pro Colwick Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: If we had an easy lead we would have taken it, but the pace was perfect. Alpine Stroll hung right around the left-hand bends, but that was quite good as I was able to get a breather into him. We kicked in the straight up the inside and he's picked up lovely, so it's worked well - Rhys Clutterbuck, rider.

runners.name: Nibras Gold
runners.comment: Made a winning debut for new yard at Beverley last month (1m4f, good); contender up 3lb
runners.spotlight: Another to be revived by the move to James Owen, making all over 1m4f at Beverley last month; up 3lb in a deeper race but foolish to think he's reached his ceiling.

quotes.race: Ladies Day 26th August Handicap
quotes.quote: Nibras Gold's an improving horse as well as being gelded. He thinks he's done when he hits the front but the horse who creeped up my inside made him go again. He makes hard work of it - Ray Dawson, jockey.

runners.name: Gallant Lion
runners.comment: On a losing run and this season's efforts don't point to him ending it in this field
runners.spotlight: Completed four-timer for Tony Carroll in the summer of 2023 (including over 1m2f at this track); beaten 15 times since the last win though and he'll need to step up on last month's midfield finish at Lingfield (2m, AW).

runners.name: Francesco Baracca
runners.comment: Series of good AW runs following wind surgery; return to turf no problem; each-way shout
runners.spotlight: Needed a drop into Class 6 company to record his first handicap success, rewarding market support at Kempton last August (1m4f); held his form afterwards and shouldn't be unduly inconvenienced by returning to turf; each-way shout.

runners.name: Dalton Park
runners.comment: Potential improver now handicapping at a realistic level; market useful on turf debut
runners.spotlight: Some promise in three AW starts at up to 1m4f; makes his handicap/turf debut at a realistic level and one to note in the market.

runners.name: Molten Sea
runners.comment: Two handicap wins at a low level last year; type to make further progress this year
runners.spotlight: Sent off favourite for all four of her handicap runs, winning twice at Musselburgh in the autumn (1m4f, good and 2m, good to soft); likely to carry on progressing and there should be sufficient pace on here to bring her stamina into play.

quotes.race: Scots Association Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: She's still quite inexperienced. We thought the track might be a touch on the sharp side so were keen to get Molten Sea into her stride and her rhythm and she's done that and showed a good attitude in the later stages. She gets that trip well and I think going up in trip will be a big help. The second horse quickened by her while she was still a bit green and she's really gone through the line well and galloped out nicely afterwards - Callum Rodriguez, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

runners.name: Imperial Cult
runners.comment: Three wins at up to this trip last year; yet to shine in 2025 but type to revive soon
runners.spotlight: Won three handicaps last summer at 1m2f and 1m4f; ended 2024 with a good third at Newmarket (1m1f; off 3lb higher); not at his best in two runs this season but likely to come good again at some point.

runners.name: Fram Castle

prev_owners.owner: Orbital Racing Group & Miss E Donnelly

runners.comment: Exposed maiden; creditable 3rd at Salisbury 12 days ago; more needed in this higher grade
runners.spotlight: Exposed 14-race maiden; creditable third at Salisbury 12 days ago (1m6f, good to firm) but more will be needed in this stronger event.

1:55.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered; 6.1)

runners.name: Darvel
runners.comment: Won at Bath in most recent turf start; finished third off this mark in this race last year
runners.spotlight: Latest effort took his AW record to 0-4; justified favouritism at Bath (1m, good to firm) in most recent turf attempt and finished third off this mark in this race last year; should be involved.

quotes.race: Download The At The Races App Handicap
quotes.quote: Mr Chamings, the last day I rode Darvel, was confident that he's got a lot more ability than his mark shows, so I knew when I was in front and started galloping away that he wasn't going to stop - Billy Loughnane, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Bet Â£10 Get Â£10 With vickers.bet Handicap
quotes.quote: We didn't know much about Darvel so that's why we ran him relatively quickly. He was rather disappointing us a bit on the all-weather, but he hadn't ran for a long time and probably needed it. We haven't had many runners, they haven't ran during the winter, we had a good second at Ascot and they're coming good now - Patrick Chamings, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I was delighted with his step up to a mile at Haydock, although the very testing ground wouldn't have suited him. He kept on well and should make decent progress this year. 11-05-21

runners.name: Marsh Benham
runners.comment: Most wins at Brighton; only midfield in this contest 12 months ago; opposed
runners.spotlight: Most wins at Brighton but hasn't shown his best form in two starts there this season; only midfield in this contest 12 months ago and isn't the percentage call.

runners.name: Huxley
runners.comment: Ex-Irish maiden who has weak claims on his middle-distance form for new yard
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish maiden who has very weak claims on his middle-distance form for current stable; chance depends on whether the drop back to 1m prompts a resurgence.

runners.name: Saturnalia
runners.owner: Ms H N Pinniger And Partner
runners.comment: Dual AW winner; 0-9 on grass and ran below par in most recent turf attempt
runners.spotlight: Dual AW winner for previous yard and placed a few times in that sphere for current stable; 0-9 on grass and ran below par in most recent turf attempt; not fully convincing.

stable_tour.quote: Having gelded him last summer he never made his racecourse debut until Lingfield in January when second over a mile. The drop back to 7f did the trick as next time out he won at Wolverhampton. He has run well in defeat since, notably when a neck second at Kempton. His last three runs, all on turf, have not been great but he is a solid horse and I am hoping that he can put those efforts behind him back at Newbury on Tuesday. I am looking for a nice run from him this week, but it could be that we have him wrong and he is a sprinter. 29-06-23

runners.name: Drumstick

prev_owners.owner: HM The King & HM The Queen

runners.comment: Maiden who has frame possibilities, provided his AW form is transferred back to turf
runners.spotlight: Maiden whose AW form since November features a few creditable efforts, keeping-on third at Kempton (1m) most recently; frame possibilities, provided he's as effective back on turf.

runners.name: Hover
runners.comment: Absent since finishing fifth in this race three years ago; market helpful
runners.spotlight: Successful on turf in 2020 and AW in 2021; absent since finishing fifth (off 10lb higher) in this race three years ago; the betting may prove best guide to expectations.

stable_tour.quote: He never ran as a two-year-old but won over 1m2f at Goodwood last year off a mark of 70. He starts this year off 75 and I feel he has improved at home so I would expect him to be competitive. It will be interesting to see how much he has come on when he gets to the course, but I'm happy with him. 05-05-21

runners.name: Newfangled
runners.comment: Solid operator who has form figures of 12112321, mostly on AW, since last July
runners.spotlight: Solid operator who has form figures of 12112321, mostly on AW, since last July; good second in last turf attempt; justified favouritism at Lingfield (1m) most recently; shortlisted.

runners.name: Racing Demon
runners.comment: On last winning mark and is interesting with AW reappearance under his belt
runners.spotlight: Five turf wins, the most recent off this mark at Bath (1m, good) last September; attractively weighted and is interesting back in this sphere with AW reappearance under his belt.

runners.name: Vellner
runners.comment: On a handy mark but has been absent for eight months; market instructive
runners.spotlight: Won off a similar mark last May but had the benefit of recent match practice, which he now lacks having been absent for eight months; market may offer further guidance.

quotes.race: William Hill Lengthen Your Odds Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Vellner has been green in his behaviour but I thought it would take a good horse to beat him. He's a lovely horse and I would say that's just the start with him - Paddy Twomey, trainer.

runners.name: English Spirit
runners.comment: All wins on Wolverhampton AW; below form returned to turf last time
runners.spotlight: All wins on Wolverhampton AW; below form returned to grass last time, taking record in this sphere to 0-15; well treated on best turf efforts but others have less to prove.

runners.name: Mybad
runners.comment: Owned by Andrew Balding; may improve now handicapping; market support should be noted
runners.spotlight: Owned by Andrew Balding, trained by Simon Hodgson; hasn't made much of a splash in three AW events but may do better now handicapping; market support should be noted.

runners.name: My Ambition
runners.comment: Close second at Bath last time; successful over this C&D early in career; respected
runners.spotlight: Suited by good ground or firmer; three-time winner at Bath and ran creditably (close second) there last time, improving on reappearance effort; scored over this C&D early in career; respected.

runners.name: Buy The Dip
runners.comment: All wins in Class 6 but has been placed at this better level; returns from break
runners.spotlight: All wins in Class 6 but has been placed at this better level, including off higher marks; each-way possibilities, provided he returns from a five-month break in top form.

runners.name: Windsor Pass
runners.comment: Has a poor strike-rate but earns points for consistency; again likely to go well
runners.spotlight: Only 1-35, the win on AW in January; however, what she lacks in strike-rate she makes up for in consistency and, off bottom weight, again looks likely to go well.

5:20.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered; 6.1)

runners.name: Channagide
runners.comment: Switches to turf over a trip that should suit; Oisin Murphy booked; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Struggled in three runs on dirt in Dubai but his three AW runs in Britain have all been respectable, beaten just over one length into fourth at Wolverhampton ten days ago; Oisin Murphy booked for turf debut; needs more but the longer trip can help.

runners.name: Bownder
runners.comment: Two 1m wins last year; placed over this trip on AW but vulnerable to stronger stayers
runners.spotlight: Won twice over a mile last season; second upped to this trip at Lingfield (AW) last month but he will find this a more challenging test at the trip; not at best at Nottingham since, either.

runners.name: Telecommunication
runners.comment: Off the mark at Yarmouth a fortnight ago (1m2f, good to firm); respected up 4lb
runners.spotlight: Beaten favourite on his reappearance at Wolverhampton in March but he turned in a career best when winning at Yarmouth two weeks ago (1m2f, good to firm); the runner-up has won since and the Topspeed figure was solid so no obvious reason why he wouldn't go well again.

runners.name: Carderock
runners.comment: Modest 2yo form but today's trip could bring about an improved showing
runners.spotlight: Modest form in four 2yo run from 5f to 7f; pedigree offers hope that he'll leave that behind now his stamina is more thoroughly tested.

runners.name: Silent Affair
runners.comment: Improved when second on handicap debut (9.5f, AW) last month; needs more but it's possible
runners.spotlight: She ran her best race so far when second of six on her handicap debut at Wolverhampton four weeks ago (9.5f); she will need a bit more to defy this mark but she showed promise on her sole turf start and is unexposed.

runners.name: Rorys Gold
runners.comment: Some promise on AW but improvement is essential if he's to make a winning turf debut
runners.spotlight: Promise in a couple of AW maidens, notably second of nine at Lingfield (1m) in January; never threatened at Wolverhampton on his handicap debut three weeks ago; improvement essential now making his turf debut.

runners.name: Olivia Jane
runners.comment: Didn't progress from debut effort when trained by C Cox; sold 5,000gns; upped in trip
runners.spotlight: Didn't progress from her debut second when trained by Clive Cox, well held in both handicaps; sold for 5,000gns this month; new yard step her up in trip but others look safer.

runners.name: Divot
runners.comment: No instant improvement for handicapping over 1m2f last month; still has time to do better
runners.spotlight: No immediate improvement for the step up to 1m2f/switch to handicaps at Yarmouth last month; could be sharper today and not yet exposed.

runners.name: Glenridding
runners.comment: 1m win as 2yo; strong in betting before being withdrawn at Yarmouth this month (got loose)
runners.spotlight: 1m Yarmouth win as a 2yo; got loose before the start and withdrawn back at Yarmouth two weeks ago (7-4 favourite at the time; race won by Telecommunication); one to consider.

runners.name: Blue Tempus
runners.owner: Helen Loggin, A Gemmell & A Stennett
runners.comment: Second, albeit well held, on handicap debut at Beverley; has more to offer; key player
runners.spotlight: Improved effort when second, albeit well beaten, on his handicap debut at Beverley three weeks ago (1m2f, good; winner won again since); still capable of better and he's a major player off an unchanged mark.

runners.name: Zarakerjack
runners.comment: Unplaced in three 1m AW runs this year; up in trip for handicap debut; can do better
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in three AW runs at 1m on AW this year; no surprise to see a better showing now upped in trip for his handicap debut.

runners.name: Hamdani Cruiser
runners.comment: Still looked in need of the experience when 6th on last month's handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Still looked to be learning his job when sixth on last month's handicap debut/reappearance at Yarmouth (1m2f, good to firm); dropped 2lb and could be sharper today.

runners.name: Azoozi
runners.comment: Hasn't progressed in handicaps thus far; new trip needs to turn things around
runners.spotlight: Hasn't made the progress that might have been expected in handicaps; creeping down the weights but hopes rest on the step up in trip sparking something extra.

runners.name: Naturally
runners.comment: Tailed off when 66-1 for her recent stable debut; new tongue-tie but not easily fancied
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in five runs for Ed Walker and she was tailed off when 66-1 for her stable debut at Goodwood two weeks ago (1m2f, good); new tongue-tie today but not easily recommended.

runners.name: Love You Back
runners.comment: Well beaten in three runs last autumn; bred to do better; gelded prior to handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Big prices and beat just two rivals home in three novice/maiden runs at up to 1m2f last autumn; bred to do better at some point and interesting to see how he goes in the betting now handicapping after gelding operation.

runners.name: Split Silk
runners.owner: R Barnett And Mrs B V Sangster
runners.comment: All runs at 7f and she could take a significant step forward now upped in distance
runners.spotlight: No immediate improvement for the switch to handicaps at Kempton last month (7f) but she looks ready for this big step up in trip and has hinted at ability; better expected.

4:05.race_name: Trade Nation Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (Div II)
4:05.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered; 6.1)

runners.name: Indian Springs
runners.comment: Finished with a flourish at Newmarket last month (7f, good); destined for bigger things
runners.spotlight: Promising third on his Kempton debut in December (6f) and more than backed up that positive impression when running away with a 7f maiden (good) at Newmarket four weeks ago; looked a fine prospect there and he's a strong contender despite his 7lb penalty.

runners.name: Accentuate
runners.comment: Promising third at Ascot on sole 2yo start (7f, good); hooded for return; more to come
runners.spotlight: Ran well in the face of evident inexperience when third on his Ascot debut last summer (7f, good); open to improvement and he's one to consider now tried in a hood for the first time.

runners.name: Baloos Blues
runners.comment: Unplaced in two 7f runs in late 2024; had wind op since latest; minor handicaps beckon
runners.spotlight: Modest form in two 7f runs in late 2024, including when well backed at Southwell in December; had wind surgery subsequently and it needs to have a dramatic effect.

runners.name: Bullington Bry
runners.comment: Sold for Â£1,000 last May; dam a maiden in France; has a good standard to aim at on debut
runners.spotlight: 17,000gns yearling; sold unraced last May for Â£1,000; fourth foal of a French maiden; has a good standard to aim at on his debut.

runners.name: Give Me The Night
runners.comment: 165,000euros yearling but sold unraced for 20,000gns last autumn; tongue tied for debut
runners.spotlight: 165,000euros yearling, 20,000gns 2yo; sixth foal; half-brother to four winners, notably Nazuna (7f/1m including US; RPR 103); tongue tied for debut; best watched.

runners.name: Prodigal Son
runners.comment: Modest form on AW debut (7f; 80-1) in December; can do better but tough task here
runners.spotlight: Ran to just a modest level on his Wolverhampton debut (7f; 80-1) in December; can do much better but he's in deep in this field.

runners.name: Raafedd
runners.comment: Shown promise in two 7f runs but has plenty to find with Indian Springs on Newmarket form
runners.spotlight: Shaped well on his AW debut in November (7f) but he was left trailing when Indian Springs moved through the gears at Newmarket last month; open to improvement and a tongue-tie may help but minor money perhaps his best hope.

runners.name: Seventy
runners.comment: Never dangerous at Newmarket (1m, good) on debut last month; can do better but needs to
runners.spotlight: Slowly away and never threatened in a 1m maiden at Newmarket last month; should do better at some point but he'll need a good step forward.

runners.name: Time Allowed
runners.comment: Promising 4th to Indian Springs at Newmarket on debut; 7lb better off and open to progress
runners.spotlight: Encouraging start to his career when fourth to Indian Springs at Newmarket last month (7f, good); 7lb better off for just over 3l and should get closer to his old rival with the experience behind him.

runners.name: Tokyo Joe
runners.comment: Useful pedigree but ran to just a modest level in a 7f novice at Kempton in December
runners.spotlight: Useful pedigree but he ran to a modest level in a 7f novice at Kempton in December; a big step forward is needed.

runners.name: Mielikki
runners.comment: Well beaten in a 7f fillies' maiden at Newmarket last November; may need longer trips
runners.spotlight: Dropped away to be beaten over 15l in a 7f fillies' novice at Newmarket in November; might not come into her own until tackling longer trips.

4:00.race_name: Juddmonte EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (For Horses In Bands C & D) (EBF Restricted Qualifier) (GBB)
4:00.stalls: (Stands' side course) 1m4f - Centre; Remainder - Stands' side

runners.name: Akabusi
runners.comment: 50-1 when beaten about 10l over a tad shorter at Brighton and limited appeal here
runners.spotlight: 50-1 when beaten about 10l over a tad shorter at Brighton (good to firm) and limited appeal here.

runners.name: Caitrinho
runners.comment: 24,000gns yearling; ninth foal; closely related to three winners; note in the betting
runners.spotlight: 24,000gns yearling; ninth foal; closely related to three winners including Maaward (7f/1m; RPR 101) and Mignolino (5f-7.5f; 94); dam Italian 6f winner and half-sister to 5f 2yo Group 3 winner; stable can ready a newcomer; one to note in the betting.

runners.name: Logi Bear
runners.owner: Ian Wight, Tony Lyons And Ptnr
runners.comment: Big positives to take from both his runs and he should be hard to beat
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to two winning sprinters and his dam was quick; both runs over 5f on good ground, finishing strongly at Leicester and then probably bumping into a good one when modestly drawn at Goodwood; could be hard to beat.

runners.name: Royal Bodyguard
runners.comment: May appreciate further than 6f but stable won this last year with a newcomer
runners.spotlight: 35,000gns yearling; third foal; half-brother to French 1m4f winner Cheek To Cheek; dam placed 1m-1m4f (RPR 82), half-sister to 1m4f Group 2 winner One Foot In Heaven; sire injects some speed into the pedigree and stable won this last year with a newcomer.

runners.name: Saeculamation
runners.comment: 32,000gns yearling; first foal out of a French 7f winner; stable newcomers best watched
runners.spotlight: 32,000gns yearling; first foal out of a French 7f winner and half-sister to winners Gamgoom (Italian 5f Listed) and Impulsion (6f 2yo); stable's newcomers are usually best watched.

runners.name: Somebody
runners.comment: Drawn moderately last week at Chester; may have to improve on his previous run
runners.spotlight: Drawn wide enough when well beaten at Chester last week but even a repeat of his second at Southwell (5f) might not be enough to topple Logi Bear, although was slowly away that day; entitled to have some say, however, now stepping up to 6f.

runners.name: Calchas
runners.breeder: Moyns Park Estate And Stud Ltd
runners.comment: 12,000gns yearling; dam 7f AW 2yo winner (RPR 85); stable had a 2yo winner last week
runners.spotlight: 12,000gns yearling; first foal; dam 7f AW 2yo winner (RPR 85), closely related to useful 7f 2yo winner Ceanna; stable had a breeze-up buy win first time out last week at Ascot; market confidence would heighten interest for sure.

runners.name: Faithful Dream
runners.comment: Never threatened at Beverley but only 9-2 and stable's 2yos often improve for a run
runners.spotlight: Stable's 2yos can improve plenty on their first run but this colt was slowly away at Beverley and hung late on, ultimately trailing the winner by 9l; odds of 9-2 suggests that better was expected of him.

runners.name: Galileo Island
runners.comment: 11,000gns yearling; 6f looks on the sharp side given his pedigree
runners.spotlight: 11,000gns yearling; first foal; dam 7f/1m AW winner (RPR 62), half-sister to winners Victory Chime (1m2f Listed) and Pontchateau (useful 1m1f-1m3f); 6f looks on the sharp side given his pedigree.

runners.name: Kings Courtier
runners.comment: 8,000gns yearling; sixth foal; brother to 5f 2yo winner Al Hussar (RPR 87)
runners.spotlight: 8,000gns yearling; sixth foal; brother to 5f 2yo winner Al Hussar (RPR 87) and half-brother to three winners including Royal Charter (6f-1m; 104) and Old News (6f-1m; 86); dam unraced half-sister to US 1m2f Grade 1 winner Queen's Trust; one to watch on debut.

runners.name: Athenas Fortune
runners.owner: J W Parry And Mrs C Shekells
runners.comment: Makes sense to check betting given her yard but may need further and she's the only filly
runners.spotlight: 18,000gns yearling; third foal; half-sister to French 1m AW winner Bolzano; dam French/German 1m3f/1m4f winner, half-sister to 1m Group 1 winner Prosperous Voyage; makes sense to check the betting given her yard but may need further and she's the only filly.

4:38.race_name: TrustATrader Approved And Reviewed Trades People Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
4:38.stalls: (Stands' side course) 1m4f - Centre; Remainder - Stands' side

runners.name: Lavender Hill Mob
runners.comment: Beaten 8l over C&D at the Guineas meeting but taking off 7lb with a claimer makes sense
runners.spotlight: Useful form in these colours for Michael Bell when highly tried on occasions; big things were expected of him in juvenile hurdles but his form tapered off; this is a drop in grade from his fourth here at the Guineas meeting (1m4f) but he was beaten 8l and connections now turn to a claiming rider, which probably makes sense.

stable_tour.quote: He's the biggest, the scopiest and the highest-rated of all the juveniles on the Flat, so we're really excited about him. He had a nice break after leaving Michael Bell's and he's been doing a lot of schooling since. We hope he's a Triumph Hurdle horse, so until he tells us otherwise we'll be aiming him that way. He's got to have that important first day of school out the way over hurdles first, so he'll be coming out in the next few weeks. He likes soft ground and we've got our eye on the Finale at Chepstow. 25-11-24

runners.name: Claymore
runners.comment: Stranded on a losing run since winning as a 3yo at Royal Ascot; not in great form
runners.spotlight: Stranded on a losing run since winning as a 3yo at Royal Ascot and there's been limited encouragement for a while now to suggest he's about to snap it.

quotes.race: Hampton Court Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Claymore has always been a proper horse. I think he improved in his trial and last time was just an absolute disaster. The only positive to come out of it was it probably made a man out of him, because his attitude today was brilliant. It was a first-class performance - Adam Kirby, jockey.

quotes.race: bet365 Craven Stakes (Group 3) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: That was a great run from a maiden winner and it was no disgrace to be beaten by last year's champion two-year-old. Claymore is French-bred so I think the plan would be to head to the French 2,000 Guineas as he will get all the premiums - Hugo Lascelles, racing manager to owner Mary Slack.

runners.name: Fouroneohfever
runners.comment: 4th off this mark over same trip at Royal Ascot last year; good run at Chester last week
runners.spotlight: Both turf wins have been at Chester where he looked threatening last week over 1m2f before weakening at the death; still ran well and he was fourth of 19 off this mark in a strong 1m4f handicap at last year's Royal Ascot; every chance.

quotes.race: Camden Town Brewery Handicap
quotes.quote: That was lovely. Fouroneohfever is a big-framed horse and he will continue to improve. It was his turf debut and a tough learning curve in front of a big crowd - he looks a nice horse - Henry Morshead, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Get The Inside Track With raceday-ready.com Handicap
quotes.quote: I wasn't actually sure whether I got up or not. We didn't go very quick but Rossa (Ryan, jockey on runner-up) put an injection of pace going round the bend and I was more trying to teach Fouroneohfever how to race. He's had three runs and he's still learning on the job. He's a horse we're going to be seeing over longer distances and he really wasn't in love with the track. He's got a massive stride and he's made for turf racing so when he gets on turf on a bigger track he can hopefully climb through the ranks - Billy Loughnane, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He could have done with slower ground last time and ran a bit fresh, but I was pleased as he'd been off the track a while. I think we would have seen a bit more if we'd had some more typical Doncaster weather. He could step up in trip and something like the Copper Horse could be a target if we can get his rating high enough. 07-04-25

runners.name: Knightswood
runners.comment: Season started well; can be relied upon to give his running and be seriously involved
runners.spotlight: Loves Ripon where he won again last month by a narrow margin; badly in under a penalty when a close third over 1m6f here 12 days ago and he's 2lb lower for this; can be relied upon to give his running and be seriously involved.

runners.name: Speriamo
runners.owner: Exorsofs Agodino,C M Budgett,P J Mcbride
runners.comment: Last autumn went well; just behind Lavender Hill Mob here on comeback run
runners.spotlight: A good run of form last autumn was mostly on the AW but she also finished second here; may have needed the run after a break when close up behind Lavender Hill Mob in a Class 2 handicap here two weeks ago.

quotes.race: Jenningsbet Handicap
quotes.quote: We've taken Speriamo out four times on account of soft ground and it was just nice for her to run on quick for a change. William Buick gave her a lovely front-running ride - Charlie McBride, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing Welfare Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Speriamo was unsuited by the soft ground the last twice and enjoyed this ground better - Charlie McBride, trainer.

2:18.race_name: TrustATrader Apply Today "Hands And Heels" Apprentice Handicap (Part Of Racing Excellence Series)
2:18.stalls: (Stands' side course) 1m4f - Centre; Remainder - Stands' side

runners.name: Onemorenomore
runners.comment: Arrives here in pretty good form and this is a drop in grade from Doncaster last time
runners.spotlight: Suffered a near miss at Southwell (7f; clear of the third) and raced up with a strong gallop when sixth of 15 at Doncaster (good); that wasn't a bad effort and this represents a drop in grade.

quotes.race: Thank You To Doncaster Annual Members Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Onemorenomore is a jockey's dream, he's very straightforward - just switch him off early and try not to get there too soon - Billy Loughnane, jockey.

quotes.race: Grace And Dotty Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: I thought Onemorenomore was too far back, I thought he was never going to get there. But he did exactly the same thing here last year, just getting there on the nod in the last 20 yards. He's that type of horse, we ride him behind at home and he always finishes off his gallops. The way he ran, he'll probably get a mile. He's declared for Southwell on Sunday and there's no reason why he shouldn't run. He takes his galloping well, he's a nice big horse -  Philip McBride, trainer.

runners.name: Stratocracy
runners.owner: Total Asbestos Solutions Ltd & A Frost
runners.comment: Arrives here in better form than most; races prominently, which is never a bad thing here
runners.spotlight: Both wins at 1m but one of his two thirds after a break was at 7f and he arrives here in better form than most; races prominently, which is never a bad thing here.

runners.name: Nammos
runners.comment: Disappointing the last twice at Chelmsford and she has a good record there; 0-8 on turf
runners.spotlight: Kicked off her second stint with Jane Chapple-Hyam by winning two of her first three races, all over 7f at Chelmsford; below par there following a break and she's 0-8 on turf, so has some questions to answer.

stable_tour.quote: She had her first run for me the other day at Doncaster, having come from Phil Kirby. She ran well under a positive ride by Laura Coughlan, a jockey I like, and wasn't beaten far. She's had a few different stables but is a lovely-natured filly. Hopefully we can build on that and I'd be confident of getting a win with her. 26-07-24

runners.name: Split Elevens
runners.breeder: Saleh Al Homaizi & Imad Al Sagar
runners.comment: Has been running well on AW; good chance provided he clicks with new partner Katrine Holm
runners.spotlight: 7f is his trip and he's a 12-time winner; the AW is more his scene (ten wins on those surfaces) but he arrives here in form and has twice finished third at Newmarket; good chance provided he clicks with new partner Katrine Holm.

stable_tour.quote: He's a bit of a character who tends to hold a bit back for himself. That said, he has done very well this season with three wins and is now 9lb higher than at the start of the year. I hope we can squeeze some more improvement out of him, possibly over a mile, as his only run when stepped up from 7f to that distance was a winning one last month at Brighton. 23-09-22

runners.name: Spanish Mane
runners.comment: Ran poorly at Doncaster after going close at Yarmouth (7f, good) under Chloe Lyons
runners.spotlight: Ran poorly at Doncaster after going close at Yarmouth (7f, good) under Chloe Lyons; trip/ground ideal and this multiple winner could bounce back.

runners.name: Cooperation
runners.comment: Below par of late; had 55 races and all bar one of those have been at sprint distances
runners.spotlight: Threatened in two of his first three races for this yard but his form has dipped in varying headgear; had 55 races and all bar one of those have been at sprint distances.

stable_tour.quote: A new horse to us after we bought him for 6,000gns at the September sales at Newmarket. He's a six-time winner who's had a career-high mark of 84. He's come down to a career-low of 60, having not won in quite a long time. We think he's just the type Mick Appleby can sweeten up and get back on track. He's got a lot of all-weather form and we'll aim him at the bonuses available at the Arena Racing Company tracks. There's a lot of prize-money available for horses like him and we feel he has the right profile and rating to have a good winter on the all-weather. If he can get his mojo back, we could have a lot of fun with him. 26-09-24

runners.name: Zina Colada
runners.comment: Fair fourth last time but inconsistent and is 5lb higher here (out of the weights)
runners.spotlight: Ran quite well under Lillie Dingle at Yarmouth (7f, good; scene of sole success) but she's not the easiest to predict and is 5lb higher here (out of the weights).

runners.name: Basharat
runners.comment: Limited to four races since only career win over 6f in September 2021; 5lb wrong
runners.spotlight: Limited to four races since only career win over 6f in September 2021; now back from another absence and 5lb wrong at the weights.

runners.name: Hold The Press
runners.comment: Returs from an absence with lots to prove and he's 7lb out of the weights
runners.spotlight: Sole win in 21 starts came on the AW in September 2023; twice below par on that surface before finishing tailed off in a Brighton classified race when last seen nearly a year ago; lots to prove and he's 7lb out of the weights.

quotes.race: Racing League On Sky Sports Racing Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Hold The Press didn't run too bad a couple of starts ago when he was mangled on the bend. But he looked in good order and we did hope for a good run, but I was very surprised he went out and won. I don't back horses and I'll let the others do that and see if they managed to get on! - John Jenkins, trainer.

3:25.race_name: TrustATrader Fully Vetted Tradespeople Fillies' Handicap
3:25.stalls: (Stands' side course) 1m4f - Centre; Remainder - Stands' side

runners.name: Twirler
runners.comment: Dual winner for Charlie Fellowes but hasn't got a lot going for her current yard
runners.spotlight: Back-to-back wins in early 2024 included a handicap when trained by Charlie Fellowes; hasn't got a lot going in three runs for her current yard.

runners.name: Renesmee

prev_owners.owner: Roberto Favarulo & King For A Day

runners.comment: Consistent but she has moved yards and last season's peak form was over further
runners.spotlight: Pretty consistent despite a modest strike-rate but she has moved yards and last season's peak form was over further.

runners.name: Mehmas Shy Angel
runners.comment: Similar sort of form in four non-handicaps on the AW; left Richard Hughes for 12,500gns
runners.spotlight: Similar form in four non-handicaps on the AW, running respectably; however, doesn't look thrown in for this first handicap, having left Richard Hughes for 12,500gns.

runners.name: Stacey Racey
runners.comment: Hasn't raced on turf but this trip is worth exploring after keeping on well at Chelmsford
runners.spotlight: 6f/7f winner on the AW; hasn't raced on turf but this trip is worth exploring after keeping on well at Chelmsford (7f).

runners.name: Hot Like Me
runners.comment: No excuses last time but ran okay; chance that the new headgear might trigger something
runners.spotlight: Just about her best run yet when beaten 3l behind an improver at Wolverhampton (9.4f) ten days ago; had no excuses there but always a chance that the new headgear might trigger something.

runners.name: My Mate Beattie
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing Ii And Partner
runners.comment: Placed form but remains a maiden and has beaten only one rival in her last two races
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden who has been up and down and now looks exposed; has beaten only one rival in her last two races.

runners.name: Manyana Blue
runners.comment: 25-1 chance on handicap debut at Nottingham (1m2f) and trailed in out the back
runners.spotlight: Placed in 7f/8.6f novices on AW but was a weak 25-1 chance on handicap debut at Nottingham (1m2f) and trailed in out the back; only 2lb higher for this return to 1m.

runners.name: Zaraquelle
runners.comment: Only 3-1 for handicap debut and either needed the run or failed to stay 9.4f; respected
runners.spotlight: Quiet last year at 7f/1m when there was ease underfoot; only 3-1 for AW/handicap debut at Wolverhampton (9.4f) but either that run was needed or she failed to stay; either way, she's respected here.

runners.name: Sixteen One
runners.comment: Hardly progressive and a tongue-tie is added for this belated handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Perhaps failed to stay 1m2f last time and was knocking on the door in her previous maidens at 1m; hardly progressive, though, and a tongue-tie is added for this belated handicap debut.

runners.name: French Haven
runners.comment: Poor in handicaps from the front; Spencer booked this time so might be held up
runners.spotlight: Debut at Glorious Goodwood was encouraging but hasn't progressed, including two heavy defeats from the front in handicaps (9.4f/1m2f); different tactics might be entertained with Jamie Spencer booked.

2:52.stalls: (Stands' side course) 1m4f - Centre; Remainder - Stands' side

runners.name: Bedouin Prince
runners.comment: The form of his Doncaster win hasn't worked out too well and he carries a penalty
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to a 1m4f winner in France and he improved for the step up to 1m2f when narrowly off the mark on good to soft at Doncaster; might not be overly inconvenienced by this drop in trip, but that latest form hasn't worked out particularly well and he carries a penalty.

runners.name: Double Meaning
runners.comment: Beaten 16l on the July course (1m, good) and then about 12l at Pontefract (1m2f, soft)
runners.spotlight: Beaten 16l on the July course (1m, good) and then about 12l at Pontefract (1m2f, soft); one for another day.

runners.name: Eternal Force
runners.comment: Appeared to perform below market expectations here in October; the ground was soft
runners.spotlight: Beat only one home here in October (7f, soft; 5-1) but he's a well-bred son of Dubawi who should be capable of much better and he encounters different ground this time.

runners.name: Formidable Don
runners.breeder: Ross Na Ree House Farm & Waldgeist Synd
runners.comment: 6,000gns yearling; third foal; dam unplaced 7f-1m6f (RPR 46); likely to be outclassed
runners.spotlight: 15,000euros foal, 6,000gns yearling; third foal; dam unplaced 7f-1m6f (RPR 46), half-sister to Listed-placed winners Arm Candy (7f/1m) and Mutajarred (1m-1m2f); opposable first time out in a race of this nature.

runners.name: Noble Horizon
runners.comment: Lots to like about his sole run last season and looks a surefire improver at three
runners.spotlight: Kingman colt out of Irish Oaks winner Great Heavens; only 9-2 at Kempton (1m) and after getting a little outpaced he saw his race out well to finish fourth of 13; looks a surefire improver at three; yard runs two so the market could be informative.

runners.name: Showyoutheropes
runners.comment: Showed more at Yarmouth (1m, good to firm), though was still only midfield
runners.spotlight: Down the field in the Wood Ditton here and showed more at Yarmouth (1m, good to firm), though was still only midfield; handicaps will be more like it.

runners.name: Sunshine Mag
runners.comment: Had no excuses from a good position at Southwell (7f; 10-1) and this looks a stronger race
runners.spotlight: Had no excuses from a good position at Southwell (7f AW; 10-1) and this looks a stronger race.

runners.name: Wicked
runners.breeder: S C Wood Nook Farm Pty
runners.comment: Not living up to his pedigree but there's time yet and he has shown ability
runners.spotlight: Kingman colt out of a smart Galileo mare and cost 600,000gns; with all that in mind it's been an underwhelming start in 7f/1m novices, the latest at Southwell; has been slow to break in both races so still learning the job, and therefore a likely improver at some point.

runners.name: Favorite Memory
runners.comment: Frankel filly and a sister to US 1m turf winner Daddy Frank; could be interesting
runners.spotlight: Frankel filly and a sister to US 1m turf winner Daddy Frank; dam unplaced 1m/9.5f in France (RPR 72), closely related to US 1m1f Grade 3 winner Andromeda's Hero; would command considerable respect if at all strong in the market.

5:15.race_name: TrustATrader You Can Trust Our Traders Handicap
5:15.stalls: (Stands' side course) 1m4f - Centre; Remainder - Stands' side
