runners.name: Midnight City
runners.comment: Hardly progressive but can win a race off this mark and a visor is tried
runners.spotlight: Class 4 was asking a bit much of him two runs back and he then reportedly found the ground too loose when well beaten at Nottingham; hardly progressive but can win a race off this mark and a visor is tried.

runners.name: Forever My Prince
runners.comment: Nursery winner last July; only 2lb higher, gelded and might have a lot more to offer
runners.spotlight: Ran okay in sprint novices (good and fast ground) before justifying favouritism on handicap debut at Lingfield (6f, soft) last summer; only 2lb higher, has been gelded and might well have a lot more to offer.

quotes.race: Get The Inside Track With raceday-ready.com Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Forever My Prince wandered about a bit under pressure but I think he just got a bit lonely out in front. I think he'll improve for better ground, but he was due a win - Eve Johnson Houghton, trainer.

runners.name: Camera Shy
runners.owner: P Trainor And Mrs G Rowland-Clark
runners.comment: C&D debut winner; stayed on quite well for a fourth under a patient ride at Windsor
runners.spotlight: C&D debut winner last year; that's just about his best form but he stayed on well under a patient ride back over 6f (from 7f) last time at Windsor and now goes in cheekpieces; considered.

quotes.race: Juddmonte EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands B-D) (EBF Restricted Race Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I bought Camera Shy for 50,000 guineas at the Doncaster breeze-ups, I would have paid more but he didn't breeze that well to be honest. The consignor Paddy Vaughan put him to me and he was right - Nick Bell, trainer's son.

runners.name: May Encounter
runners.comment: Qualifying runs weren't devoid of promise and she's the type to pay her way in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced filly whose qualifying runs weren't devoid of promise and she's the type to pay her way in handicaps; worth checking in the betting.

runners.name: My Mate Kev
runners.comment: Front-running third at Doncaster and off same mark here with Fred Daly claiming 7lb
runners.spotlight: 6f maiden winner on the AW last year; had a poor draw on handicap debut but seen to much better effect when a front-running third at Doncaster (good to firm) and gets in off the same mark here with Fred Daly claiming 7lb; must be considered.

runners.name: Dapper Guest
runners.comment: Only his second run in a handicap when never closer than at the finish at Windsor
runners.spotlight: Only his second run in a handicap when never closer than at the line at Windsor (6f, good to firm), finishing close up behind Camera Shy; down 2lb and has a big run in him.

runners.name: Sabrimento
runners.comment: Took nice races to win for Brian Meehan (on soft at Bath) and he's 0-5 for current yard
runners.spotlight: Took nine races to win for Brian Meehan (on soft at Bath) and he's 0-5 for current yard and been kept to the AW; might not be straightforward and they keep tweaking his headgear.

runners.name: Rokuni
runners.comment: 0-7 for current team and his third at Leicester two runs back was over 7f
runners.spotlight: 6f Brighton maiden winner for former yard; 0-7 for current team and his third at Leicester two runs back was over 7f; slipped at the start returned to 6f last time; others are more intriguing.

runners.name: Alashos
runners.breeder: Scea Marmion Vauville, Ecurie Skymarc Fa
runners.comment: Respectable first run after being gelded but performed moderately the last twice
runners.spotlight: Fast-ground maiden winner last summer over 6f; no further improvement since, and after a respectable first run after being gelded he's performed moderately the last twice.

runners.name: Rogue Dynasty
runners.comment: 0-4 las season; improvement required on reappearance/handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Best of four runs last year when fourth of ten at Southwell (6f, AW); improvement required on reappearance/handicap debut and trainer sees the need for a claimer.

stable_tour.quote: Owned by The Rogues Gallery, she's a filly we bought from the Doncaster Breeze-Up who ticks a lot of boxes. She's probably going to end up being a 7f filly, but will start over six soon. 30-05-24

runners.name: Bow Street
runners.comment: AW winner; 0-4 on grass; hold-up tactics might not be ideal here on quickening ground
runners.spotlight: Only win and best form has been on the AW; wasn't beaten too far in his only handicap on grass and was just 3l away in two AW handicaps before hampered by a slow start last time; hold-up tactics might not be ideal here on quickening ground.

runners.name: Royal Accord
runners.comment: Recent wins have come in Class 6 affairs and this demands another personal best
runners.spotlight: His two wins have come in his last three races, both Class 6s affairs at Lingfield and Brighton; 3lb higher than last time but effectively up 6lb as they claimed 3lb as well; needs another personal best.

7:23.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered)

runners.name: Kyprios

prev_owners.owner: Moyglare Stud Farm & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
Moyglare Stud Farm & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor

runners.comment: Champion stayer bids for third win in last four years in this; unopposable
runners.spotlight: Champion stayer of recent years attempts to win this for the third time in the last four years; unblemished record last season included wins at the highest level in Ascot and Goodwood Cups, Irish St Leger and Prix Du Cadran; reappeared for traditional Vintage Crop win at Navan last month and another straightforward task here en route to Ascot.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Vintage Crop Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Kyprios only does what he has to do. Ryan [Moore, jockey] was very happy with him, so once Ryan is happy I'm delighted. That's him, just totally relaxed all the time. He's very classy, well he's in second gear all the time probably. The plan will be to go back to Leopardstown and then the Gold Cup. We'll stick to that. He's a remarkable horse. It's incredible he's even here and what he's doing is incredible, too. He's as enthusiastic as he ever was, he was like that as a two-year-old as well. His demeanour hasn't changed. It's pure, raw ability - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Qipco British Champions Long Distance Cup (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Kyprios didn't really have much of a race today, he only cantered around but it was the same after his last run in France. He lost no weight and ever since France he's been putting on weight again. He's just an unbelievably classy horse. He loves coming racing and is so laid back. We'll give him the winter off now and then he'll have his two trials [next year] before coming back here for the Gold Cup. That's what we're working towards - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Qatar Prix du Cadran (Group 1) (4yo+) (New & Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Kyprios is incredible. Hopefully, if everything is well with him we'll head back to Ascot before giving him the winter off, and come back for the Gold Cup next year with the two preps before it again - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Comer Group International Irish St. Leger (Group 1)
quotes.quote: Kyprios is so special, he's a very, very special horse and every year he seems to be improving. That even looks to be his best again and Ryan said he won so easy. He doesn't have to run again this year; the way we approach every race is that we see how he is and have a chat and then see if we go again and he could run in an Arc. It's important to mind him, do the right thing for him, and let him tell us how he is - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Al Shaqab Goodwood Cup Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: I thought there would be pace with Al Qareem, he's usually a free-going horse. It took him a while to get Gregory but I thought we would go along today. Kyprios stays well, so I was going to be forward anyway and it was all very smooth. The only thing that happened was we slipped on the top turn, and I was on the back foot then and dropped away from the horse I wanted to take me into the race. But he still got there with two to run, he was going very easily and was a little idle in front, but it's obviously a tremendous performance. He's been a great horse for a long time now and his record is incredible since we stepped him up in trip. When you ask him and when he picks up the bridle he's got pace. He saves a bit for himself really but when you get it out of him he's got proper speed. - Ryan Moore, jockey.

quotes.race: Gold Cup (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Ryan gave Kyprios an unbelievable ride. Incredible. It wasn't easy. The second horse passed him here last year, and the second horse came back at him. I could see Ryan biding his time, and he went there and went there. It's incredible, it's masterful stuff, really. It's not simple, it's incredible. An incredible horse and I'm so delighted for everybody. There's an unbelievable team around him that make it happen - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Saval Beg Levmoss Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Kyprios is a lovely horse. When he gets there he just pulls up. He has plenty of speed left but he is just lazy. The plan was to have the two races and then go to Ascot, it's great to get him back - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: SBK Vintage Crop Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Kyprios had been pleasing us. Wayne set a nice even pace on Queenstown, a lovely horse himself who just kept taking him there, so we couldn't be happier. When he gets there he doesn't do much but he travelled easily the whole way - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Qipco British Champions Long Distance Cup (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted on how Kyprios has come back this season [from injury]. Obviously he made great progress from the Curragh and ran a great race today - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Qatar Prix du Cadran (Group 1) (4yo+) (New & Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Kyprios is a great horse and it's a privilege to have him. He has an unbelievable capacity for covering any amount of distance. He obviously has an incredible heart and lungs. Ryan rode him handy all the way and his opponents just fell away as they turned into the straight and he got left there. That's what happened when he came up the straight. He lost a shoe halfway up the straight as well (off fore shoe), probably when he turned the way he did. Maybe that was a little bit of the reason, maybe it wasn't, but I think he was just left in front too long - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Comer Group International Irish St. Leger (Group 1)
quotes.quote: Kyprios is such a talented racehorse and such a pleasure to ride. He is a little bit lazy but there is so much there every time you ask him he will find a little bit more for you. He is a very special stayer. He broke well and then just wanted to follow for a bit. I didn't want the race being slowly run. The pace was nice and even and I was happy where I was. He started to take me coming down the hill and he was always going to keep finding then - Ryan Moore, rider

quotes.race: Al Shaqab Goodwood Cup Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Ryan gave him a beautiful ride. Kyprios is a horse who keeps plenty and is very lazy, but it's brilliant and I'm delighted. It was great they all came into the straight and Ryan had him in a beautiful position, while he's a horse who loves a fight. He's lazy and if you want him to stay in first gear, he'll stay in first gear. That's the way he is and always has been; he saves everything but is very professional. I'd say there's a lot more to come from him. He loves racing and is easy on himself. These races - the Gold Cup and Goodwood Cup - were planned out for him and the plan from here was the Irish St Leger. He's got a lot of class and quality and even though he ran two miles there and two and a half at Ascot, we would have had no problem starting him over a mile and a quarter next year. He has that pace, but you don't see it because he doesn't show it - unless you really want it - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Gold Cup (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: It wasn't a nice race to ride. Kyprios stepped slow, which is unusual for him and I didn't like the spot we were in as we were going slow. They were getting an easy time up front and I had to move him to the outside - I don't like doing that. We got going and he's got there and Mojo Star has come to us and that's when he's clicked in, it was comfortable at the line. It wasn't a true test today but I'm glad he's come over here and won. There will be lots of good days with him. He was much the best - Ryan Moore, jockey.

quotes.race: Vintage Crop Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: We always thought Kyprios was going to be very nice but he went to Ascot last year and jumped out under the stalls before the start. He hasn't run since then. He looks a stayer with a bit of class. He relaxes and quickens and has done well since last year. If he was going for the Ascot Gold Cup, he could run in the Saval Beg at Leopardstown, but we'll see - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Blackwater Race
quotes.quote: Kyprios probably did well to win at two but it was great to get him a win and get some experience into him then. He's not too slow and I was happy with him today. He's right up there or just behind the best of them - Seamie Heffernan, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's back and in great shape and the plan is to go back to Royal Ascot to try for a third Gold Cup with two runs beforehand. Then everything else can fall into line after that. Everything is very good with him at the moment. He's incredible, he just goes forward, plants himself in second gear and goes asleep. He's always been like that, even when he was a two-year-old. I remember when we took him to Newmarket for the Zetland Stakes, he went asleep and didn't wake up at all in the race. His personality is the same still and Ryan [Moore] rides him great. 07-04-25

runners.name: Dallas Star
runners.breeder: E Dieuaide & Domaine Billard Et Fils
runners.comment: Didn't get home over 1m4f in Group John Porter; obvious stamina concerns
runners.spotlight: 1m2f Group 3 winner on heavy ground here on first start last term and winning return in minor Dundalk contest at same trip in February; well below best twice since, latest when didn't get home over 1m4f in Group John Porter at Newbury last month; both trip and ground don't look in his favour here.

quotes.race: P.W. McGrath Memorial Ballysax Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Dallas Star will be entered in all the big races now I suppose and we'll see where we go. I'll have to chat to Kia [Joorabchian, owner] and Robson [Aguiar] and see where they want to go. He came to us over the winter and is a lovely horse - Adrian Murray, trainer.

quotes.race: British EBF Future Stayers' Novice Stakes (Sire And Dam Restricted Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Dallas Star is s a lovely horse and has always been a big, raw type. His first run was good at Haydock and then we pitched him in deep in the Chesham, and he ran well, but I stress he's big and raw and has taken time. Rossa says he'll be nicer again next year when he'll want further. I remember saying to someone at Haydock he could be an Ebor horse one day and I haven't changed my mind - he'll be a nice, staying type. This ground isn't essential, but he enjoys it - Dominic Ffrench Davis, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been running really well. He came to us with a big reputation from Robson Aguiar, who pretrains all the Amo horses, and he thought a lot of him. He has proved to be a nice horse and I remember saying after his first run that he might be an Ebor horse one day and I still think he will be. I think he'll be a lovely staying type of horse, it's just a case of keeping him on the right side of the handicapper and bringing him along nice and slowly. He's had a bit of a break but you can expect to see him out before the end of the year and we'd like to find him a race he could win rather than pitching him in too deep. 21-09-23

runners.name: Duraji
runners.comment: Very lightly raced 4yo came up short in German Group 2 recently; upped in trip now
runners.spotlight: Very lightly raced half-brother to top-class Ghaiyyath; landed 1m2f maiden here on second start last summer but was off the track until last month when well held in Group 2 at Cologne over 1m4f, weakening final 2f; step up in trip doesn't appear an obvious route but still unexposed.

runners.name: Mont St Michel
runners.owner: Moyglare Stud Farm & Mrs J Magnier & M Tabor & D Smith
runners.comment: Lightly raced 4yo back from long absence and likely pacemaker for Kyprios
runners.spotlight: Galileo 4yo has obviously had his problems, this being only his third start an first since touched off in 1m5f Limerick maiden last June (good) when wearing tongue-tie and blinkers; headgear left off here and likely pacemaker for Kyprios.

runners.name: Satin
runners.comment: Less negatives than some of these re trip and ground so could be the one for second
runners.spotlight: Smart handicap form in 2023 included C&D win in premier handicap; below par during a light campaign last year but much more encouraging effort on second start this term when forcing pace in 1m4f Cork handicap 10 days ago, rallying well when beaten a neck; less negatives than some of these regarding trip and ground so could be the one to follow Kyprios home.

stable_tour.quote: She had a great campaign last season, winning three times and improving plenty. We'll wait until the ground dries up as she needs good ground. She'll probably start off over a mile and a half and we could try a mile and six with her at some stage during the season. 24-04-24

5:05.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered)

runners.name: Estoublon
runners.comment: Slow to break and ran green on recent debut over inadequate trip; more expected of now
runners.spotlight: Wootton Bassett colt a 160,000Euros yearling; first foal; dam 1m4f winner, sister to middle-distance Group 2 winner Leo De Fury, half-sister to 1m2f-1m4f Group 1 winner Luxembourg; slow to break, ran green and not clear run when midfield in good-class Navan maiden (6f) last month; 2l to find with Ipanema Beach on that run but bred to relish this longer trip and likely improver.

runners.name: Ipanema Beach
runners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith
runners.comment: Eyecatching Navan debut fourth, 2l ahead of Estoublon; big player
runners.spotlight: Siyouni half-brother to Australian 1m winner Maximum Dividend; dam Group 3 winner, sister to a middle-distance winner First Officer; eyecatching debut in Navan maiden last month, coming from last (green) to finish fourth behind a clear winner; 2l ahead of Estoublon then and interesting to see which of the pair makes the most improvement upped in trip here.

runners.name: Italy
runners.comment: Wootton Bassett colt cost 200,000gns; obvious appeal from top yard
runners.spotlight: Wootton Bassett colt cost 200,000gns as a yearling; half-brother to winners Bowmark (Listed-placed 1m; RPR 106), Bouquet (1m 2yo; 94), Hidden Story (1m2f AW; 93) and Fighter Command (1m2f; 90); dam 1m2f Listed winner (100), sister to Derby winner Serpentine; top yard; newcomer has to be respected although no fancy entries.

runners.name: Star Chamber
runners.comment: Mehmas colt; top connections, any market strength on debut has to be noted
runners.spotlight: Homebred Mehmas colt is second foal of a 7f winner (RPR 81), a sister to useful 7f-2m winner Duty Of Care, and half-sister to Breeders' Cup Mile winner Expert Eye; family of 1,000 Guineas winner Special Duty; top connections, any market strength on debut has to be noted.

runners.name: The Memphis King
runners.comment: Behind throughout after slow start on last month's Curragh debut; easily passed over
runners.spotlight: Behind throughout after slow start on last month's Curragh debut; easily passed over.

runners.name: Thesecretadversary
runners.owner: Cayton Park Stud & Mrs John Magnier
runners.comment: Newcomer probably best watched in what could be a hot maiden
runners.spotlight: St Mark's Basilica colt is second foal of a 1m/9.4f (Listed) winner (RPR 104), closely related to useful winners Wargrave (7f/1m2f; 2m hurdle) and Ahandfulofsummers (1m1f); newcomer probably best watched in what could be a hot maiden.

runners.name: Sursum Corda
runners.comment: Kodi Bear filly cost 25,000Euros; debutante best watched
runners.spotlight: Kodi Bear filly cost 25,000Euros as a yearling; second foal; dam modest maiden, closely related to 9.4f Group 3 winner/Irish Oaks runner-up Jack Naylor; debutante best watched.

5:40.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Median Auction Maiden
5:40.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered)

runners.name: Anchors Away
runners.comment: Big prices and well held on both starts last year for Sarah Dawson; can only be watched
runners.spotlight: Big prices and well held on both starts last year for Sarah Dawson; can only be watched.

runners.name: Dahoma
runners.comment: Staying on Gowran fourth an improvement; likely player here
runners.spotlight: Definite step forward on latest outing when staying on fourth (beaten under 2l) at Gowran last month; bit to find with both Senna's Girl and Hopes Are High on that run but definitely one to consider.

runners.name: Hopes Are High
runners.comment: Gowran comeback run on soft was encouraging, run since on quicker ground raises questions
runners.spotlight: Nicely improved on comeback when third (Senna's Girl second, Dahoma fourth) over 7f at Gowran last month on soft but not as effective on quicker ground in similar contest early this month; not sure this longer trip is what he wants and ground concerns.

runners.name: Immortal Jock
runners.comment: Debutant likely all the better for the experience
runners.spotlight: 9,000Euros yearling; half-brother to four winners including Spiritual Star (7f-8.6f including at 2/AW; RPR 106); dam 7f 2yo/1m winner (87); likely all the better for the experience.

runners.name: Kevin The Great
runners.comment: Mild recent debut promise at Navan; more likely here
runners.spotlight: Saxon Warrior half-brother to winners Arqoob (1m-1m4f Flat inc AW, RPR 98; 2m hurdle), Chimney Rock (German 1m1f/1m3f; 96) and Dromantine (7f AW 2yo; 79); dam 6f/7f winner (inc AW; 96); yard outsider on recent debut but showed some promise in 1m2f Navan maiden without landing a blow; back in trip here and likely improver.

runners.name: Lauderdale King
runners.comment: Newcomer best watched
runners.spotlight: King Of Change gelding is first foal of a hurdle winner, a half-sister to Listed-placed 1m-1m1f winner Major Title, family of Doncaster Cup winner Far Cry; newcomer best watched.

runners.name: Royal Belief
runners.comment: Newcomer best watched unless market suggests otherwise
runners.spotlight: Make Believe gelding a 11,000Euros yearling; half-brother to four winners inc Rhythmic Intent (1m2f-14.5f; RPR 103), Chance To Dream (1m/1m2f; 82) and Labyrinth (1m; 80); dam unraced grandaughter of French Oaks winner Caerlina; newcomer best watched unless market suggests otherwise.

runners.name: Summer Island
runners.owner: Nigel Ohare/Martin W White/Mark Devlin/Rockview Stables
runners.comment: Slowly away when never really counting on last month's Cork debut; best watched for now
runners.spotlight: Caravaggio gelding was slowly away when never really counting on last month's Cork debut; best watched for now.

runners.name: Al Rojo Vivo
runners.comment: Poor form last year for Darren Bunyan, easily passed over
runners.spotlight: Poor form last year for Darren Bunyan, easily passed over.

runners.name: Banner Beauty
runners.owner: O B P Carroll & Anthony Vaughan
runners.comment: Close fourth here last October for previous yard makes her a player if staying 1m
runners.spotlight: Nice run here on second of two starts last year for the Halford/Collins team, keeping on well over 7f when beaten 1l into fourth; this trip could prove her limit but definite player on that run.

runners.name: Chipsrdown
runners.comment: Kodi Bear filly never counted after slow start on Naas debut six days ago
runners.spotlight: Kodi Bear filly never counted after slow start on Naas debut six days ago.

runners.name: Echinacea
runners.comment: Curragh debut promise not built on at Gowran but excuses; remains potential improver
runners.spotlight: Outran big odds on Curragh debut in March (7f, soft) but not so effective given a greater stamina test (1m, heavy) at Gowran following month, not the best of starts and meeting trouble in running; remains a potential improver and encounters much quicker ground here.

runners.name: Givehertilxmas
runners.comment: Slow to break when beaten 12l on both starts in Gowran maidens; more one for handicaps
runners.spotlight: Slow to break when beaten around 12l on both starts in Gowran maidens this term; probably one for handicaps.

runners.name: Jet Black Jewel
runners.comment: Newcomer for whom market best guide
runners.spotlight: King Of Change filly is first foal of an unraced three-parts sister to US 1m1f turf Grade 1 winner Hunt; newcomer for whom market best guide.

runners.name: Lynns Dash
runners.comment: Never involved when beaten 8l in Dundalk maiden in March; best watched on turf debut
runners.spotlight: Never involved when beaten roughly 8l in Dundalk maiden in March; likely best watched on turf debut.

runners.name: Restful
runners.comment: Some 2yo promise but disappointing thus far this term
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability in late-season Thurles 2yo maiden but two runs this term in headgear have been disappointing, fading tamely each time; tongue-tie worn latest now discarded; hard to be confident in and current rating probably flatters her.

runners.name: Self Charging
runners.comment: Never sighted when a 50-1 shot on Roscommon debut on Monday (1m2f); can only be watched
runners.spotlight: Make Believe filly was never sighted when a 50-1 shot on Roscommon debut on Monday (1m2f); can only be watched.

runners.name: Sennas Girl
runners.comment: Flew home for second at Gowran last month; big player if staying 1m
runners.spotlight: Debut promise behind two high-class 2yo fillies in Curragh maiden last summer probably flattered her and she came up short when highly tried afterwards; good run back to maiden company on last month's Gowran return, coming home best of all for second (Hopes Are High third and Dahoma fourth) over 7f (soft); shapes as though she'll stay 1m and leading player if she does.

6:13.race_name: BoyleSports Daily Money Back Meetings Apprentice Handicap
6:13.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered)

runners.name: Pandion Power
runners.comment: Bellewstown third to Rockbury Lad puts him in the mix
runners.spotlight: Hit form with two wins last October on soft/heavy; encouraging run on much quicker ground at Bellewstown last month when third to Rockbury Lad under positive ride; 7lb better off with rider's claims taken into account so big chance.

quotes.race: Racing Club Membership Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Pandion Power has a big engine and a big stride, and Rory rides him out very day. He's not an easy ride but he's reaping the benefits from him now - Johnny Murtagh, trainer

runners.name: Rockbury Lad
runners.owner: P E Ryan & J G Shanahan
runners.comment: Bellewstown winner up 5lb but big player
runners.spotlight: Good AW campaign over the winter transferred to turf at Bellewstown last month, coming off pace then idling a little but holding on; had Pandion Power back in third (beaten 2.5l); 5lb higher but big player.

quotes.race: William Hill Proper Betting Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Rockbury Lad is a very frustrating horse. He's had a couple of fractures and he needs to be smuggled into races. We'll see what the handicapper does - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer.

runners.name: Solomon Coop
runners.comment: AW winner for whom return to 1m to suit on first turf start in 11 months, poorly drawn
runners.spotlight: Off the mark on yard debut for Eamonn O'Connell in 1m Dundalk maiden in February, joined current yard after finishing third (behind Notforalongtime) in claimer there in March over inadequate 7f; return to 1m to suit on first turf start in 11 months but shocker of a draw.

runners.name: Rampage
runners.owner: Mrs P Mccourt/Whytes Stamullen Syndicate/S Sweeney
runners.comment: Good C&D run in March but tough task from this wide draw
runners.spotlight: Won twice on turf over 1m1f in 2023 (including here) and landed AW handicap last year; pick of four runs this year when only beaten 2.5l from a wide draw over C&D in March; draw again hasn't been kind here though.

quotes.race: James P. Cunningham Electrical Handicap
quotes.quote: The stiffer track suited Rampage today. We were a bit worried about the ground but he showed us he is well able for it. We took a while to get to know him but he seems to be in a good vein of form. He was due his head in front again. It opened up well for me, he got the splits at the right time and when he gets there he just does enough - James Ryan, jockey.

runners.name: Heliogabalus
runners.comment: Just fair comeback run for current yard last month; badly drawn and others preferred
runners.spotlight: Best effort a 1l third of 13 in a 1m Dundalk maiden in October 2023; poor form last year and just fair comeback run for current yard last month; badly drawn and others preferred.

stable_tour.quote: He's still a maiden and has done well over the winter. He progressed well to finish a good third at Dundalk and hopefully can win his maiden and go forward. 24-04-24

runners.name: James Henry
runners.comment: Testing ground wouldn't have suited latest; ground in his favour here so don't rule out
runners.spotlight: Better AW performer, albeit at shorter trips; seemed to be ridden to get today's trip in testing conditions at Limerick last time; ground more in his favour here so don't rule out.

quotes.race: Gateway Hotel Dundalk Race & Stay Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: James Henry loves travelling and doesn't do an awful lot when he gets there but I liked the way when I crept into it that he did put his head down. Leanne [Breen, trainer] was very happy with him and said he had improved from the last day. He has a lot of ability and he's still well in I think if he keeps going the right way - Scott McCullagh, jockey, speaking to RTV.

runners.name: Auburn Avenue
runners.comment: Good Curragh run over inadequate 7f; place claims if overcoming wide draw
runners.spotlight: Maiden has been tried over various trips and on all types of ground; stays 1m1f and ran well over 7f in big field at the Curragh latest in today's headgear combination; place claims if overcoming wide draw.

runners.name: Finsceal Annie
runners.comment: Curragh second encouraging; return to 1m to suit and one to consider despite high draw
runners.spotlight: Good AW form over the winter and transferred that to turf at the Curragh early this month, staying on well to chase home a clear winner over 7f, having been short of room; return to 1m to suit and one to consider despite high draw.

quotes.race: Donovan Transport Handicap
quotes.quote: We bought Finsceal Annie out-of-training at Goffs and there were a few issues afterwards but the owners were patient and she had a lovely run at Killarney the last day. To build on that today was great. My horses seem to be coming good now. - Ciaran Murphy, trainer

runners.name: Notforalongtime
runners.comment: Left with plenty to do over 7f at the Curragh latest, return to 1m sure to suit
runners.spotlight: Gained eighth AW win in a Dundalk claimer in March and good turf run when second at Cork  (1m, soft) last month; left with plenty to do over 7f at the Curragh latest, return to 1m sure to suit and still on a fair mark.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Notforalongtime had lost his way when I got him and he had a few problems so we were able to sweeten him up. The cheekpieces made a big difference. We'll come up for the winter with him - Laura Hourigan, trainer.

quotes.race: Free Tips Daily On attheraces.com Handicap
quotes.quote: I was chuffed with that, it was a nice enough race and Notforalongtime is a gutsy little horse - Adam Kirby, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: We've gelded him and he's had a wind operation, which can hopefully help him take another step forward. I think he'll continue to progress over a mile and build on his head-bobbing win at Doncaster last summer. 22-04-21

runners.name: Summer Snow
runners.comment: Her three wins have come at 7f, hasn't convinced over further of late; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Her three wins have come at 7f, hasn't convinced over further of late; others preferred.

runners.name: Alto Sax
runners.comment: Two runs this term on unsuitably soft ground so potential improver back on a sound surface
runners.spotlight: Won back-to-back claimers early last season for Ger Lyons; two runs this term for new yard on unsuitably soft ground so potential improver back on a sound surface.

runners.name: Brains
runners.comment: Back to form over C&D in March to win off 60; should make a bold bid from good draw
runners.spotlight: Heavily raced eleven time AW winner was gaining his third turf success when landing C&D win in March off 4lb lower, despite racing keenly; should make a bold bid from good draw.

quotes.race: www.roscommonracecourse.ie Handicap
quotes.quote: I got a lovely easy lead which I didn't think I would, there was plenty of pace on paper. I got a nice breather into Brains around the bend and he stayed at it well. The slower ground over this shorter trip definitely helped today - Adam Caffrey, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: El Bello
runners.comment: Slow-starter worth another try at 1m; wide draw may not be that much a negative
runners.spotlight: Habitual slow-starter whose five wins have all been at 7f; once again did himself no favours at the start on latest when strong-finishing third (Finsceal Annie second) at the Curragh early this month; well worth another try at 1m and wide draw may not be as much a negative as for others.

quotes.race: Bet On The Best Night Out At Dundalk Stadium Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: El Bello was tough all the way to the line. Two horses came alongside him and he battled well. You'd like to think he could get an extra furlong - Dan King, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: A lightly raced gelding, things are really starting to click with him now. He won back-to-back races at Wolverhampton and Newcastle, both over 7f. He went up a fair bit to 80 from an opening mark of 71 - the handicapper actually hiked him 8lb for his last win at Gosforth Park. He relished the stiff 7f there and although he won at Wolverhampton I was not sure the track suited him, and my fears were proved correct last week when he was never happy and although he ran on well at the end it is not his course. We will keep him to stiffer venues in the future and he can win again. 25-05-22

runners.name: Glengarriff
runners.comment: Best watched on handicap debut off what looks a high enough mark
runners.spotlight: Some ability in 2003 season for Willie Browne; back from the best part of two years off when dropping out soon after halfway in Limerick maiden last month; best watched on handicap debut off what looks a high enough mark.

runners.name: Maharajjah
runners.comment: Glimpses of form on AW; C&D comeback run in March leaves him with a bit to find
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutant; promise in a couple of maidens at 7f-1m at Dundalk but struggled on all four turf starts on a variety of ground, never counting on C&D debut for new yard in March.

runners.name: My Vonnie

prev_owners.owner: Exors of the Late Mrs S M Rice

runners.comment: Not ruled out in her first handicap but high enough mark
runners.spotlight: Respectable form in three maiden outings; arguably best effort was when sixth over 1m at Gowran on her second attempt; not ruled out in her first handicap but high enough mark.

runners.name: Pascalia
runners.comment: Better AW form; 9lb higher than last turf run in September on first start for Noel Meade
runners.spotlight: Both wins for Johnny Murtagh yard on AW, including claimer last October; some decent turf efforts last year but now 9lb higher than last turf run in September on first start for Noel Meade.

runners.name: Pleasant Dawn
runners.comment: Couple of decent maidens last season; probably has a bit to prove off this opening mark
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 3yo ran okay in a couple of decent maidens last season on decent ground; probably has a bit to prove off this opening mark on seasonal debut.

runners.name: Amavasya
runners.comment: Dundalk handicap debut last month was modest enough; seemingly has it to do here
runners.spotlight: Dundalk handicap debut last month was modest enough under forcing tactics; seemingly has it to do here.

runners.name: Paddydaddy
runners.comment: Encouraging handicap debut and more likely now upped in trip
runners.spotlight: Only minor promise in maidens but handicap debut run at Naas last month hinted at more to come now upped in trip, staying on strongly after a slow start over 6f; potential improver.

runners.name: Sub Rosa
runners.comment: Not much of note so far for this yard, including over C&D on penultimate; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; showed ability in a couple of maidens in 2023 for Roger Varian; not much of note so far for this yard though, including over C&D on penultimate.

runners.name: La Tulipe Noire

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Magette Meagher & Thomas P Meagher

runners.comment: Regressive on flat and modest over jumps of late; cheekpieces on; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; 2yo maiden winner but became regressive and hasn't really taken to hurdles, pulled up on recent chase debut; cheekpieces tried.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (Fillies) Maiden
quotes.quote: La Tulipe Noire jumped okay, there wasn't much pace on and I was able to dictate. The blinkers helped her. She was tough and always doing enough, Declan McDonogh, rider.

runners.name: Shining Aitch

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Caroline Jordan & Mrs Pauline McCourt & Anthony Davitt

runners.comment: Recent Dundalk form none too encouraging; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; wins have been at up to 1m2f, most on AW; recent Dundalk form none too encouraging.

6:48.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Handicap
6:48.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered)

runners.name: Pepper Noir
runners.comment: AW winner, 0-6 on turf, improved effort latest, place chance off 1lb lower from plum draw
runners.spotlight: Three-time AW winner is 0-6 on turf; showed a bit more on second start for this stable at Sligo earlier this month when beaten just 2.25l and is 1lb lower now; place chance from plum draw.

quotes.race: Floodlit Fridays At Dundalk Handicap
quotes.quote: Pepper Noir enjoyed going the trip, she travelled better and actually picked up well. I think we will be sticking to this trip and hopefully there is more to come - Gary Carroll, rider.

runners.name: Secret World

prev_owners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Al Maktoum

runners.comment: AW winner, up 4lb for good run on stable debut behind Hurricane Helen, claims
runners.spotlight: AW winner yet to score on turf but has gone close on multiple occasions; carried head high when beaten 1.75l by Hurricane Helen latest on stable debut at Navan (1m2f, good) after 171 days off; up 4lb for that but should strip fitter and could turn that form around with cheekpieces applied; claims.

runners.name: Hurricane Helen
runners.comment: Beat Secret World at Navan, up 9lb and beaten off revised mark at Cork, career best needed
runners.spotlight: Beat Secret World at Navan (1m2f, good) on penultimate off 63 under this rider; hiked up 9lb for that and beaten 2.75l at Cork over 1m off revised mark ten days ago; the step back up to 1m2f will suit but she'll need a career best to defy her current mark.

quotes.race: Free Tips Daily On attheraces.com Classified Stakes
quotes.quote: Hurricane Helen did it nicely. I think there's still a bit of improvement there. I loved the way she travelled into the race but inside the final furlong she was still a bit green and having a good look at everything. I'd be hopeful there's more to come - Ross Coakley, jockey.

runners.name: Touch The Sound
runners.comment: AW winner, ran well in 1m maiden here last August, step up in trip a query, best watched
runners.spotlight: AW winner over 7f in November is 0-4 on turf; best effort on grass a 0.5l second of 11 in a maiden here over 1m in a maiden last August; well beaten at the Curragh latest (7f, good); mixed messages in pedigree regarding this step up in trip; watch.

runners.name: Thatwilldoso
runners.comment: Won on seasonal bow at Gowran, beaten off revised mark latest, good ground a query
runners.spotlight: Off the mark on seasonal reappearance early last month at Gowran (9.5f, yielding) off 60; hiked up 11lb and beaten 25l at Navan (1m2f, soft) three weeks later; a bit to prove after that and good ground a question; Keane booked but others appeal more.

runners.name: Tiscommonknowledge
runners.comment: Won at the Curragh in 2023, only seen twice last year, entitled to need this, check market
runners.spotlight: Gained first win on final start of 2023 at the Curragh (1m, heavy) off 63; only seen twice last year and failed to fire at Galway and the Curragh at around 1m4f; entitled to need this run and is best watched unless the market speaks.

quotes.race: Tote.ie Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Tiscommonknowledge is a tough little filly and stepping up to a mile has suited her. We'll have a good bit of fun with her next year - Padraig Roche, trainer.

runners.name: Yes Oui Si
runners.comment: Maiden ran well behind two of these latest, better off at weights now, Foley up, chance
runners.spotlight: Eight race maiden ran a pleasing race in fourth behind Hurricane Helen and Secret World at Navan on her seasonal return; weighted to get much closer to those rivals now, should come on for the run and Shane Foley takes over in the plate; nicely drawn; go well.

runners.name: Morning Approach
runners.comment: No turf win since 2022, won on AW in December, balance of turf form is off-putting
runners.spotlight: 1-35 on turf, the win coming here over 1m in 2022; won at that trip again on the AW in December; has run well at this trip before but balance of turf form is off-putting; others preferred.

quotes.race: Gateway Hotel Dundalk Race & Stay Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought Morning Approach ran a lovely race here the last day over 1m2f where things didn't work out as they went no pace up front and they all quickened up the straight and it didn't really suit her. They went a nice pace here and she had a target which helped her. She likes good ground and a level track - Willie McCreery, trainer, talking to RTV.

quotes.race: Racing With Pride Handicap
quotes.quote: Morning Approach is a good little filly. She ran well in handicaps last year but she is just stronger this year. She is a big filly and needs a big galloping track - Willie McCreery, trainer

runners.name: Rain
runners.comment: No win since October 2022, best form is on easy ground, others make more appeal
runners.spotlight: October 2022 winner for Andre Fabre has failed to win since; was behind a few of these when weakening late on at Navan early last month on his first start for this stable; best form is on easy ground; others appeal more.

runners.name: Baltray Lady
runners.comment: Up 8lb for 1m h'cap debut win in October, blinkers off, up in trip, watch unless backed
runners.spotlight: One of three for yard; won on handicap debut at Bellewstown (1m, yielding) in first-time blinkers last October; raised 8lb for that and the blinkers are left off for her seasonal reappearance; probably best watched upped in trip unless the money comes.

runners.name: Paulines Dream
runners.comment: Well-beaten first start for this yard, tongue tie now reached for, best watched for now
runners.spotlight: Long odds and didn't show a whole lot in four starts for Henry De Bromhead; similar story in first start for this yard at Gowran (9.5f, soft); down another 1lb and tongue tie reached for; can only be watched for now.

runners.name: Fortuna Vera
runners.comment: 7f AW winner, stayed on over that distance on turf debut, bred for this trip, interesting
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; Dundalk 2yo maiden winner over 7f in November; good effort on turf debut at the Curragh (7f, good) latest after 98 days off; ran on well to finish a 5.25l fourth of 15 after missing the break and is bred for this trip; dropped 1lb; interesting.

runners.name: Kashel Spring
runners.comment: H'cap debutante, bred to appreciate this trip, drawn wide but could improve, check market
runners.spotlight: Third runner for yard; handicap debutante showed a glimmer of promise in two of her three maidens; this trip should suit on pedigree; wide draw not ideal but could improve and worth a market check.

runners.name: Love Sonnet
runners.comment: Improved to win h'cap debut, effectively 13lb higher now, Joyce claims 5lb, can't discount
runners.spotlight: Didn't show much in maidens but improved dramatically to win on handicap debut at Killarney three days ago; carries a 7lb penalty and 6lb wrong so effectively 13lb higher now but Wesley Joyce's 5lb claim will help and the slight drop in trip should be fine; not discounted.

runners.name: Idomything
runners.breeder: Mrs James Wigan & London TB Services Ltd
runners.comment: Huge odds and well beaten in maidens at 6f-8f, 13lb wrong for h'cap bow, hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Huge odds and well beaten in maidens at 6f-8f on varying ground; 13lb wrong and hard to make a case for on first start in handicap company.

7:58.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered)

runners.name: Gallo Dell Cielo
runners.comment: AW winner, sole turf win came on testing ground, poor on soft latest, others preferred
runners.spotlight: AW winner is 1-7 on turf, the win coming on testing ground last October at Gowran; below par at that venue latest and remains 3lb above his win; may need it softer; others preferred.

runners.name: Porsche Lad
runners.comment: Improved last twice on AW, has joined Charles Byrnes, obvious chance if effective on turf
runners.spotlight: Improved for switch to AW handicaps for Sean Davis, winning off 50 (10.5f) then second off 58 (1m4f) at Dundalk in first-time cheekpieces (discarded); has since joined Charles Byrnes; obvious chance if as effective on turf (pedigree suggests he will be).

runners.name: Fascinating Shadow

prev_owners.owner: Townley Hall Bloodstock And D J Cox

runners.comment: No turf win since 2021, promise on seasonal return, not discounted, due to run on Thursday
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose; 1-11 on turf but that win came in 2021; shaped well on seasonal return at Cork (1m4f, soft) last month and quicker ground is fine; not discounted; declared to run at Clonmel on Thursday.

quotes.race: Sign Up To Our Newsletter Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I think Fascinating Shadow is a nice horse. He does everything right for me at home. We went to Dundalk with him, my first runner there in eight years, but I went up with him, and ever since he scored there the plan was to come here. He probably want nearly faster ground than that, but he'll be a nice novice horse for the year - Shark Hanlon, trainer.

runners.name: Secret Rock
runners.comment: 1-13 on turf, last won off 5lb lower in 2023, out of form last season, watch after absence
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose; 1-13 on turf on the Flat; last won on grass at Roscommon (1m4f, yld-sft) in 2023 off 5lb lower; out of form in four Flat starts last season; Keane up but probably best watched on return from a 207-day absence.

quotes.race: Visit Wexford Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Secret Rock is still putting all the pieces of the puzzle together but hopefully there will be improvement off that. I think that will sharpen him up a lot - Peter Carberry, jockey, speaking to RacingTV.

runners.name: Jawhary
runners.comment: No win since 2021, ran well at Dundalk in January, lacks a run, others appeal more
runners.spotlight: 1-15 on turf but without a win since 2021; ran well in a 1m4f Dundalk handicap off 56 in January but well beaten in a 10.5f claimer there when last seen 109 days ago; others appeal more.

runners.name: Tartaraghan
runners.comment: 0-18 on turf, second off this mark at Navan in Oct', upped in trip on return, check market
runners.spotlight: One of three for yard; maiden is 0-18 on turf but has run well in defeat in claimers and handicaps; beaten 2.5l off this mark when second of 15 at Navan (1m2f, gd-yld) in October; steps up to 1m4f for the first time and worth a market check on return.

runners.name: Crypto Crash
runners.comment: 4lb lower than when beaten 2.25l at Tipperary in 2024, ground too soft latest, interesting
runners.spotlight: 0-6 on turf; best effort yet in second handicap start at Tipperary (12.5f, gd-fm) on final run of 2024, beaten 2.25l off 57 despite hanging left and 4lb lower now; heavy defeat on seasonal return at Cork but ground was soft; could do better back on a sounder surface; interesting.

runners.name: Picpoul

prev_owners.owner: Exors of the Late Mrs S M Rice

runners.comment: Three-time AW winner, turf form poor, heavy defeat latest, down 2lb but opposable
runners.spotlight: Three-time AW winner is 0-6 on turf and yet to trouble the judge; rated 9lb lower on grass but suffered heavy defeat on latest turf start at Navan last month; down 2lb for that but opposable.

quotes.race: Happy Christmas From All At Dundalk Stadium Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: It's great to get Picpoul back on track, hopefully she'll now go on from this, next week there is another one for her. During the summer she had physio for a back problem but we have her back and I'm delighted with that. We wanted to try hurdling but she won't jump a pole! - Michael Rice, trainer, talking to Racing TV

quotes.race: DundalkStadium.com Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Picpoul is the first Flat horse that I've trained so I might be looking at getting a few more in! She's a decent filly. We might step her up in trip. There is a two mile race here on Friday week so we'll have a look at that - Michael Rice, trainer.

runners.name: Chopsticks
runners.comment: Narrow defeats off this mark last twice at Dundalk, has course form, go well on stable bow
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; twelve race maiden running consistently well in defeat on the AW; narrow defeats at Dundalk the last twice over 10.5f off this mark; has form at 1m4f; best run on turf came here over 1m1f (good) off 55; Foley keeps the faith, he's nicely drawn and he could go well on first start for John McConnell.

runners.name: Highland King
runners.comment: Has run well here before off higher marks, positive signs on AW latest, not discounted
runners.spotlight: Third runner for yard; AW winner is 0-13 on turf; best efforts on grass came at this track over 1m2f and 1m1f in 2022 when trained by Johnny Murtagh; well-treated on those two runs and showed a bit more on latest at Dundalk; well-drawn and not discounted.

quotes.race: CT1 Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Highland King has turned the corner now and hopefully he can go on and win another one. He has form on the turf and would probably jump a hurdle - John McConnell, trainer

runners.name: Tatum
runners.comment: 0-10 on turf, good run over this trip at Cork, ground fine, blinkers on, thereabouts
runners.spotlight: 0-10 on turf but plenty of placed efforts to her name; shaped with promise on first try at this trip at Cork (soft) last month when a 2l third of 10; ran well on good ground on handicap debut last year; blinkers go on; should be thereabouts.

runners.name: Pare Of Brown Eyes
runners.comment: Cheekpieces go on for handicap debut, poor form in maidens, probably best watched
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutante; beaten a combined distance of 58l in a trio of maidens at 1m-11.5f on good ground and on the AW; could improve but probably best watched in first-time cheekpieces.

runners.name: Patrick Joseph
runners.comment: Dual-purpose veteran, 0-26 on turf, beaten 33l when last seen, hard to make a case for
runners.spotlight: Long standing dual-purpose maiden; best Flat form on AW; veteran is 0-26 on turf on the Flat; beaten 33l when last seen over 16.5f at Clonmel; lacks a recent run and hard to fancy.

runners.name: Creative Dancer
runners.comment: 0-6, beaten 4.5l off 7lb higher at Gowran last year, yard in form, could outrun odds
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose maiden; 0-6 on turf on the Flat; best effort a 4.5l ninth of 15 at Gowran (1m, good) last June off 47 and 7lb lower now; beaten 25l over hurdles on latest after break but may have needed that; yard is in good form; drawn wide but might outrun odds.

runners.name: Zentopia
runners.comment: 0-7 on turf, better effort latest when blowing the start but others look more likely
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose maiden; 0-7 on turf; blew the start at Bellewstown on latest when a 6l fourth of 7; that was an improvement on previous efforts but others hold more pressing claims.

8:30.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered)

runners.name: Reaching High
runners.owner: Hm The King & Hm The Queen
runners.comment: Won off 81 on the AW for former yard, has form on quick ground, respected on stable bow
runners.spotlight: Wide margin AW winner at Wolverhampton (1m6f) off 81 for Michael Stoute last August and 11lb higher now; best turf effort a 0.5l second of 6 at Windsor (11.5f, gd-fm); lacks a run but respected on debut for Willie Mullins.

quotes.race: Leopardstown Lady Riders Handicap
quotes.quote: The race set up perfectly for Not Just Any Eagle. I bounced out to make it and I felt we were going quick enough down the back and let them go. He picked up well and was good and game the whole way up the straight. He's been a great servant to me and Pat. That's his fourth win in the past year - Robyn Donaghue-Leahy,  jockey

runners.name: Oreilly
runners.breeder: Sarl Baileys Haras Des Trois Chapelles
runners.comment: Last won in 2021, minor promise second start for this yard after long layoff, needs more
runners.spotlight: Sole win came at this track over 1m (good) but that was back in 2021 for Jessica Harrington; minor promise when finishing in midfield on second start for this yard after mammoth layoff at Tipperary; needs more.

quotes.race: Leopardstown Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: O'Reilly was in at Navan but we took him out because of the ground, he loved that ground today. We'll step him up to 1m2f and maybe find a Listed race for him. In a stronger race he will jump and travel that bit better - Kate Harrington, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He did it well at Leopardstown first time and I think he's crying out to go up to 1m2f. He could be good and I think he'll keep improving through the season. 21-04-21

runners.name: Genoah
runners.comment: Two-time AW winner, 0-3 on turf, beaten off this mark at Dundalk latest, stamina to prove
runners.spotlight: Two-time AW winner is 0-3 on turf; ran okay when fifth in a Punchestown maiden (1m1f) on good ground last September; beaten favourite off this mark when last seen at Dundalk in March; stamina to prove and others appeal more.

runners.name: Solomon
runners.comment: Won off 3lb lower for William Haggas, badly out of form for current yard, hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: AW winner is 1-6 on turf; that win came off 85 at Haydock (1m2f, good) for William Haggas last August; has failed to beat a rival in three runs for current yard; cheekpieces worn last time discarded; hard to fancy on recent exploits.

runners.name: Walhaan
runners.breeder: B Kennedy & Mrs Ann Marie Kennedy
runners.comment: Course winner on Flat and over timber, 9lb above last turf win, well beaten here latest
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; dual-purpose course winner on the Flat and over hurdles; has won seven races including three on turf on the Flat; remains 9lb above last turf win and his best form on the Flat is over shorter; well beaten here five days ago; others appeal more.

quotes.race: Edmondstown Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Walhaan got a no-nonsense ride, Eoin was very good on him. We felt he had improved since Navan and had this race pinpointed. The flat track and nice ground suited him well. He's really starting to get the hang of hurdling now - Ciaran Murphy, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won twice in France for Jean-Claude Rouget but has been winless since and has only just joined us after a season with Ian Williams, for whom he finished second twice at Ascot. They were good runs and fingers crossed we can do something with him this year off his mark of 90. From what he has shown me at home he could win off his mark. He may start off this week at Newcastle on Friday and I think as the season progresses he can win a race or two. 28-04-21

runners.name: Burren Song
runners.comment: C&D winner, went close for this rider in October off 86, 3lb lower now, blinkers, chance
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; three-time winner on turf on the Flat; last win came over C&D in May 2023 off 84; went close under this rider off 86 at the Curragh in October; 3lb lower now and fit from hurdling; interesting in first-time blinkers.

quotes.race: Women's Irish Network For Racing Lady Riders Handicap
quotes.quote: Burren Song likes to be let stride along like that, we were probably riding him wrong by holding him up. Since we've let him use his stride he seems to be a bit better. I'd like to put him over two miles, I think he'll be better at two miles, and he might go to the GPT at Galway - Andy Slattery, trainer

runners.name: Rock Of Ireland
runners.comment: Sound efforts first two h'caps for this yard, up 2lb for latest second, competitive again
runners.spotlight: Went close in a 1m2f Navan maiden for Barry Fitzgerald last season; excellent runs in defeat in first two handicaps for current yard at Cork (10.5f, soft) and Tipperary (12.5f, yielding); nudged up 2lb for that last run but should be competitive again.

runners.name: Bear Profit
runners.comment: Course winner, good effort last Flat start, pulled up over timber latest, may bounce back
runners.spotlight: Two-time AW winner is 2-20 on turf; good effort last start on the Flat when a 2.5l second of 18 at the Curragh (1m4f, soft) in March off 78; won here on good over 1m1f last June off 64; pulled up on very testing ground in a maiden hurdle latest; could bounce back returned to the level.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Lengthen The Odds Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Bear Profit just arrived there. Things didn't go right at Listowel when he raced too keen. He's not a bad horse and got a lovely ride - Ger O'Leary, trainer.

runners.name: Dubai Leader

prev_owners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Al Maktoum

runners.comment: Three time winner in Britain, ran well over 1m7f here last year, out of form since
runners.spotlight: Won three for the Johnstons in Britain, two on quick turf at 1m2f-1m4f; best run for this yard here over 1m7f (good) for this rider last July; poor since and never in contention on seasonal reappearance at Cork (1m, good); this trip more suitable and 3lb below last win but others look more likely.

runners.name: Not Just Any Eagle
runners.comment: 3-19 on turf, remains 7lb above last turf win, no impact last twice, may be on tough mark
runners.spotlight: AW winner is 3-19 on turf; two of those turf wins came under this rider last season at Cork (1m2f, good) off 63 and Tipperary (12.5f, gd-fm) off 71; remains 7lb above last success and no impact in last three handicaps; may need more respite from the handicapper.

quotes.race: Leopardstown Lady Riders Handicap
quotes.quote: The race set up perfectly for Not Just Any Eagle. I bounced out to make it and I felt we were going quick enough down the back and let them go. He picked up well and was good and game the whole way up the straight. He's been a great servant to me and Pat. That's his fourth win in the past year - Robyn Donaghue-Leahy,  jockey

runners.name: Raydamann
runners.breeder: H H The Aga Khan's Studs
runners.comment: Hurdle winner, 0-7 on the Flat, good effort in a 1m1f maiden here last year, could go well
runners.spotlight: Hurdles winner is 0-7 on the Flat with four of those runs coming on turf; went close in a 1m1f maiden here on good ground last summer for Johnny Murtagh and has been in good form over timber for current yard; nicely drawn, will like the ground and could go well.

runners.name: Beyond Your Dreams
runners.comment: Dual-purpose, 1-6 on level, out of form last twice over timber, return to Flat may revive
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose filly is 1-6 on the Flat, the win coming off 58 at Listowel (1m4f, good); narrowly denied off 10lb higher at Killarney (1m3f, heavy) in follow up bid and raised another 5lb; out of form in last two runs over hurdles but return to this sphere could spark a revival.

quotes.race: Kevin's Bar, Listowel/Exchange Inn, Ballybunion Handicap
quotes.quote: Beyond Your Dreams is a huge big unit and just coming into her frame. Hopefully she can step forward again and she could have a good back end - Declan McDonogh, jockey.

runners.name: Pralognan
runners.comment: No win since 2021, beaten 14l off 1lb higher here latest, others hold more pressing claims
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose; 1-11 on turf on the Flat but that sole win came in 2021; beaten 14l over 1m2f (good) here last month; just 1lb lower now and best recent form is on the AW; others hold more pressing claims.

runners.name: Hibernia Oppositus
runners.comment: Promise in maidens in 2022, no impact sole run for this yard last year, watch on h'cap bow
runners.spotlight: Promise in all four maiden runs in 2022 for Joseph O'Brien at 1m-1m4f at Dundalk and at the Curragh; off 657 days and ran poorly on sole start for current yard at Galway last August; now returns from another absence and can only be watched on handicap debut.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well in maidens on the Flat for Joseph O'Brien and we bought him [for 52,000gns] at Newmarket last month to go juvenile hurdling. We've given him a break but he'll start back this week. He's a big, raw horse - a lovely dual-purpose type for the future. 21-11-22

This son of Australia is a very big horse who was with Joseph O'Brien last year. He ran four times for him with form figures of 2432. Last time at the Curragh, over 1m4f, he was second of 15 and looked a winner waiting to happen. We purposely gave him a long break, but he's back in work now and will be campaigned as a dual-purpose horse with the intention of winning his maiden and then going over hurdles. He has the physique of a hurdler rather than preferring the Flat, but has run so well on the level that he should do well in both spheres. He was very immature last year but the break has done him good and we'll kick on this summer in 1m4f maidens before possibly stepping up in trip. 06-04-23

runners.name: Autocrat
runners.comment: Won off 73 on AW in January, best turf effort off this mark latest four days ago, claims
runners.spotlight: Turf maiden won off 73 at Dundalk in January; fine effort off this mark on latest at Roscommon (1m4f, good) four days ago when arguably a shade unlucky; ran well in a maiden here back in 2022; claims once this run doesn't come too soon.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Apprentice Claiming Race
quotes.quote: Autocrat ran well up here last week. He got into a good rhythm and when I asked him to pick up he did it nicely. He likes it up here and loves the surface - Dan King, rider.

4:50.race_name: Watch Every Race Live On Racing TV Maiden Hurdle
4:50.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to yielding in places; watered)

runners.name: Amber Point

prev_owners.owner: Tara Dwan & Mrs Michael Cunningham & Mrs Paul Shanahan

runners.comment: Well beaten on all four starts but from a powerhouse yard so can't be ruled out
runners.spotlight: Has been well beaten on all four starts; finished 35l ninth of nine last time out; from a powerhouse yard so cannot be confidently ruled out.

runners.name: Charlies Gift
runners.comment: Outran his odds of 250-1 to finish in mid-division on his last start, could play a hand
runners.spotlight: Outran his odds of 250-1 to finish in mid-division on his last start; stayed on past tired horses on that occasion; he could play a hand in this weak race.

runners.name: Go To Town
runners.comment: Bumper debut form is reasonable in the context of this race, the jockey booking is a plus
runners.spotlight: Finished 24l fifth on his bumper debut and ran to a similar enough level next time out; that is reasonable form in the context of this race; Danny Gilligan now takes the ride which could be a clue to his chance.

runners.name: Kome Dans Un Reve
runners.breeder: S C E A, Haras Du Hoguenet,E A R L Ecurie Prevost Baratte,M
runners.comment: Made little impression on first two starts, could be the type to improve with experience
runners.spotlight: Sister to 2m-2m1f hurdle/chase winner; made little impression on first two starts; beaten by 25l when sent off at 100-1 last time; could be the type to improve with experience.

runners.name: Sionainn
runners.comment: Well beaten when last seen in February, top conditional aboard
runners.spotlight: Has first start for new trainer after failing to fire for Gavin Cromwell; 170,000 euros purchase as a 3yo; well beaten when last seen in February; top conditional aboard.

runners.name: Skyscraper
runners.breeder: S A R L European Bloodstock Management & O Labomme
runners.comment: Beaten comprehensively on two starts but could have more to offer at this level
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to four winners; beaten comprehensively on two starts with the most recent one happening in March; could have more to offer at this level.

runners.name: Sticktotheplan
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Lieu Des Champs
runners.comment: Finished eighth in a bumper on most recent start, that type of form could be good enough
runners.spotlight: Sent off favourite on first two starts; running ok in his point before falling; disappointed on subsequent start when sent off 11-10 favourite; finished eighth in a bumper on most recent start 14 days ago; that type of form may be good enough here.

runners.name: The Burrow
runners.comment: Previously won a point by 10l but has been disappointing since running under rules
runners.spotlight: Won a point-to-point by 10l on his third attempt; has been disappointing since running under rules and was most recently beaten by 44l when sent off at 200-1 in a beginners' chase (3m, gd-yld); returns to hurdles here and could possibly play a role.

runners.name: Warriors Wood
runners.comment: Useful pedigree but soundly beaten on last start, jockey booking is a positive
runners.spotlight: Has a useful pedigree but hasn't converted that to the track as of yet; soundly beaten into last back in October; there could still be enough improvement in him to be a contender in this race; jockey booking is a positive.

runners.name: Hey Babbs
runners.comment: Best effort came last time out but more improvement required
runners.spotlight: Underwhelming on three starts so far; best effort came last time out when finishing ninth of 22 in a Fairyhouse maiden hurdle (2m, sft-hvy); more improvement required.

runners.name: Ladies Well
runners.comment: Needs to have improved from run six days ago to be involved in this
runners.spotlight: Finished tenth of 16 in a Cork mares' maiden hurdle six days ago; that run was coming from a 222-day break; needs to have improved for the run to be involved.

runners.name: Saga Des Aigles
runners.comment: Finished fifth of eight on stable debut last time out, more improvement needed.
runners.spotlight: Her seven starts under rules make her one of the most experienced of the contenders; she finished a 25l fifth of eight on her debut for her current stable last time out at Tramore; prior to that she was running on the Flat to little effect; more improvement needed.

5:25.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to yielding in places; watered)

runners.name: Ciao Adios
runners.comment: Won at Cork (2m) two starts ago but wasn't as good over 2m2f at Downpatrick off this mark
runners.spotlight: Dual Flat winner won a Cork handicap hurdle (2m) two starts ago but wasn't as good over 2m2f at Downpatrick off this mark; this shorter trip will probably suit better.

quotes.race: Racing Home For Easter Festival April 19th - 21st Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I just tried to settle Ciao Adios a bit and get her into a rhythm and jumping. I wasn't worried where I was as that's the way she has to be ridden. If she gets up there too early she'll do too much early on but she stayed on really well. That's her first win over hurdles and she loves that type of ground - Eoin Kelly, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Wajaaha
runners.comment: Poor on soft the last twice; would have a squeak if back to some of his form of last year
runners.spotlight: Three hurdle wins including over 2m2f at this track in 2020; poor on soft the last twice but would have a squeak if getting back to some of his form of last year.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Selling Hurdle
quotes.quote: I'd have been disappointed to lose Wajaaha and delighted we were able to keep him. He's a fun horse, despite having a few issues with his back. He's got lots of ability and carried a nice rating on the Flat. Charles Byrnes, trainer

quotes.race: KilbegganRaces.com Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: They went real hard up front on that ground. There was no way they were going to get home. It's holding ground. It's nice to sit on these type of horses. Wajaaha jumped and travelled like the best horse - Kevin Brouder, rider

quotes.race: Fedamore Handicap
quotes.quote: He had a great draw today compared to a bad draw the last day at Roscommon. There might be something for him at Galway. The ground was perfect for him today, he handles a slight dig in it - Charles Byrnes, trainer of Wajaaha

quotes.race: Kids Go Racing Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Wujaaha had a nice run at Naas and he has come forward a good bit. He's a bit temperamental but when he gets things his own way he looks good. He'll tip away in handicap hurdles - Charles Byrnes, trainer

runners.name: Colvin
runners.comment: Doesn't look particularly well treated but still considered on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: The best of three maiden hurdle runs came at Down Royal last time over nearly 2m2f; doesn't look particularly well treated but still considered on handicap debut.

runners.name: Prove Yourself
runners.comment: Bounced back from a poor run to win a Tramore maiden hurdle; respected on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Posted fine runs in four bumpers without winning; was poor on debut for this yard but bounced back to win a Tramore maiden hurdle; respected on handicap debut.

runners.name: Jhentong Enki
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras D'Enki
runners.comment: Showed ability in a bumper and three maiden hurdles; market can guide after a year away
runners.spotlight: Impressive point winner in 2023 but only four runs since, though showing ability in a bumper and three maiden hurdles; the market can guide after a year away.

runners.name: Malbay Madness
runners.comment: Raised 7lb for C&D win last time but he won snugly so has to be on the shortlist again
runners.spotlight: Dual Flat winner didn't really go on over hurdles but got off the mark over C&D last time; raised 7lb but he won snugly so has to be on the shortlist again.

quotes.race: Ireland West Airport Knock Handicap
quotes.quote: Malbay Madness is probably a hardy little horse. He was full of life going to the start and I'm sure they will have plenty of fun with him - Colin Keane, rider.

runners.name: W B Easy
runners.comment: Soundly beaten in three maiden hurdles; can't be ruled out on handicap debut; check market
runners.spotlight: A fine run on debut in a valuable sales bumper last year but hasn't progressed from that; soundly beaten in three maiden hurdles but can't be ruled out on handicap debut; hood worn last time is removed; check market.

runners.name: Gordons Aura
runners.comment: Was poor in testing ground on return; this suits better but others preferred
runners.spotlight: Record of 1-19 over hurdles; regressive in the last year and was poor in testing ground on return; this suits better but others preferred.

quotes.race: Bulmers Bundle For Easter Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Gordons Aura took a bit of a look in front but once he was joined he put his head down and battled. It wasn't easy but it worked out well - Jordan Gainford, rider.

runners.name: Bannow Blaze
runners.comment: Hint of ability in three maiden hurdles; market can reveal expectations on  handicap bow
runners.spotlight: Has shown a hint of ability in three maiden hurdles; handicap bow after a break and the market can reveal expectations.

runners.name: Kaptain Bay
runners.comment: Got off the mark over hurdles in a Bellewstown maiden; goes well on good ground; respected
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark over hurdles in a Bellewstown maiden last time; that wasn't a strong race but he goes well on good ground so has to be respected.

runners.name: Lynchy Boy
runners.comment: Beaten 12l as 4/1 fav' behind Malbay Madness in a C&D handicap last time; can get closer
runners.spotlight: Yet to win but was placed in two maiden hurdles at this track last year; beaten 12l as 4/1 fav' behind Malbay Madness in a C&D handicap last time; could get closer today.

runners.name: Godblessyourosie
runners.comment: Below best on debut for this yard after a break; one to consider if strong in the market
runners.spotlight: Some decent maiden hurdle runs in defeat for Henry de Bromhead last year but was below that level on debut for this yard after a break; still one to consider if strong in the market on h'cap debut; tongue-tie added.

runners.name: Theophilos
runners.comment: Well beaten in three completed maiden hurdles; worth a market check on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Some decent Flat runs lately, though below form on soft last time; well beaten in three completed maiden hurdles, albeit strong races; worth a market check on handicap debut.

runners.name: Yarraman Makarrata
runners.owner: Mrs Sheila Oryan & R Bannerman & S Salter
runners.comment: Makes handicap debut after an absence and the market can reveal what expectations are
runners.spotlight: Showed a hint of ability in three maiden hurdles behind quality winners; makes handicap debut after an absence and the market can reveal what expectations are.

runners.name: Only One Plan
runners.comment: Well beaten on chasing debut when last seen; has to be at best for a new trainer; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; has a record of 2-24 over hurdles and placed six times for former yard; well beaten on chasing debut when last seen and will have to be at his best for a new trainer.

runners.name: Hobart
runners.comment: Glimpse of ability in three maiden hurdles; poor on Flat last time; best watched; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; has shown a glimpse of ability in three maiden hurdles; was poor over 1m in a Flat maiden last time; best watched for now.

runners.name: Brave Soldier
runners.comment: Was beaten 16l over C&D on handicap debut and has to do plenty better; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; a glimpse of promise in maidens; was beaten 16l over C&D on handicap debut and has to do plenty better.

6:00.race_name: Follow Kilbeggan On Instagram Maiden Hurdle
6:00.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to yielding in places; watered)

runners.name: Rapparee Champ
runners.comment: Fell early at Punchestown in November, form of his Limerick second gives him a big chance
runners.spotlight: Flat winner (1m4f, good) for Joseph O'Brien; placed in three of his four completed starts over hurdles; has a claim as the form horse on his second to subsequent Grade 2 winner Mr Percy at Limerick in October; fell early at Punchestown in November and absent since; strong chance.

runners.name: Drop The Dip
runners.comment: Three-time Flat winner including twice at Listowel, valid excuse at that venue last autumn
runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner, including twice at Listowel; had a valid excuse at that venue last autumn when found to be clinically abnormal; no hurdling experience.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Handicap
quotes.quote: Drop The Dip is as solid as a rock - she's very strong and has been running well all season. She handles good ground well and the only question mark going to Listowel last week was whether she would handle softer ground. After she did, we figured it wouldn't be a problem today, so she's very versatile. You would think she was semi-idling, but she was tough and Gavin (Ryan) said she had to be - Thomas Gibney, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Costacurta
runners.comment: Solid debut when runner-up to an odds-on chance at Naas, one of the leading candidates
runners.spotlight: Brother to useful hurdler/winning chaser Latino Fling (winner of eight races), closely related to hurdle/chase winner Barbaha Queen; made a bright start to his career when runner-up to a Willie Mullins-trained odds-on chance at Naas in January; longer trip and different ground now; one of the leading candidates

runners.name: Couldntmakeitup
runners.comment: Improved a little with each of his three hurdle starts late last year, could be in the mix
runners.spotlight: Improved a little with each of his three hurdle starts late last year; went very close at Naas in December; could be in the mix with further progress.

runners.name: Easy Doyen
runners.comment: Well beaten in a bumper and two completed hurdle starts, unlikely to feature
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in a bumper and two completed hurdle starts; unlikely to feature.

runners.name: Kasanovas Dream
runners.breeder: M Julien Lebrun & M Anthony Pierre Yves Lebrun
runners.comment: Stayed on for third over 2m at Tramore, this trip should help his cause, strong contender
runners.spotlight: Cost E60,000 at Derby Sale in 2023; staying-on third on debut over 2m at Tramore suggests he wants a stiffer test and he gets it here; definite chance.

runners.name: Mavetherave
runners.comment: Not beaten far in sixth in a bumper at Perth last month, considerable improvement needed
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far in sixth in a bumper at Perth last month, considerable improvement needed.

runners.name: Tamberian
runners.comment: 33-1 when completely tailed off first time out in a bumper at Fairyhouse last month
runners.spotlight: 33-1 when completely tailed off first time out in a bumper at Fairyhouse last month.

runners.name: Damoso
runners.comment: Half-brother to six winners, including smart hurdler Cockney Sparrow, trainer runs three
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to six winners, including smart hurdler Cockney Sparrow, winner of the 2014 Scottish Champion Hurdle; trainer runs three, the other two are hard to fancy.

runners.name: Dontgowithjoe
runners.comment: Only four finishers in the Clonmel maiden in which he was a moderate third, up against it
