runners.spotlight: Showed some ability in three AW maidens; tailed off on hurdling debut; only four finishers in the Clonmel maiden in which he was a moderate third; up against it.

runners.name: Lucky This Time
runners.comment: Pulled up on debut, last of 17 on second attempt, can be left out of calculations
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on debut, last of 17 on second attempt; can be left out of calculations.

runners.name: Screaming Eagle
runners.comment: 73-rated Flat maiden, placed on AW in Britain, down the field at Cork on hurdling debut
runners.spotlight: A 73-rated Flat maiden; best form was for Andrew Balding when placed on AW; 42,000gns buy last autumn; 20-1, down the field at Cork on stable/hurdling debut.

runners.name: Shaboozee
runners.comment: Bellewstown fourth was a small step in the right direction, decent pedigree, may improve
runners.spotlight: Bellewstown fourth was a small step in the right direction; decent pedigree; may improve, needs to.

runners.name: La Gordita
runners.comment: Newcomer by Yeats, closely related to bumper/hurdle winner St Cuthbert's Cave
runners.spotlight: Newcomer by Yeats; closely related to bumper/hurdle winner St Cuthbert's Cave.

runners.name: Mystic Milly
runners.comment: Tailed off at Tramore, made mistakes and pulled up at Fairyhouse, no appeal
runners.spotlight: Tailed off at Tramore; made mistakes and pulled up at Fairyhouse; no appeal.

runners.name: Princess Georgie
runners.comment: Remote second in a point, carried out on latest, dam was effective over staying trips
runners.spotlight: Remote second in a point, carried out on latest; dam was effective over staying trips, winning twice for Denis Hogan.

runners.name: Accustomed
runners.comment: First reserve, 10l point winner in March, dam Solita won seven races for Paul Nolan
runners.spotlight: 10l point winner at Castlelands in March; dam Solita won seven races for Paul Nolan; stable had a Flat handicap winner at Roscommon on Monday; positive jockey booking; first reserve.

runners.name: Ardeen Joy
runners.comment: Second reserve, half-sister to three French winners, yard's Kasanova's Dream has had a run
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to three French winners, yard's guaranteed runner Kasanova's Dream has had a run; second reserve.

runners.name: Mickey Cohen
runners.comment: Third reserve, ordinary form on the Flat, mild promise when third in first handicap hurdle
runners.spotlight: Ordinary form on the Flat; mild promise when third in first handicap hurdle, a seven-runner contest at Down Royal a month ago; third reserve.

6:30.race_name: Winning Post Service Station Handicap Hurdle
6:30.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to yielding in places; watered)

runners.name: Dartan
runners.comment: Solid eighth at Aintree festival and capable of getting involved
runners.spotlight: Solid eighth of 17 in premier handicap hurdle at Aintree festival last month; less encouraging last time when well beaten in beginners' chase; last win came in 2023 but capable of getting involved here.

quotes.race: DMG Media Irish EBF Handicap
quotes.quote: Dartan had some good form last year, but had a bit of a setback so we let him off for the rest of the summer. I had faith in him and knew he was good enough to win. I told Declan to make plenty of use of him and he gave him a great ride. He stays well and he is a nice horse - Matt Smith, trainer.

quotes.race: SP Or Better Guaranteed With Tote Handicap
quotes.quote: Declan (McDonogh, rider) said this was as short as you would want to be going with Dartan. He was only getting going in the last 100 yards and Declan liked him. He has a great attitude, just switches off and relaxes. He can be a bit slowly away so probably two miles would suit him and he can just take his time. Declan thinks he would be good enough for some of those better staying handicaps - Matthew Smith, trainer.

runners.name: Plains Indian
runners.comment: Stayed on well last time on the flat and remains open to progress
runners.spotlight: Ran on well from an unpromising position to finish fourth last time out on the Flat; up 9lb from handicap hurdle win in November (3m, good); could still have more to offer in this sphere.

quotes.race: Clonmel Oil Service Station Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I suppose Plains Indian was the class horse in the race being a Listed winner and I know he has been disappointing but the ground was too soft for him all year - Willie Slattery, stable representative.

quotes.race: Dunraven Arms Hotel Novice Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Even though his dam is a half-sister to Death Duty I was worried about his stamina because he had been free. I left riding instructions up to Danny and he said there was a good enough pace and Plains Indian settled well. He was off for two years but is back now. I was planning to go for a big handicap at Leopardstown but that's probably gone - Andy Slattery, trainer.

quotes.race: McHale Pro Glide Hurdle
quotes.quote: Plains Indian is an impressive horse and hopefully there is a bit of improvement to come yet. I knew going down to the last I was cantering everywhere so once we got over it he hit the ground running - Cian Quirke, jockey.

quotes.race: Fourmilewater Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Plains Indian had a good confidence booster there and he's a fair horse. As long as the ground isn't too quick he'll probably stay going - Andy Slattery, trainer.

runners.name: Yeats Star
runners.comment: Has potential to play a part if returning to the form of his third at the DRF last year
runners.spotlight: Won a beginners' chase before falling at Cheltenham when beaten in October; finished third of 21 runners in valuable Leopardstown handicap hurdle in 2024 and lightly raced over hurdles since then; unseated at the third in Punchestown handicap when last seen; has the potential to play a part.

stable_tour.quote: Took a tired fall at Cheltenham on Saturday, but hopefully he'll be none the worse for that. He was very good at Listowel the time before and had taken well to fences. We'll aim to get his confidence back now. 28-10-24

runners.name: Shadow Rider
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De L'Hotellerie
runners.comment: May want it softer but cannot be totally ruled out
runners.spotlight: 11yo runner whose last win came in a handicap chase last year (2m4f, yielding); beaten 29l when last seen; may want it softer but cannot be totally ruled out.

quotes.race: Tommy Carberry Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Shadow Rider is a lovely horse, but he's fragile. We train him out of the pool a bit. He's a bit inconsistent, but he did it well today - Padraig Roche, trainer.

quotes.race: Eden Capital Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Shadow Rider is a good horse and the form of his last run was well-franked. He won easily enough and we would have been disappointed if he hadn't - Mark Walsh, rider

stable_tour.quote: He won a point-to-point nicely at Knockanard. I'd say we'll skip bumpers and go straight for a maiden hurdle. Colin Bowe liked him and he could make his mark over hurdles. 09-11-20

runners.name: Slane Hill
runners.comment: Handicap hurdle winner in November who has run respectably the last twice,  he is a player
runners.spotlight: Won handicap hurdle by 9l in November; 10lb higher now; respectable efforts the last twice when finishing fifth and third; he is a player.

quotes.race: Lisadell Equine Hospital Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Slane Hill had lost his confidence over fences. He didn't get home at Punchestown last time so we just decided to stick a pair of blinkers on him. They sharpened him up. He has plenty of ability but he's a little bit of a thinker - Barry Connell, trainer.

quotes.race: Thank You Paul Quish Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Slane Hill is not going to be top drawer and this was an ideal race for him. He was a bit babyish at the end but he stuck at it well. He's a big, tall horse and we won't wait too long before going chasing - Barry Connell, trainer.

runners.name: Final Orders
runners.comment: Showed signs of life in Ulster National; runs from 18lb lower hurdle mark
runners.spotlight: Five-time chase winner; disappointing last year but showed signs of life when 1/2l second in the Ulster National; has pulled-up and finished third over the banks at Punchestown since that effort; runs from 18lb lower hurdle mark here.

quotes.race: Prizm Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Final Orders had a break since the jumps season and that was a nice pipe-opener for Galway. I thought he might be vulnerable over the trip but he did it well. He'll go for the Galway Plate - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

quotes.race: Paddy Power Cheltenham Fanzone Handicap Chase (Registered As The Sandyford Handicap Chase) (Grade B)
quotes.quote: Final Orders has massive scope, they are big fences around here but he just has so much scope. He loves it and is just thriving off it. He was off 140 there today and he's only 102 over hurdles so it's been a massive transformation - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: "Bet Through The Free Racing Post App" Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Final Orders has been a revelation since he went chasing. He's only a small horse but loves jumping. He needs every yard of three miles over hurdles and but his jumping is so good over fences that he can operate at this trip. The Dan Moore Handicap Chase could be a race we might look at for him - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

quotes.race: Start Your Free Trial Now At racingtv.com Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Final Orders is just so good and quick to jump. He wasn't in love with that ground, he might sneak into a good handicap off a low weight - Gacvin Cromwell, trainer

quotes.race: Follow Us On Social Media Rated Novice Chase
quotes.quote: I wanted to make use of Final Orders because he stays well. I left him bowl away, used his jumping and he jumped well on the whole - they're probably the biggest fences he's jumped but he has loads of scope. The ground looks worse than it is and I wouldn't call it soft, it's only yielding - Keith Donoghue, rider.

quotes.race: tote Guarantee On All Irish & UK Races Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Final Orders jumped really well for his second run over fences, exceptionally good. He's really suited to the summer tracks. It wasn't a strong race - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Reddans Of Bettystown Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Final Orders tends to hit a flat spot in his races but he stuck at it very well here. We might look for something at Listowel or he could go back on the Flat - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had a busy enough summer so we let him off on a break but we'll probably bring him back in shortly. 12-11-24
He had a busy summer, so we let him off on a break and we'll probably bring him back in shortly. 13-11-24

runners.name: Run For Harry
runners.comment: Steps up to 3m for first time, more needed
runners.spotlight: Beaten 21l last time at Punchestown (2m1f, yielding); steps up to 3m for first time; more needed.

runners.name: Saint Le Fort
runners.breeder: S A R L Jedburgh Stud
runners.comment: The first-time tongue tie and trip could bring out the best of him on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Not disgraced when running against quality opposition last time at Punchestown; prior to that was a game winner of a Cork maiden hurdle (2m4f, good); the first-time tongue tie and trip could bring out the best of him on his handicap debut.

runners.name: Whatsavailable
runners.comment: Has shown erratic form but could get in the mix if on song
runners.spotlight: Has shown erratic form since winning handicap hurdle in November (3m, good); well beaten 15th of 25 when last seen in February but prior to that run he kept on strongly to finish second in a Pertemps qualifier at Leopardstown; could get in the mix if on song.

quotes.race: Kevin Sheedy Bowel Cancer Raceday 17th December Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Whatsavailable will make a lovely chaser. The tongue tie worked well with him - Mouse Morris, trainer.

quotes.race: Mongey Communications Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Whatsavailable never runs a bad race, and he'll make some chaser next season - he gave the last about a foot. He had a bit of experience and you can't beat that - Mouse Morris, trainer

runners.name: Walking On Glass
runners.comment: Last win came on the Flat last August, runs off 2lb lower mark than last hurdle win
runners.spotlight: 10yo has won eight races under all codes; finished a well-beaten seventh on return from a layoff last month; showed he still has the fire burning when winning on the Flat last August; runs off 2lb lower mark than last handicap hurdle win.

quotes.race: Good Enuf 2 Eat Caterers At Gowran Park Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Walking On Glass is a right little horse, he's tough and he's honest. That's his seventh win and I'm delighted with him. He's in good order and as long as the ground is good we'll run away - Padraig Roche, trainer.

quotes.race: Oristown Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Walking On Glass is a right little horse. Since he won here last year, he's run 12 times and only been out of the first four on three of them. I think he's after improving since last year. He's tiny but he tries his heart out. He'l mix it for the summer - Padraig Roche, trainer

quotes.race: BetVictor Guaranteed Run For Your Money Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Walking On Glass won well. Tramore didn't take anything out of him. He might go for a syndicates only handicap at Bellewstown next week - Padraig Roche, trainer.

quotes.race: Troytown Bar Handicap
quotes.quote: He hasn't showed a lot in maidens but Padraig [Roche] does a good job and the step up in trip did him the world of good. The ease in the ground helped him as well. Where he goes from here is up to Padraig but he's a grand, small fun horse. He gave the boys their day out, which is what they wanted, and anything after that is a bonus. They'll enjoy him anyway whatever they get out of him - Gary Halpin, rider

runners.name: Artic Lane
runners.comment: Dropped 2lb for lesser effort on latest start, trip and ground may aid his chance
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle win came on good ground over two miles back in November but has won a point-to-point; effectively brought down at the first on penultimate novice hurdle start when sent off at 7-1 (3m1f, good); dropped 2lb for lesser effort latest when finishing a well beaten seventh; trip and ground may aid his chance.

runners.name: Redstone
runners.owner: Thomas Cox & Ralph Kelly & H Rogers
runners.comment: Change of stable has not sparked a return to form in two runs, tongue-tie now goes on
runners.spotlight: Beat the now 143-rated King Of Kingsfield in a maiden hurdle in 2023; didn't progress for Gavin Cromwell; change of stable has not sparked a return to form in two runs thus far; tongue-tie now goes on.

quotes.race: 2nd To The SP Favourite At Novibet (C & G) Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I've always liked Redstone and he's going to be a very nice horse in time ? he's big too. It was nice to do that today and you wouldn't have thought the inside track here would be the ideal place for him as he's a big horse. He's not slow and travelled well but you could certainly see him going up in trip. You probably won't see the best of him until he goes over fences - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice horse who goes well at home. He made a winning start at Fairyhouse last month when he beat an odds-on favourite. We'll step him up in grade now and he'll probably go to Navan for the For Auction Hurdle or the Monksfield, depending on the ground. 10-11-23

runners.name: Armed And Fabulous

prev_owners.owner: Ms Margaret Mullins & Ms Marie Mara

runners.comment: Weakened at the finish on handicap debut at Ayr last month, cheek-pieces now employed
runners.spotlight: Failed to get home when sent off at 5-1 on handicap debut at Ayr last month (3m1f, gd-sft); jumped to her left on that occasion; before that, returned from a mammoth layoff to win a mares' maiden hurdle at Newcastle in February (2m1f, gd-sft); stamina in her pedigree suggests she's worth another try at this trip; cheek-pieces are now employed.

quotes.race: Shaklan Dubai Equine Products UK Mares' Maiden Hurdle (Herring Queen Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought maybe it was a little fresher ground on the outside but up the home straight the horse in front was jumping to his right so I had to switch to challenge on the inside, which wasn't ideal. Armed And Fabulous had an injury since her last run and had been off for a long time but we had her pretty ready and she was tough - Patrick Mullins, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Ad Caelum
runners.comment: 2lbs out of handicap, is 15lbs higher than last handicap win six runs ago
runners.spotlight: Runs from 2lbs out of the handicap; won a 2m3f novice and a 2m4f handicap last season; has run consistently without ever challenging since then; is 15lbs higher than last handicap win six runs ago.

quotes.race: Racing Again December 21st Mares Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: The rain really helped Ad Caelum and she's an exciting mare for the future. Sean really fancied her and I was a bit concerned as she likes to get her toe in, but the ground has gone yielding which helped. She'll need soft ground and should be progressive in handicaps, or she could go to a rated novice hurdle - John Ryan, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

7:05.race_name: Cooke's Bar And Restaurant Caragh Beginners Chase
7:05.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to yielding in places; watered)

runners.name: Ballybrittas
runners.comment: Beaten favourite at Clonmel, return to a longer trip could make all the difference here
runners.spotlight: Won two point-to-points for Caroline McCaldin last season; winner of a maiden hurdle on good ground at Limerick in October on his second attempt; made a bright start to chasing career when second to Spinning Web at Thurles, with Beggars Rock third; return to a longer trip could make all the difference after Clonmel defeat over extended 2m.

runners.name: Be Positive
runners.comment: Needs to jump a lot better than when a remote fourth at Down Royal early this month
runners.spotlight: Is 0-4 over hurdles and rated 95; needs to jump a lot better than when a remote fourth on chasing debut at Down Royal early this month.

runners.name: Beggars Rock
runners.comment: Winning hurdler, placed on all three chase starts, has a bit to find with Ballybrittas
runners.spotlight: Ex-pointer, winning hurdler, placed on all three chase starts; has a bit to find with Ballybrittas on Thurles running but has a definite chance of reaching the money.

quotes.race: D Pack Packaging Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Beggars Rock had a couple of good runs but was getting frustrating. He jumped and travelled today, they stopped and he galloped to the line well - Kevin Sexton, rider.

runners.name: Next Stop Paris
runners.comment: Winning favourite in a handicap hurdle at Cork last week, trip and ground should suit
runners.spotlight: Respectable form in maiden hurdles; fell when favourite on handicap debut at Fairyhouse; beaten 40l next time at Clonmel; raced keenly when third at Bellewstown; winning favourite at Cork last week; trip and ground should suit for this switch to chasing.

runners.name: Ollie La Ba Ba
runners.comment: Maiden hurdle winner over 2m6f on good ground, has some potential as a summer chaser
runners.spotlight: Won 2m6f Downpatrick maiden hurdle last July on good ground; not the most consistent sort but has some potential as a summer chaser.

runners.name: On Lovers Walk
runners.comment: Two wins in points, has taken to chasing reasonably well, just behind Ballybrittas latest
runners.spotlight: Dual points winner is a maiden under rules; touched off in 2m4f Down Royal beginners' contest at Christmas; has failed to make  much progress since then but just behind Ballybrittas over a shorter trip at Clonmel on latest.

runners.name: Solly Attwell
runners.comment: Sole hurdles win was gained over 3m, no show after an early mistake on chasing debut
runners.spotlight: Placed in four of his six starts in points; fair handicap hurdle form (3m winner at Tipperary a year ago); made no show after an early mistake on chasing debut at this venue three weeks ago.

runners.name: Standing Orders
runners.comment: Showed next to nothing in three maiden hurdle outings, tongue-tie on for chase debut
runners.spotlight: Showed next to nothing in three maiden hurdle outings; tongue-tie on for chase debut.

runners.name: Starzov
runners.comment: A long time since he showed his best form over hurdles, lacks chasing experience
runners.spotlight: A long time since he showed his best form over hurdles; lacks chasing experience; trainer has a much more obvious chance with Ballybrittas.

quotes.race: McCarthy Plant & Agri Sales Rated Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Starzov possibly wants better ground and a bit further. With it being soft today, we said we'd go back to two miles and try to outstay them - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

runners.name: Vale Of Glory
runners.comment: Two wins over hurdles, should be better for a recent run, makes chasing debut now at ten
runners.spotlight: Two wins over hurdles, should be better for a recent run; makes chasing debut now at ten and is probably vulnerable.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Vale Of Glory had been promising all the time and today was his day. The ground was perfect and we were a little worried about stepping back up to 2m4f, but the race went nicely for him so we're very happy - Adrian Murray, trainer.

runners.name: Born Bright
runners.comment: Stayed well when winning a 2m6f handicap hurdle at Thurles three starts ago, chase debut
runners.spotlight: Point winner; stayed well when winning a 2m6f handicap hurdle at Thurles three starts ago; makes chase debut; others have better recent claims.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: That's fantastic and I'm delighted with Born Bright. She won a point-to-point and my son got to ride her in a few bumpers but she wants good ground and it went soft in Sligo and Listowel. This was a race that really suited and it was local. She'll run away over hurdles now - Claire O'Connell, trainer.

runners.name: Hardy Diamond
runners.comment: Course maiden hurdle winner last July, good first chase run, jumped badly second attempt
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in a point-to-point; winner of a 2m3f maiden hurdle at this venue on rules debut; failed to match that form on her next three starts; made a satisfactory start to her chasing career when third at Downpatrick; jumped badly at Gowran on second attempt.

runners.name: Nastya
runners.comment: Point winner, solid placed form before runaway maiden hurdle win at Down Royal, big chance
runners.spotlight: Point winner, solid placed form (including behind high-class stablemate Air Of Entitlement) before runaway maiden hurdle win at Down Royal; big chance if that translates to something similar on chase debut.

runners.name: Lakota Blue
runners.comment: Disappointed in a claiming hurdle last time, potentially interesting with weight allowance
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner; 0-9 over hurdles and rated 102; best efforts on soft and heavy ground; disappointed in a claiming hurdle last time; potentially interesting with weight allowance.

runners.name: Boston Rover
runners.comment: First reserve, 0-5 over hurdles, handicap form good enough to suggest he could feature
runners.spotlight: 0-5 over hurdles; handicap form good enough to suggest he could feature if he takes to chasing effectively; first reserve.

runners.name: Ahead Of The Posse
runners.comment: Second reserve, has useful chase experience, should be better for a hurdles run last month
runners.spotlight: Has useful chase experience; should be better for a hurdles run last month, his first outing since last August; second reserve.

runners.name: Presenting Max
runners.comment: Third reserve, recent third in a handicap at this venue was an encouraging display
runners.spotlight: Recent third in a handicap at this venue was an encouraging display; third reserve.

7:40.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to yielding in places; watered)

runners.name: Aeros Luck
runners.comment: Respectable efforts in three novice chases (fell on debut) incl' at Tipperary last week
runners.spotlight: Listowel maiden hurdle winner in 2023 and some decent efforts in defeat since; respectable efforts in three novice chases (fell on debut) including at Tipperary last week; considered on handicap bow.

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Maiden Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Aeros Luck deserved that. He was very keen last day but he settled much better today. He's learning still. I would say he'll go on any ground but he is just a horse that can be hard on himself - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He finished second in three maiden hurdles before finally getting off the mark at Listowel in September. He received a high handicap mark after that, so he's gone on a break and we'll aim him at the spring. 10-11-23

runners.name: Good As Hell
runners.comment: C&D winner last autumn; not at her best in four starts since and unseated last time
runners.spotlight: The last of her six chase wins came over C&D last September off this mark; hasn't been at that level in four starts since; made a mistake and unseated at Tipperary three out last week; needs a return to best.

quotes.race: Tipperary Town Plate Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Good As Hell was able to dictate and got a good ride from Niall. She needed a good jump at the last and nearly gave it away but she got back on an even keel. She will hopefully make a good broodmare down the line - Philip Fenton, trainer.

quotes.race: Tipperary Town Plate Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Good As Hell is a great servant and hopefully can progress. We're only learning about her best trip. She'll have a little break now and hopefully will turn up in Listowel - Philp Fenton, trainer.

quotes.race: Tipperary Racecourse Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: She just does enough but Good As Hell is a serious mare to jump, she's always making ground at her fences. She's a nice mare to have and I'm sure there will be more fun to be had with over the summer - Niall Moore, jockey, talking to Racing TV

quotes.race: Tipperary Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Good As Hell might hold her own in this company and she will have one more run as she has been on the go for a while - Philip Fenton, trainer.

runners.name: Rainbow Trail
runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Des Loges
runners.comment: Third in a Grade 2 novice but poor twice since; chance if at his best after a break
runners.spotlight: Bumper and maiden hurdle winner got off the mark over fences at Gowran last autumn over this trip; third in a 3m Punchestown Grade 2 novice after but poor twice since; chance if at his best after a break.

quotes.race: Mongey Communications Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: We probably won't do much more with Rainbow Trail now and he'll head over fences next season. He's honest, he jumps and he stays - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: It was a shame to see him come down at Punchestown in that Grade 3 novice chase and it would have been interesting to see how he got on. He already looks like he's going to be a better chaser than hurdler and two and a half miles looks his trip. 28-10-24

runners.name: The Dasher Conway
runners.comment: Won this last year; poor on last three starts so has to bounce back in a major way
runners.spotlight: Two hurdle and two chase wins, the last of those coming in this race last year off 2lb lower; several fine runs after but has been poor on last three starts so has to bounce back in a major way.

quotes.race: Tramore Tourism Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The Dasher Conway put the race to bed with his jumping, he was very good everywhere. If you jump and travel like that around here he was going to be difficult to get by - Donagh Meyler, rider

quotes.race: Follow @TipperaryRaces On Twitter Maiden Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: It's been a while since The Dasher Conway's last run and he's been improving all the time. He's a fabulous big horse. Hopefully there'll be more days with him and it's great to get this - Gillian O'Callaghan, trainer.

runners.name: Marv Michael
runners.comment: C&D winner last year was below form next time; has a chance if ready after a break
runners.spotlight: Point winner won a Tramore maiden hurdle last August and took a C&D beginners' chase the following month on chasing debut; weakening when badly hampered at Cheltenham next time; chance if ready after a break.

quotes.race: Follow Kilbeggan On Instagram Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Marv Michael schooled super at home and he's always been a very good jumper. Even in his runs over hurdles we were hoping that chasing would bring a bit of improvement and hopefully that's the case - Robbie Power, stable representative.

quotes.race: Tramore Amusements Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Marv Michael is really improving and I'd say the cheekpieces helped him. He seemed in mighty form coming here and we were happy with him. He was beaten by what is probably a nice horse at Wexford and he was unlucky not to win at Down Royal last year, so he has good form - Henry de Bromhead, trainer

runners.name: Lake Chad
runners.comment: Won at Thurles in February off 3lb lower; below that form twice since so has to rebound
runners.spotlight: Won his fourth chase when scoring at Thurles in February off 3lb lower; has been below that form twice since so has to bounce back.

quotes.race: Racing Again February 20th Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Lake Chad winged the third last and I didn't want to disappoint him and I kept him rolling. He knows his job and he is some servant. He just sees out his races and he was always doing enough to win - Niall Moore, rider

quotes.race: McCarthy's Irish Bar Lexington Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Lake Chad is better around here than anywhere else. He has won here before and has always run a good race here. He ran terrible the last day and I don't know why he ran so poor. The ground was soft in Roscommon that day. It was a big improvement today - Philip Fenton, trainer.

quotes.race: Waterford Chamber Of Commerce Beginners' Chase
quotes.quote: Lake Chad will maybe get a little break now and come back here for the August meeting - Philip Fenton, trainer.

runners.name: Hand Over Fist
runners.breeder: E A R L Guittet Desbois
runners.comment: Might not have stayed 3m4f when last seen; seems to be the yard second-string on comeback
runners.spotlight: Won twice over fences last autumn including over 3m1f at this track; might not have stayed 3m4f in the Cork National next time; seems to be the yard second-string on comeback.

quotes.race: Paul Byron Shoes Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Hand Over Fist was very good today, put the head down, galloped and saw the trip out well. He's a forward-going horse and seems to enjoy himself out front. Hopefully there is a bit more improvement in him - Mike O'Connor, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: We will aim Hand Over Fist for another handicap at a similar trip - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

runners.name: Bocellis Voice
runners.comment: Below form on last three starts and has to return to best on second run back after a break
runners.spotlight: Hurdle and chase winner has run well in defeat at this track; below form on last three starts and has to return to best on second run back after a break.

runners.name: General Clermont
runners.breeder: S C E A Elevage De Clermont
runners.comment: Runner-up both starts this year off this mark in a lower grade; has to find a bit more
runners.spotlight: Won twice over fences last year and has run some solid races in defeat since; runner-up both starts this year off this mark in a lower grade; has to find a bit more today but shouldn't be far away.

runners.name: Prince Zaltar
runners.comment: Below form at Leopardstown last time; needs to jump better and return to his best
runners.spotlight: Three-time hurdle winner has run well in defeat in three of his five chase starts, though a Leopardstown handicap last time wasn't one of them; needs to jump better and return to his best.

quotes.race: Navan Racecourse Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Prince Zaltar won at Tramore last year and I thought we were on an upwards curve but anything that could have gone wrong did go wrong. But I thought he ran a cracker at Fairyhouse last day and I couldn't see him out of the four today - Philip Rothwell, trainer

quotes.race: Family Fun Day July 3rd Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Prince Zaltar was very disappointing the last day on heavy ground at Clonmel. He really struggled on it. He jumped better and travelled better on that ground - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

runners.name: Miss Oreo
runners.comment: Unseated at the last behind a smart sort at Down Royal last time; needs more
runners.spotlight: Hurdle winner has run creditably in defeat at times, including when unseating at the last behind a smart sort at Down Royal last time; needs more but not ruled out on handicap debut.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Shane gave Miss Oreo a great ride. She's free and I told him to try and save a bit so that you'll be able to give her a breather at some stage. Her jumping was unreal. She won a point-to-point and any of them that win a point-to-point can jump. Shane has done a lot of work with her at home because she's not an easy ride, so fair play to him - Shark Hanlon, trainer.

8:15.race_name: Racing Again June 1st (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
8:15.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to yielding in places; watered)

runners.name: Brownes Cross
runners.comment: Fifth foal, half-brother to handicap hurdle winner Cosmo Renfro, good 7lb claimer
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; half-brother to handicap hurdle winner Cosmo Renfro; good 7lb claimer

runners.name: Minella Emperor
runners.comment: Ordinary points form, caught the eye with staying-on fourth behind a stablemate at Cork
runners.spotlight: Three uneventful runs in point-to-points before fetching just 3,500GBP last December; shaped quite promisingly when keeping on for fourth behind well-fancied stablemate Clay Pigeons on bumper debut at Cork last month; rider (owner) 0-10 in bumpers, fair prospects of a breakthrough here.

runners.name: South Of Killerig
runners.comment: Two hurdle runs last August much better than Listowel bumper run, useful 7lb claimed now
runners.spotlight: Two fourth placings over hurdles last August indicated winning potential; failed to match that form in a Listowel festival bumper, soft ground may not have been ideal; experienced conditional claims a useful 7lb.

runners.name: Take Chance
runners.comment: Beaten almost 30l when sixth at Clonmel in March so needs to find plenty of improvement
runners.spotlight: Remote second in Tinahely maiden point last October; left an impression this longer trip might suit when keeping on for sixth in a 2m bumper at Clonmel in March; beaten almost 30l, so needs to find plenty of improvement.

runners.name: Le Roi Du Livet
runners.breeder: S A S Elevage Du Livet
runners.comment: Brother to a versatile French winner, trainer capable of having one ready first time
runners.spotlight: Second foal; brother to a French Flat.hurdle/chase winner Klothilde Du Matin; dam unraced; trainer capable of having one ready first time.

runners.name: Stede Bonnet
runners.comment: E75,000 Goffs Arkle purchase last year; dam has a solid record at stud
runners.spotlight: E75,000 Goffs Arkle purchase last year; 12th foal; brother to two winners, notably the stable's four-time scorer Shannon Royale, half-brother to five winners, including three useful performers by King's Theatre (Minella Foru, Sumkindofking and Penny Jane) dam bumper winner for Charlie Swan whose son Harry rides here for Gordon Elliott.

runners.name: Crohan Lady
runners.comment: Fine effort at 66-1 on bumper debut at Cork last month, failed to improve at Tipperary
runners.spotlight: Mixed form in points; Ballycrystal winner last December; ran a fine race when 66-1 third behind mares from the De Bromhead and Elliott stables on bumper debut at Cork last month; failed to improve on that when sixth in a 2m2f contest at Tipperary last week.

runners.name: Maranoa Charlie
runners.breeder: Haras D'Etreham, Riviera Equine Sarl & Gestut Zur Kuste Ag
runners.owner: Peter Maher, Carl Fitzgerald & John Baxter

prev_owners.owner: Peter Maher, Carl Fitzgerald & John Baxter

runners.comment: Looked exciting as a 2yo and now goes sprinting follow return success; obvious chance
runners.spotlight: Showed clear signs of being well-above average as a 2yo over 7f and a mile but disappointing in a Group 1 on his final start as a juvenile; sprung back to life when winning the Group 3 7f Prix Djebel on his return to action when a hood was added (Woodshauna third) and interesting connections have decided to now go the sprinting route with him rather than go back up in trip; goes from the front and holds obvious claims.

quotes.race: Prix Djebel (Group 3) (3yo Colts & Geldings) (Straight Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I loved Maranoa Charlie's attitude at the end as he went again when the runner-up came to him and showed real fight. He already looked like a three-year-old last year but he has strengthened further over the winter. We'll have to discuss it with the owners but as well as the Poule [d'Essai des Poulains] there are several options. He could go sprinting or perhaps he might run in Britain. He seems to have plenty of gas and I think we'll look at races for him that place an accent on his speed. All options remain open at the moment - Cristopher Head, trainer.

quotes.race: Prix Thomas Bryon Jockey Club de Turquie (Group 3) (2yo) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I don't think I've ever trained a horse like Maranoa Charlie, one with his desire to run and who can take the others on like that. He gets better with every run and I don't know what his limits are. The plan is to go to the Criterium International and that was the perfect preparation - Christopher Head, trainer.

runners.name: Kullazain
runners.comment: Makes seasonal return in decent race; this is his first time past 5f
runners.spotlight: Ran three times as a 2yo and improved on every start, securing a maiden success (soft ground) on his second start before a fine third in the Group 3 Cornwallis Stakes as a 25-1 chance; holds a Group 1 entry and will handle the going if it's genuinely soft but this is his first start past 5f, so stamina to prove.

quotes.race: Madri Excepcional EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We liked Kullazain at the sales but he was a bit of a baby. He had sore shins and he was a bit behind so we've given him time, but we learnt a bit at Ripon and he was impressive here. He'll be better next year. He likes soft ground so I suppose we could think about something like the Cornwallis or a Listed race at Chantilly at the end of October - James Tate, trainer.

runners.name: Woodshauna
runners.comment: Was race-fit when beaten by Maranoa Charlie last time, albeit over 7f; more needed
runners.spotlight: Trainer continues in fine form but this son of Wooded will need to up his game a bit to reverse 7f Prix Djebel form with Maranoa Charlie, as he went in race-fit against that rival and was beaten 1.75l; place chance if progressing again.

runners.name: Jenilat Bright
runners.comment: Won over 6f on heavy on debut less than a month ago; much more needed to feature here
runners.spotlight: Won on debut over 6f in Milan on heavy ground less than a month ago but this is a significant hike in class for a second outing; others far easier to like for win purposes.

runners.name: Fraise Des Bois
runners.breeder: Mme C Vitse, Mme A Vitse Et Al
runners.comment: Capable of good form as a 2yo but 3yo return wasn't her best; needs improvement on that
runners.spotlight: Had some strong form as a 2yo at up to 7f and was Group 2 placed, but concluded that campaign with a third over this C&D in a Group 3, over a length behind Polyvega; wasn't at her best on her return to action in the Prix Imprudence (7f) in April but has the potential to come on for that outing.

runners.name: Profumo Di Iena
runners.comment: No doubting her current well-being but will need to find extra to be a part of this finish
runners.spotlight: Only a glimmer of ability on first two starts but has left that behind now, winning three on the spin, most recently a C&D conditions event a couple of weeks ago on good to soft; no doubting her current well-being but winning at this level will demand a lot more.

runners.name: Time For Sandals
runners.owner: D Bevan And Mrs D Bevan
runners.comment: Back sprinting after trying 7f about a month ago; claims if back to Lowther level of run
runners.spotlight: Won on debut (AW) and progressed nicely as a 2yo after, her neck second in the 6f Group 2 Lowther Stakes (good to firm) a really solid run; 14-1 when beaten over 4l behind the winner of the Dubai Duty Free Stakes on her opening start of this season when tested over 7f, so interesting connections now revert to sprinting; claims if back to York effort.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Lowther Stakes (Group 2) (Fillies) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted, it was a bit of a leap into the unknown. Time For Sandals travelled very sweetly and lack of experience probably cost her. We may have to look at black type races - Harry Eustace, trainer.

runners.name: Polyvega
runners.comment: Has tons of course experience and comes out on top of the figures; sound chance
runners.spotlight: Plenty of good form as a 2yo, including finishing ahead of Fraise Des Bois over C&D in September, but took her form to a new level on debut for this trainer when winning here over 5.5f in March; excuses can be made for her most recent start and she comes out top of the figures; one of the more likely types.
